Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise - Holiday Inn a better value than Marriott (this from a Gold member)”
Reviews.Author: Guyana1234
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to OC this summer. I stayed at the Courtyard with my kids and it was decent but overpriced (see my review). We saw the Suites and decided to stay there. We had to settle for the only room available on the highest floor but it was large, staff great and the outside pool adult sized. Brian the manager was nice enough to allow me an extra parking for a friend who spent the day. Did not use the restaurants but saw many there. Parking under the building was always overcrowded at night but plenty of nearby satellite parking and 1 block to Dunkin Donuts. Nice laundry rooms w/o extra charges. Definitely a place to re-visit again. I'm a Platinum Priority member and got bonus points

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine W
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 days in August. This was our 3rd time at this hotel. The location is great, right on the beach! They have a great kids pool with 2 water slides which my kids loved! They also had a magic show for the kids one evening. The front desk staff was friendly. Housekeeping definitely needs improvement. They were inconsistent and getting clean towels was like pulling teeth. With that being said we will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MommyDu
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong booking this hotel. First location, location, location! It is on the beach right in the middle of the Boardwalk. Second, 3 pools! The child pool is perfect for kids with 2 slides and they even have a jacuzzi for the parents. Plus there is an adult pool and an indoor pool where there is a bar/restaurant. Third, the rooms are very spacious and clean. Fourth the staff is very nice and professional. Fifth, the food is very good and reasonably priced. Sixth, the beds are so comfortable. Lastly, free parking and the hotel is updated. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst part of our trip was the hotel”
Reviews.Author: marissa g
Reviews.Content: Visited OC this past Labor Day Weekend and stayed at the Holiday inn and Suites. We stayed at the Hilton last year but thought it might be a little more convenient to stay on the boardwalk, so we chose the holiday. What a mistake! The room we were given was 311, it was clean for the most part aside from the cigarette ashes that covered our balcony table, however the room was just very dated from rust cover fridge to wallpaper tearing off the corner wall, crack in the shower tile. The decor was unimpressive and the room had an odor to it not exactly sure how to describe it, not terrible but not fresh. My family and I went out for a few hours hoping to come back to rest for a while assuming the room would have been made up by now, only to find out our room doesn't get done until 2:30 in the afternoon, that happened twice. The pool is nice, waitresses and lifeguards were great, but I strongly felt the wristband rule was not enforced. I don't think everyone at the pool was actually staying at the hotel, since some of the people were actually in there full clothes, in the pool! The coral reef restaurant food was good, but our waitress, must have been in a rush cause she gave us the check before we even got out entrees!! We had a little rain and decided to go to (what we thought) was a heated indoor pool, only to find out it was not...or at least the heat was not on. the waitress in the restaurant assured us it was but it was freezing! even the host at the desk said he would check on it but nothing was done. The pools outdoors were warmer! Every guest that came inside to use the pool complained about it. Needless to say this will be our last time at the Holiday inn and suites, for $400 a night same as Hilton, the Hilton is the way to go, even if we have to drive a few blocks!! I'm posting a few pics of what I'm talking about...

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Front at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: upstateNYMickey
Reviews.Content: We couldn't afford Oceanfront during the high peak season. We went in April with our 13 yr old Granddaughter.. Really liked the hotel. Although there is a risk of getting a little spray of water if you sit at one of the tables near the bar,on other side of pool seperated by lattice type fencing. In the summers months when really busy, i imagine it can be pretty noisy too. We enjoyed our stay, and look forward to a return trip. The hotel was well maintained and clean and comfortable. Liked the location....

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay in OCMD”
Reviews.Author: LisaD517
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient in terms of location but also the pools outside were perfect for a family. They have a water slide for kids which was great. The hotel room was very clean, spacious and what a view! The staff was ok, nothing disappointing but nothing outstanding. I would definitely go back here as we frequent OCMD often.

Reviews.Title: “NOT impressed.You're better off renting a condo for less!”
Reviews.Author: kellzz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 2 night stay more than a month in advance. Our only requests were to have a king size bed ( we have a toddler who sleeps in between us) , to be away from the elevators and to be on higher ground. Sounds simple for one of the largest hotels in Ocean City right? NOPE! Upon check-in we were given a room key to 108 which just so happens to be on the ground floor right next to the lobby and elevators. As we entered the room, we noticed that we had 2 full size beds instead of the king and also right in front of our balcony was the swimming pool. GREAT! My husband walks back out and talks to some guy at the front desk who could do nothing for us. FOR REAL??!!! We book 6 weeks in advance and paid close to $400 for this?! What could we do right? We drove 4 hours and were exhausted so we stuck with what they had. The noise from the pool area was not as bad as I thought it would be but things go downhill from here. When I went to clean the jetted tub to give my daughter a bath, a bunch of small black hairs came out from the jets! GROSS! The shower head also had green mold on it. It was a good thing I brought along my Tilex and sponge because it is obvious they do not clean the tub/shower. When it came to bedtime, I actually had to stack a bunch of pillows along one side of the full size bed so that my daughter would not fall off. (like I said earlier she usually sleeps on a king in between my husband and I. Well apparently that did not work well bc she ended up falling off the bed during the night. Oh I also found a couple long blonde hairs on the the duvet cover......eeeew! I understand that this is not the Hilton but when I am paying $400 /night I do expect that my requests for a certain room are met and that the rooms are CLEAN. We will NOT be staying here next year and will probably rent a condo or end up at the HILTON.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: luxtrvl
Reviews.Content: Location is great and as they are all suites layout is great and you have all you need especially for families. Service was very good in the hotel, restaurant so-so. The bed linens were scratchy and the fridge needed a good cleaning along with other parts of the room. They have an adult and kids pool along with an indoor. Note though I can be pickier than the average traveler. All in all, I'd say it's what you can expect from a 3star and really not much in the way of luxury on the boardwalk so this one is probably one of your better options for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time stay”
Reviews.Author: ECtraveler12
Reviews.Content: Great location right on the boardwalk. Rooms are nice and spacious. Housekeeping is good. Free wifi works nice. Elevator traffic is acceptable meaning no long waits. Will be staying here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, it is totally awesome”
Reviews.Author: vhindel
Reviews.Content: 5 of us Senior Citizens from Sudlersville High School, Md. went for a few nites (traditional now) and we had a "wonderful" time. The staff was wonderful and the suite was awesome. This will be our regular staying place from now on. They really spoil their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in oc”
Reviews.Author: ocaug
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying here every August since 2006. This is the absolute best place to stay if you have children. The pool is spectacular. The staff is friendly and the rooms are very clean. I've had a wonderful time each stay and each year is better than the last. Would never want to stay anywhere else. My only suggestion would be to have one assigned parking spot per room since parking can be tricky. If you have a chance to stay here you won't be disappointed! Its worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with all the extras”
Reviews.Author: shellerenee
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this hotel for 2 years now. It was quite a breathe of fresh air, after our former favorite hotel went down hill. We stayed in an oceanview suite. The best thing has to be the view. It has a great unobstructed view of the ocean and the balcony was very clean. Nice jacuzzi tub in bathroom and complimentary bath salts. Great property with tons of extras. Fresh fruit in a basket in the lobby every morning. At night I noticed they had tea & bath salts out. Very large, clean swimming pools, game room, onsite restaurants & boutique. A bit pricey, our room was around $450 a night. Overall wonderful stay, going back next month.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed beyond belief!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa0413
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the last 3 years and had a fabulous experience but this will be my last Our first room was filthy. Dirt and grime in the kitchen. The refrigerator had a nasty odor and was spray painted white to hide all the rust stains. The air conditioning vent in the bedroom was not blowing air. Called for the manager to view the room condition and HE was extremely apologetic and moved us immediately and our second room was ok but not worth the 529.00$ per night. Pool area clean but cramped and I would have appreciated non-vulgar music from the pool bar . Anyway next time the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful except for the reservations group.”
Reviews.Author: carusta123
Reviews.Content: I made reservations 2-3 months early and asked for a certain type room and asked for 8th floor or higher. I did not want the extra noise, wanted to hear the ocean. Confirmed my reservation several weeks prior and again asked for the 8th floor or higher. When I got there I was told my room was on the 2nd floor (right above the pools) and that the room I reserved did not go as high as the 8th floor. WHY DID NO ONE TELL ME THE 1ST 2 TIMES I CALLED? After almost having a meltdown they did find me a 6th floor room for the first night (but I had to switch to a 4 floor the 2nd night and lost a half a day without a room) They had to store my bags. After I decided not to let that ruin my vacation I did enjoy this hotel. The rooms were great, the pools were wonderful. The staff was very helpful especially the bellman and both the restaurant s were really good too. Great location, great view. Price a little high even for all that good. I'd go back if I had the extra money and now I know what to ask for when I made a reservation hopefully I’d get what I asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed 8/8/12”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for about 5 days. This hotel is immaculate. The room was very spacious. The balcony was nice and overseeing the ocean and pools. Great view. Had 2 queen beds, a sofa sleeper, jacuzzi tub, nice spacious bathroom. Everyone at this hotel was soooo nice and helpful. I broke my glasses the morning of the next to last day and the front desk had the repair man bring me some tape and helped me with my glasses. Was a laundry room on each floor, soda and snacks.... There was plenty of parking for a regular guest but my wife is handicapped. There was only 4 handicap spots I saw and they were always taken. Did not mind at all dropping off my wife at the front of the hotel and then parking in the additional lot but this was the only negative to the trip. On the boardwalk, 17th street, Coral Reef Restaurant Cinnamon French Toast is wonderful. I did think it was a little pricy though.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great location, nice pools”
Reviews.Author: angelphilly
Reviews.Content: We just got back from two days at the hotel (using my rewards points). It was our first time at this hotel and in OC. I loved the view from our balcony (5th floor), the pools were perfect and loved that it was just steps away to the beach. We stayed on the beach in the morning, left our stuff on the beach, went to the pools and the pool bar in the afternoon and then went back to the beach. The hotel is within walking distance to many of the local restaurants. I was surprised to arrive and seeing that our room had a full kitchen and the nice sized bathroom. The room was very spacious for 4 people. My husband thought the room smelled a little musty and like cigarettes, but I didn't notice because I spent most of the time on the beautiful balcony. The pullout couch didn't look comfortable based on the mattress flatness to me, but my 13-year old son didn't mind it much. The staff were so friendly and even after we checked out, we stayed in the pool area and used the bathrooms before heading home for a 3-hr drive. The elevators get a little crazy during peak times. I don't know if they open the indoor pool -- it always seemed like the lights were off in it. Overall I thought the hotel was perfect. However, I was surprised to find out that the hotel price is in the $400-$500 range - which I think is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: bigmook
Reviews.Content: very very nice hotel. Pools are great, bar and restaurant are awesome. Only steps to the beach. Huge balcony overlooking the ocean. Suite had 2 queens & pull out sofa, 6 were extremely comfortable. Hotel is very up to date and housekeeping does an awesome job. If you cant enjoy yourself here just stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th year in a row”
Reviews.Author: Lakadre
Reviews.Content: We just got back tonight from another outstanding week stay here, this made it our 4th year in row of staying here in OCMD. Everything has always been excellent staying here and any minor issues that we have ever had have always been corrected quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: familyfun48
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in this hotel almost every year since 2006. While things are showing some wear, we have never had issues with our stay. When we have had to call for something to be fixed, it was done so immediately. The staff and management are awesome. They have 4 elevators that work beautifully, even during a busy vacations season. If you have children this is the place to stay....GREAT kids pool. I grew up staying on the boardwalk when we would vacation in Ocean City, MD and my husband and I enjoy providing the same experience for our children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Jnmpa
Reviews.Content: While the location and the pools were awesome, I was disappointed with the condition of the room (broken floor tile in the kitchen, broken cabinets) and the housekeeping service. Housekeeping was inconsistent as best and we had to ask for our room to be cleaned one day because they didn't come at all. Staff was friendly. Gym was a joke - treadmill didn't work at all and only a couple of other machines that barely worked. Food was good poolside. Frozen drinks were weak - stick to beer - but bartenders were super friendly and fun. Not sure it was worth almost $500/night but it was a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Whitehall123
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Holiday Inn! Tips and info: ~ If you can get an ocean front, do! Great views! First floor rooms have direct pool access, but not as nice of a view. These rooms have pros and cons. Pro: you can beat the crowd when the pool opens and possibly get a table! You will be guaranteed a chair. You will be also able to go in and out of your room when at the pool! Please know that these first floor rooms are at the adult pool and activity pool, so if you want to request one- make sure you request the side you’d like to be on. Cons: loud, no privacy on you patio, lacking beautiful ocean view. ~ We had a one bedroom ocean front suite- all rooms here are suites. We requested a room with two beds. When entering our room, you walk directly into the living room- nice size with pull out sofa and table for four. Then you walk into a galley kitchen- everything you need! To the right is a large bathroom with large Jacuzzi tub! Tip: make bubbles in the tub by pouring the provided shampoo into the bath! Then walk further to the bedroom- very nice size. Then to the balcony! What a view- table and chairs- very nice. Overall, our room was clean. Yes, it could use some minor touch ups, but we expected that. Tip: Make sure you put in a request as to where you’d like to be placed. Higher floors are above the noise and have nice views. ~ Washing machines are located throughout the hotel. I hear that they are free of charge, just bring your detergent. ~ Smell- the smell you have read about in other reviews is true. We did smell it. It seems to be in the hallway. Attention Holiday Inn: I think it is from your carpet cleaners. I own a carpet cleaner and the smell reminds me of the stale water that accumulates in the carpet vacuum. The dirty water smells awful and if it happens to fall out onto carpet the smell will stick! I’d have a talk with your carpet cleaning crew. ~ Elevators- nice. They seem to work well. Now if you are and the lobby and need to go to the ground- why not simply use the stairs. ~ Restaurants- we enjoyed the food at the indoor restaurant and at the pool. Kids eat free with a paying adult. I suggest the club wrap. Our kids loved the chicken finger meal consisting of two chicken fingers, fries, two Oreo cookies, and a drink. If you want ice cream- don’t buy it from the ice cream truck that you will hear. Instead, buy it from the indoor restaurant- great prices! Most are only $1.50! You will pay $3 or more for the same items on the boardwalk or from the ice cream truck. ~Activity pool- usually opens around 8 or 9 AM and you will see a line form prior to it opening. Unfortunately, until Holiday Inn finds a way to regulate this, you must play this silly game of saving seats. Now I am NOT saying you should save seats if you don’t plan on using them for hours (as many do), but you can stroll out there when the pool opens and save your spot if you plan on being there within the hour. People would put their towel on a chair and head and head to the beach for the day and come back in the late afternoon- how rude! Tip: if you can’t find a chair set one of your beach chairs up in a free spot. If you have toddlers, try to get a chair by the entrance to the pool close to the baby slide as you will spend a lot of time in that section. If you have kids a little older like my 6 and 8 year old who love the circling whirlpool try to get a chair on the right hand sided closed to the beach. I liked this position because I could see the kids in the circling whirlpool at all times. Also, kids under 16 are NOT allowed in the outdoor hot tub. You can access a bathroom by using the door by the towel booth. If those two bathrooms are being used, walk a down the hall and to the right you will find additional bathrooms. There are even more bathrooms located by the arcade. ~Indoor Pool- this pool in nice. It is located with the indoor restaurant. This is a nice place to eat your lunch at and take a break from the sun. Other info: It is nice to use the changing rooms on your last day or when you arrive. Simply ask the front desk for the key. These rooms are located by the gym. Towels are provided for beach and pool use. We viewed a magic show in the conference room. I would not recommend wasting your time as it was not very good. However, it is nice of the H I to offer it. Additionally, fruit is available for the taking by the front desk. Be sure to clean it very well- you will smell the heavy amount of pesticides used. Around the corner from the front desk is a mini store. There are additional stores right under the H I on the boardwalk. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Pamalakiw
Reviews.Content: We went here for a girls week and had a blast! The location right on the boardwalk was just right. Close to great food and fun. The beach was close and clean and not too crowded. The pool bar had great drinks and fun bartenders! We loved the slide in the kids pool too! The rooms were very clean and big. There were four in our room and we had plenty of space. The bathroom was huge! We loved the patio--ocean front made a huge difference. This was my first visit to Ocean City and I wasn't sure what to expect. I loved it! One day I saw something I've never seen at a resort (and I go to a lot of them): As we were leaving one day, a young boy (6 ish)came down the steps wearing a "staff" shirt and sweeping a broom. He was with the bell boys at the entrance. Seems his family has been coming to this resort for years--before he was born. He loves working with the staff so they got him a shirt and let him hang with the staff for a little. Everyone here was like family--no kidding. By the time we left our four day visit, they called us by name and we made friends with other vacationers as well. Everyone I met --and I mean everyone--had been coming to this beach and staying at this resort for years. Now THAT says something about service, quality, and value. I can't wait to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Much to like, only a little to dislike!”
Reviews.Author: SandyBeach86
Reviews.Content: Likes: mostly friendly, hard working, polite staff, location (1 mile from either end of the boardwalk-pretty quiet!), perfect viewing for Tuesday night fireworks from Southern view suite, free washers and dryers on each floor, easy parking, 40 cent sodas in the machines!, fresh fruit in the lobby. Dislikes: dated decor and seriously smelly hallway near us on the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Debbie H
Reviews.Content: I believe this HI has alot of room for improvement. The carpet should be ripped out in the bedroom and the floor should be tiled. Everytime we took a shower or bathed and walked on the carpet the bottoms of our feet were black. The balcony looked like it hadn't been swept in the last year. Everyone was friendly, and check in and out was a breeze, these suites location is great but the carpet needs to go.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better for the price...”
Reviews.Author: BobnCarolyn
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed one night to extend our vacation in Ocean City. Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in North Ocean City for three nights and splurged on one night at this property. We had a corner double queen suite which was very large. The room was clean, but not spotless. The kitchen did not have a dishcloth, dishtowel or oven mitt. The bathroom was large with a nice shower. I agree with another reviewer on the odor in the hallways, very foul. While we were waiting to check in to our room, we went to the kids pool and within 10 minutes a child had an "accident" in the water so the pool had to be cleared out and disinfected. Needless to say we were not in a hurry to jump back in. Overall, I think we had a better experience for our money at the less pricey Holiday Inn Express on the quiet side of Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “All in all..Good”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy G
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I never write reviews but thought I should just share a few things with you. First off the room/balcanoy is a nice size but for 450+ a night it should be. The room was pretty clean but I did find a few "dirty" spots as well. The location was nice and great access to the beach. The restaurant in the hotel (we only ate breakfast) was ok but the eggs did taste a little funky at times. We stayed on the 10th floor and every morning when we went into the hallway there was a VERY foul odor of vomit. I first thought maybe someone got sick but then came to realize by the second day that it was just the smell. Finally by the 5th day I called to complain and they sprayed some sort of disgusting smelling deodorizer..the vomit smelled better than that!! All in all the hotel was decent I just would hold your breath everytime you leave your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay Once Again”
Reviews.Author: bkohler
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times and each time has been very pleasurable. Kids pool is great (although it does get crowded at times). Also, if you want a lounge at either of the outdoor pools, be warned that guests line up outside the gate around 8:15 am to grab a spot. A little silly, but it's just the way it is. The staff at this hotel is always friendly and helpful..I've seen the same faces year after year so it must be a decent hotel to work at. Love the convenience of the boardwalk tram right outside the hotel. Great place to stay for families. Rooms are clean and the maid service is very good. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Spa-Enthusiasts
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel on the Boardwalk. Suites are well equipped, but rain shower is annoying. Restaurant and lounge on property, as well as great spa packages. Over-priced, but everything in Ocean City, MD, is over-priced during the season. Don't stay during June - high school and college kids galore.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as in past years”
Reviews.Author: etraveler37
Reviews.Content: This was a family stay versus our normal couple stay. We had lots of deficiencies in the room about 1/2 of which the hotel addressed during our stay when brought to their attention (some were really bad while some were a nuisance). The hotel did offer some concessions to our stay but I am really disappointed with the housekeeping and overall maintenance of the hotel. Location is great it is ashamed that the hotel hasn't been putting forth more effort on upkeep. Of course when it is sold out all summer I guess they don't feel they need to. While this is one of our favorite extended weekend summer getaway places it is starting to lose it's flair as the quality of the rooms (maintenance/upkeep and housekeeping have dropped off). Also we saw the police their during our stay investigating missing items from a room so starting to be more concerned regarding valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - Would Stay here again”
Reviews.Author: doggiemama
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in June, picking up my son from Beach Week. Nicest Hotel in Ocean City - Great views of ocean and bay (in lobby), especially on upper floors. This is a true suite with a door by the bedroom, where we had 2 queen beds with plenty of walking space and a wonderful balcony. There was a nice galley with a full size fridge, stove, coffee maker, microwave and counter space. This would be great if you are staying a while and making some food to save money. We did not use this for just one night. The pools looked very nice, but actually too chilly when we were there. One pool had some nice kiddie areas, while there was also an adult pool with a bar. Great location, right on the beach, enjoyed the restaurant for breakfast. Teens can take the bus all over with a day pass. Parking wasn't a problem since it wasn't too busy - but I can imagine in the summer it may be when they are full.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parklandmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband, 16 year old daughter and her 2 friends. We stayed here for 2 nights before moving into our condo on 127th street for the week. The room was direct oceanfront. Nice size balcony. Good location, right on the boardwalk. If you don't want to walk down to the "action" part of the boardwalk, you can board the tram right in front of the hotel. The shower was the worst thing about the room. It was an overhead shower and did not have sufficient water pressure. We were on the 7th floor, so not sure if the pressure is better on the lower floors. The soda in the vending machines as 40 cents and the use of the washer and dryer was free. I am a priority club member for many years and was disappointed that breakfast was not included, since the Holiday Inn Express on 127th Street includes breakfast and the rates are much cheaper. I used my points for the 2 nights we stayed, but I know that the rates at the hotel are expensive, but you're paying for the oceanfront and boardwalk location, which are a must for me. Like one other reviewer stated, this is not the Ritz, but it is a nice hotel in Ocean City. I plan to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wake Up People, It's the Holiday Inn... Not the Ritz......”
Reviews.Author: MrDuckNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I have been spoiled over the years by staying at Hyatt's and other luxary hotels. This was an impulse trip on 4th of July week. Everything was booked and this hotel had one suite avaiable. After reading a couple of negative reviews (because no one really reads the positives anymore) i had no idea what to expect. From the moment we arrived the staff was fantastic and going out of their way to provide great service. It was obvious that the place was to it's capacity but each time we needed something they were great. Yes a few delays here and there but nothing to complain about(unless you are just a constant complainer). My son even locked out the safe by playing with the keypad as soon as we got there and when the guy came to fix it, I try to tip him and he said "Sir this is my job, you don't need to tip me" of course I won that one. I asked the same guy for a High Chair and he had one at my door in five minutes. The room had a kitchen and a seperate living area in it. Not the most current decor but it was clean and well maintained. Had two large flat screen tv's with a DVD player and VCR along with a Jacuzzi tub. One may argue the price per night but the section of the boardwalk that it is on and the amenities that it has is worth it. If your travelling with the family I highly recommend this hotel based on everything from the staff to the great location. Good Job Holiday Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “Waaaay Overpriced vs. Quality”
Reviews.Author: KatzyHagerstown_MD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice when it was new, but it seems they fail to maintain the rooms and the cleanliness is below acceptable... kitchen cabinet doors that don't stay shut causing you to constantly run into them or have to move them out of your way, blender missing cap, coffee maker in bad condition, beer bottle cap on floor and crumpled tissue on floor upon check-in. Location is the best thing about this hotel, but the price is ridiculous !!!

Reviews.Title: “Depends on Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Sean C
Reviews.Content: Arrived home yesterday from OCMD, having stayed at this hotel. Before I begin my review of the hotel itself, I would just like to say that I often wonder what people really expect when they stay at a hotel in OCMD high priced or not. As long as its not falling down, its a place to sleep and shower, this isn't a Sandals Resort, its OCMD. If you haven't been there before OCMD is not exactly glamourous or exotic...its a boardwalk and a beach plain and simple. SO IF YOU THINK THAT YOU ARE GOING TO HAVE THE TRIP OF A LIFETIME BY GOING TO OCMD YOU HAVE ANOTHER THING COMING. I have read many reviews on here for many of the different hotels along the Boardwalk and it would seem that every single hotel has a 1 dot review. Honestly, upon reading most of these reviews, one would probably rather stay on the beach than in any of these hotel rooms. My experience in this hotel was a very pleasant and predictable one. We had a very nice ocean view from the 6th floor, room 620 to be exact, and the room seemed very clean and well maintained. The staff were very friendly when asked questions and laughed and joked with us as we were checking in. The wireless internet worked pretty well as I had to attend an online meeting whilst there, experiencing very little network interruption. The lobby was clean enough, I mean come on...its a beach...things are going to get sandy...I myself was probably responsible for some of the sand left on the floor. Steps down to the boardwalk may pose a problem to handicapped visitors but there are other ways to get to the boardwalk...I have a handicapped mother and I would stay here with her; and I'm sure she'd have enjoyed it just as much as me. To expand a little bit on the room...it had a sitting area with a large TV, maybe 42" flat-screen, and comfortable couches with nice decor. A full kitchen with Stove, microwave, and fridge. Bathroom had a huge shower and a nice tub. The sleeping area also had a flatscreen tv and had 2 queen beds and a nice porch to look out over the boardwalk and ocean. I did not notice any cleanliness issues in any parts of the room, not that I was looking to be displeased by something, we are not overly scrutinizing people. Here's the deal and my two cents on this...everyone is looking for and will have a different experience on vacation. I have been to OCMD before, I know what to expect, I have no kids, I was here with my girlfriend and one of my close friends, and we had nothing tieing us down to the room so we came and went as we pleased. We slept and showered here; that was all. And for that the room was excellent. The only reason I did not give this a 5 dot rating is because I think nothing deserves a perfect rating. Things could always be better, even if there is nothing apparently wrong. I would definitely stay here again....If you want more than one opinion on this after reading my review, I thought the review with the "Roll the Dice" title was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: 4mindshare
Reviews.Content: Superior location, and attentive staff. Room was amazing, as we were Oceanside and on a high floor. The hotel was exactly as advertised, and was great for the whole family. The outside 'kids' pool was the best, even for my 14 year old who felt that she outgrew that, but with the 'lazy river' and whirlpool, she was elated, and couldn't get her out. The only drawback is that the high building blocks off the sun in the later part of the afternoon (3pm for us in May), but assume all tall buildings have the same issue on the Oceanfront. We spent 4 days in total. The indoor pool is next to the restaurant, which was great, and liked rolling right out of the hotel onto the boardwalk. Going back again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sylver H
Reviews.Content: We booked a 7 night family vacation here! The very first night we arrived the room smelled horrible a mix of musk/smoke/mildew, and we noticed there was a huge floor dryer blowing directly at the front of our door in the hallway! I immediately called and complained and said I wanted to switch rooms because the smell was nauseating and I have 3 small children with me one of whom is only 8 months old, I was told "Sorry we are completely booked - we will send someone up to check the smell. Housekeeping arrived and checked the outlets??? and then said "I smell exactly what you are talking about but I do not know where it is coming from but I will leave you this can of air freshener but don't use it unless you plan on leaving the room because it is very powerful!" I asked him why the floor had a dryer blowing outside and he said "Someone spilled a drink earlier which splashed onto your door so we were drying the carpet. The next day we woke up and walked outside of our room and noticed the dryer was gone, didn't think much of it went about our day, came back, and were walking into our room when I noticed wet shoe tracks all throughout the room - I grabbed a towel and wiped it up. The smell again was horrible. We continued our day and went to eat downstairs. Upon returning I opened the door carrying my 8 month old daughter and slipped and almost fell. Again I looked down and see wet foot prints from my kids - I start looking around and realize the wet floor was coming from outside my door - it was drenched! The smell again was still overwhelming as well so I called again and complained - this time I was told a mop bucket was spilled - we will put a dryer out and send someone to check on the smell. Maintenance arrived and he put vanilla scented pads in the air returns which completely masked the smell and the dryer ran all night and most of the next day until someone removed it. Day 3 went about my day came home to a drenched floor again! Called yet again and complained the manager said she would come look at it - she evidently looked at it and called back apologizing saying they would send maintenance up to take care of it this time they would use a wet-vac first and then a dryer. Again I asked to move - "Sorry we are sold out!" A maintenance man came up again with the dryer - I asked him if he had any knowledge about the situation he laughed and said "This room has had this problem for a month - I have told management several times and they have done nothing except say put a dryer out! At this point I am furious but obviously my hands are tied - the hotel has all of my money and I can do nothing about it! By the 6th day I am so sick of wiping up the tile so we don't slip and break our necks that I head straight to the front desk and ask for a manager to follow me to my room. He did and said "I was told a mop bucket spilled here a while ago and have heard nothing since, I apologize you shouldn’t have to deal with this - I will credit you one night and you can switch rooms if you like. By this time my husband refuses to switch rooms because of the amount of time and hassle of packing everything back up to move and unpack for the next 2 nights. This vacation was a complete nightmare! This hotel was horrible and no better than most motels we drove past while in Ocean City. I feel the one night credit was a nice gesture but not nearly good enough for what we had to endure. My vacation days were spent wiping up a floor every time we walked in the door, and dealing with a horrible odor which I can only assume was from the leaking water all of that time. When you pay over $400 a night you expect a nice hotel - my 9 year old boys even said "This place is a dump and disgusting!" I am completely appalled at the service we received staying in this hotel! I will NEVER again stay at this hotel because of their lack of customer service. Obviously this hotel has too many managers since I never dealt with the same one more than once and they have not a clue what goes on or don't care! I took a video of just how soaked the floor was -you can actually see the water gush around my shoe when I step unfortunately I can't upload it here!!! I will be advising all not to stay here! On a better note - the maid was terrific and very accomodating - even left extra towels because of the problem daily!

Reviews.Title: “A roll of the dice”
Reviews.Author: MySunsetProse
Reviews.Content: It pains me to write this review, as I have had a couple fairly good experiences at this hotel. However, my recent visit to celebrate my birthday was, in a word, awful. At $400+ per night, I do expect a certain level of professionalism, including top notch customer service skills and the ability to deal with difficult problems. So here is a word of warning to you -- if you are a person or family who requires a good night of sleep during your vacation, please know that your chances of having that are a roll of the dice. For me personally, I aim for about five solid hours of sleep. If I can get that, I'm good. So when all hell broke loose in the evening at the unit directly adjacent to ours, my adreneline kicked in, though I felt pretty sure the hotel could handle it. I was wrong. Earlier in the day we had heard screaming, arguing and banging on the wall, but we left for the beach and figured it would pass. When the loud voices and wall banging re-commenced in the evening, we called downstairs to report it. The staff member duly responded that he/she would "handle" it. Okay, good. About twenty minutes later, the wall banging and door slamming picked up, and it had the distinct feeling of some kind of adolescent retaliation. Except I knew it was two adults and a couple kids. Another phone call downstairs was made, and the responding staff member indicated they would make another call to the offending room. By this time we're into an hour of this aggravation. More wall banging, yelling and door slamming ensues, and a security person then comes up. Clearly whatever it was he communicated did nothing to impart concern to the hell raisers that they might be asked to relocate. My feeling is it should be three strikes and you're out. Evidently the hotel takes the attitude that those poor souls who are complaining about something should be the ones to move. Really? It became painfully obvious to me that the hotel prefers not to deal with these kinds of issues -- but at the customer's expense. The yelling was so loud that my 17 year old daughter kept being startled awake and asking what was happening. When the wall banging and angry yelling started again, I began to feel a bit threatened for my family's safety. My daughter was so tired, as was I -- we all were -- all we wanted to do was get some rest in our nice, expensive hotel room, but no. The grand finale came around 2:00AM when the whole motley crew stepped out on their deck and screamed loud enough to drown out the pounding thunder. This went on for a good hour. At this point...I gave up, knowing our option would be to "relocate." It was in that moment I realized that my esteem for this formerly beloved hotel was gone. I deserved to have a nice birthday, and my family deserved to enjoy themselves. I strongly recommend that the Holiday Inn and Suites in Ocean City, MD revisit their security policies, along with the manner in which they treat hotel guests who are experiencing this kind of unpleasantness. It is patently unfair that folks who spend their hard earned vacation money should have to suffer through something like this. So be forewarned -- you might get the chance to enjoy a nice stay here. On the other hand, should something happen that requires professional intervention in a situation such as the one we suffered through -- may the good Lord hlep you, because it seems the Holiday Inn & Suites enjoys so much business that it doesn't have to care.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for falling concrete”
Reviews.Author: Rick G
Reviews.Content: We were using our Priority Club points for this hotel, as it costs $400 a night or more during the summer. We had a Southern View suite. The fully stocked kitchen, had 1 frying pan, no spatula (hard to make breakfast in your kitchen of the suite without one, if you need to flip things) no hot pads (had to use a towel from the bathroom as one, when using the oven.) The first morning my family was there, I use the shower, my wife then notices something in the whirlpool(which doubles as the shower, when she goes to use the shower. I clean it out of the whirlpool. It is a hard abrasive object. after her shower, there is more. we call maintenance, who deems it to be concrete, but doesn't know where it is coming from. We go out on the boardwalk, only to find more concrete in the tub, where it was coming from one of the ceiling tiles. When we leave for dinner we ask the front desk to have maint. fix the problem. Needless to say, we will be asking Priority Club for our points back, The location is the best part of this hotel, as you can walk out of it directly onto the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons....expensive place to stay unsure if it was worth it”
Reviews.Author: Denise P
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: nice location, good that outdoor pools face the beach so you can see the ocean from your poolside lounge chair if you don't want to sit on the sand, beautiful rooms with kitchen area efficiency, easy parking under hotel, right on the boardwalk. On the negative side: outdoor hot tub is located next to the children's pool instead of being located next to the adult pool, which leads to constant jumping in and out of the hot tub by small children (even though posted signs discourage this) , no lobby area with seating...so you are either in your room or at the pool area, TV in the room does not allow you to order movies (you have to drive to a red box across the street and get one and put it in the VCR in the room....very inconvenient in a room that costs over $400/night, screen to balcony was torn and difficult to slide on track, poor water pressure in the shower, only one restaurant in the entire hotel and no menu in room to use to order room service, no information booklet in room to find the location of the indoor pool or other hotel amenities, must have thin walls because we were woken up twice with noise from the outside hall which sounded like it was inside our room. There were other hotels close by with similar exterior setups. Would definitely look into other options before paying the high price this hotel demands.

Reviews.Title: “Pre visit trouble....”
Reviews.Author: earlphiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I am reviewing just the "booking" part of this hotel. I am hoping to followup with a much better expierence during my stay, if we don't cancel. I was quoted $417 a night to stay here.....wow. A week later I called back with a discount code offered by my employer. After the hotel validated the code, they told me they COULD NOT give the discount! When I asked why, they said the rate quoted is already a discount. I called guest services, and was told I would get a callback within 48 hours from the hotel. When no callback was received, I again called guest services and was told they are mailing their decision on my discount. Huh? Where's my callback? Anyway a week later I got a "Dear John" saying tough bananas, that's the rate and we are sticking with it. Now I guess when you are a multi million dollar business you can just cast customers off, figuring somebody else will call and itl book anyway. I say customer service is just that....customer service. None has been found here so far.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for OC, MD...BUT handicapped beware!”
Reviews.Author: mamalikestotravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. One of the nicer places in OC. But, on my most recent trip, I had 2 handicapped individuals in my party. They put us on the 4th floor and we were having a nice, enjoyable stay....until the alarm went off one of the evenings. We had a person on a crutch and a hospice patient in a wheelchair. When the alarm started, I called the front desk to find out how we should evacuate and if we could get some help. I let it ring about 15 times and received no answer. So, I checked for a number to call in the hallway - where they have emergency instructions. I called that number and someone picked up. I told her of our situation and asked what we should do. She responded that we needed to evacuate the building, that it wasn't a drill. I reiterated my question - what should we do? How can we get this person in a wheelchair down the steps. She responded with "I don't know" and put me on hold without telling me to Hold On. I waited and waited and started to panic. I eventually hung up and we attempted to carry the person in the wheelchair down the steps. We made it one landing and couldn't go any further.....but, then learned as the guests were headed back to their rooms, that it was a false alarm. Some nice gentlemen carried my mom back into the room. The hotel staff apologized and moved us to a lower floor and promised it wouldn't happen again....and gave us a free dinner. It was a horrible experience though. We felt that the hotel staff had no regard for our safety and that they had no clue how to handle disabled people in an emergency. Although they say that they plan to remedy the situation, I wouldn't feel confident staying there again if I had disabled people in my party. It's unfortunate, because I enjoyed that hotel on all prior occasions. It has nice, clean rooms, the location is great, and the pool is perfect for families and young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and views”
Reviews.Author: Lynnbobchak
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel great view we had a corner so could see both ocean and bay. Room was Big and Clean Staff was friendly Lounge food was good a little price Hotel is in a great location I think I am picky and was very happy with this hotel and would go back

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and pools”
Reviews.Author: Charlene592
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are similar to a condo or apartment with a living room, full kitchen, bedroom and private balcony with a table and chairs. Although evident it is a beach hotel, i.e., well used, the bedding is sublime and the service is immediate and friendly. The lobby bar is great and the bartender, Patrick, skilled and friendly. The outdoor pools include a kids pool with water slides and a lazy river, a large hot tub and a more sedate "adult" pool with bar service. The location, right on the boardwalk, at 17th street facing the ocean, could not be better. A bit pricey in season, but totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: seashell212
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. The last time we were in Ocean City we did not have a good experience so I was hesitant to come back. We enjoyed our stay this time around at the Holiday Inn and Suites. This hotel is located directly on the boardwalk. We had an ocean front suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa bed. We had a private balcony that was furnished with a table and chairs. We had a full kitchen with dishwasher. It was nice to be able to make quick meals for breakfast and eat out on the balcony. The room was a little dated but very clean. The location is perfect. We parked our car and didn't drive for the rest of the weekend. There is a CVS within walking distance, but if you want groceries such as lunch meat and things of that nature, you should get them on the way in because there are no big grocery stores within walking distance. We were able to walk to the end of the boardwalk to ride the rides and play games every night. I'm guessing it was about 1.5 miles to the end of the boardwalk from this location. There is a tram car you can ride for $3 dollars each way/person if you don't want to walk. My little one loved the activity pool. It has a shallow entry so you just walk right in. It was heated so he didn't mind going in. There is a spa tub near the activity pool. You need to be 15 in order to use it. The other pool was not heated and was pretty chilly when we were there. You have to purchase your alcohol through the pool bar. They don't allow outside alcohol in. The pool hours were also a little strange. The activity pool closed at 6pm and the other pool closed at 8pm. The hotel gives you passes to get towels at the pool. If you hand in your towel you get the towel pass to use the next time. The indoor pool is next to a restaurant/bar. It was a little chilly also. The only downside to this property is the price.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs”
Reviews.Author: TheFbright
Reviews.Content: Ocean City isn't upscale so it's no surprise this hotel isn't either. But it met our needs. We traveled with our 2 year old daughter and it was a fine stay. The front desk staff isn't rude but they are not helpful or accommodating in any way. We should have been given a brief rundown of hotel amenities(like parking) but it was sort of "here are your keys. Bye" type of attitude. Being a former hotel manager,I prefer uniforms for employees (except management) and some standard of professionalism. Although the front desk staff looked fine, i prefer uniformity so you recognize them as staff. The restaurant staff & maintenance did wear matching shirts but looked sloppy from the waist down, just unprofessional in my opinion. We ate breakfast in the restaurant each day and it was pretty good. Some of the staff was great, others lacked service. The room was fine. Yes, some things were dated or needs attention (I.e. Pealing wallpaper) but overall good. The view is wonderful, bed & linens were as good as any, ample size living & kitchen, very much met our needs. The whirlpool tub needs to go. My toddler is scared of the shower and it was hard to bath& wash her hair in the whirlpool tub. And it's just dated& tacky in my opinion. The bathroom was large with ample amenities. The air conditioner could have been colder, especially since we went early in the season. Hate to think how hot it would be in mis summer. Overall we had a good stay. Happy hour prices were great! If we were to return to Ocean City, which I doubt, I would stay here. Ocean City was a close place for us to drive our toddler to this year...which is why we chose it. We had a good time but will not choose Ocean City in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location . . . humble furnishings”
Reviews.Author: ASELAGE
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Memorial Day weekend. The ocean view from the balcony was perfect and the rates were fair. The layout of the suite could not have been better - living room area, full-size kitchen, large bedroom w/king size bed and a Jacuzzi tub, great shower, 2 large flat screen TV's and free Wi-Fi. We had no problems finding a parking spot in the garage - which was a huge plus!. I was surprised at the furnishings - they were a bit pedestrian. They served the purpose, but sort of reminded me of college dorm furniture. And for a non-smoking hotel, the cigarette smoke that wafted through the air conditioning was overpowering. An okay stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel of choice in OC Maryland”
Reviews.Author: lovestoeat2010
Reviews.Content: When this hotel first opened we started staying there and were immediately impressed by the staff as well as the facility itself. There is plenty of parking no matter what time of year you stay. The rooms are as clean and well appointed today as they were the day they opened for business. The have a great restaurant that is open late for dinner every evening that serves consistently great food. The staff of the hotel seems to remember you from stay to stay which is a neat trick considering the number of people they deal with daily. And the cleaning staff is always willing to let you sleep in without disturbing you and then sneaks in when you are gone to work their magic on your room. For us, it is the only place to stay in OC Maryland!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BvilleBoy
Reviews.Content: We were there in low season -- early April -- so I don't know what the summer rates might be, but it was perfect for me,(the dad) and three high school juniors on spring break. Right on the boardwalk and convenient to everything in OC. The ocean view from the 12th floor was great and the full size kitchen was perfect. Kitchen was well furnished with pots, pans, plates, silverware, etc. Even had a dishwasher! The outdoor pools weren't open when we were there, but it looks like it would be a great place for a family with small children, too.

Reviews.Title: “Short Visit to OC”
Reviews.Author: Irishdm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was adequete but the furniture is a little outdated. I also question the cleanliness of the pool. Also be careful if you have more than 6 - they charge you the 18% gratuity but nowhere on the menu does it inform you of the policy. However kids eat free with one adult which is beneficial

Reviews.Title: “The ocean put me it sleep!”
Reviews.Author: M200789
Reviews.Content: The view is fantastic, can't beat an ocean view! The boardwalk is nearing completion (they are working on it during the day) We thought that the beds were very comfortable. I liked the sliding screen door to the balcony so that we could enjoy the ocean sound with no bugs. We found the room very clean. My husband liked the nearby "Subway" shop for inexpensive meal choices. We have stayed at the Hilton prior to this and it was the same room style but seemed newer but does not have the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time pre-season at the Holiday Inn in OC”
Reviews.Author: ajohnsonb
Reviews.Content: We went for a quick overnight to the Holiday Inn and Suites in OC. It was a spur of the moment trip and we got a decent room rate for pre-season. The hotel is not sparkly new anymore (we haven't stayed in at least 4 years). There is a little wear and tear...but in general it is a fabulous place to stay for families. The extra room makes it great for spreading out. You could choose to cook your own meals in the full kitchen. However, with so many awesome places to eat in easy walking distance I wouldn't bother for the night! :) (We love Layton's for breakfast!!!, and Fishtales for hanging out~there is a play area for kids). All staff we encountered were friendly. The bar has great happy hour prices from 3-7, so it's nice for the adults while the kids play in the pool. The one bummer for us is that the prices are pretty steep during peak season, so the kids haven't gotten to try the outside pool which looks VERY fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great with kids!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalFamily_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location on the boardwalk/beach. We had an ocean front suite with a living room with pullout couch and a full bedroom with 2 double beds. Also, a balcony facing the ocean. The rooms are comfortable and clean though not luxury (which was FINE for us but depends what you are looking for). Bathroom is large. A small kichenette is there as well. The beach is steps from the hotel lobby. The tram is available right on the boardwalk by the hotel. Dunkin Donuts and a drug store (maybe CVS?) is walking distance as are several restaurants. The pools with waterslides also offered tons of fun. It was a family favorite vacation and we're doing it again this year. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel- We will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: liliribs
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! It had everything we needed and more. Our little family of three had more than enough room to stretch out in these suites. It could have easily fit more people. The living room was large with a fold out bed, flat screen tv and dining table with four chairs. Our toddler in slept in here in the provided pack-n-play. The kitchen was well equipped with everything we needed and more. It had silverware and dishes, a blender, toaster, coffee-maker, pots, pans, a full size fridge and stove. It was all very clean and new. It was nice to be able to make our own breakfast in the morning, and to have all the food we needed through out the day with out having to rely on eating out for every meal. The bathroom was great! Our toddler LOVED the giant jacuzzi, and she swam in it several times during our stay. It also has a nice rain style shower head, very luxurious. Plenty of counter space and lighting. We had two queen beds in he spacious bedroom. We loved how high the ceilings were, and that we had a TV in here too. It was far enough away from the living room that we didn't disturb our sleeping baby. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The sliding doors leading to the balcony were lovely, and we enjoyed watching the sun rise over the ocean from our bed. The hotel is on the beach, so access is very convenient. Since it was the off season, there were hardly any people there, which was great! Lots of covered parking, no crowds, and a very quiet hotel. We appreciated that there was an indoor pool too! The outdoor pool(s) looked amazing, and I can imagine it would be a kid's dream come true during the summer. We ate dinner one evening from the restaurant in the lobby. It was very quick service, and our ribs were great! We especially enjoyed the fried banana cheesecake pastry offered there. I highly recommend it. The staff and employees were very kind and accommodating. We were given and early check in at around 10. We also asked for a late check out so our toddler could squeeze in one more nap before we headed home, and that was no problem at all. The only problem we encountered was in our first room we were given, the curtains and valance had fallen off the wall, but we just informed them about it, and were given a room just a few doors down. Easy fix! We had an awesome stay here, we wish we could have stayed longer. I definitely recommend visiting Ocean City in the off-season. Perhaps it is a little colder and lots of places are closed for the season, but I loved the sparse crowds and no traffic and there were still enough places open for us to have some fun. Please the beach was practically deserted! This hotel is in a great location for all the fun you want to have.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Courthalecki6
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my weekend getaway with my boyfriend at the holiday inn. The room was very large with a king bed & ocean front balcony. The bed & pillows were so comfy I felt like I was sleeping in my own bed at home!!! We chose not to have housekeeping come, but they left a bag in front of our door with fresh towels and coffee & bath essentials. They had mini bath & body works shampoos, lotions and conditioners. Will come back in the summer too! A++

Reviews.Title: “Best in OC... but it is OC, you know, so don't judge too hard!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a great hotel and we DO love it. There is plenty of space for my family of 4 in the suites and no fighting over tv's or trying to make kids be quiet so someone can nap because there is always the other room to retreat to. We go there every single June (this year will be our 5th year) and the staff is so nice many of them even remember us, which makes us feel special. The staff always try to help us in any way and leave us feeling like they care about our vacation and the impression they leave on us. However... this is an Ocean City hotel, so if you are looking for total perfection... new carpets, pristine decor, you are going to the wrong beach TOWN because I don’t think anything like that exists in OC, especially on the boardwalk. (I think there is a new and nicer Hilton that is very similar to this hotel but it is not on the boardwalk which is half the fun for us. We take this awesome location over a hotel that is sparkling like new.) To us this is the best hotel with a great location on the boardwalk, at a beautiful beach far from the public beach down on the end of the boardwalk, good bar by the 2 outdoor pools (one that is great for kids) situated overlooking the beach (not the parking lot like at most other OC hotels!) and an indoor pool for cool or yucky days as well as a decent, casual restaurant, fitness room, and suites with full kitchens and lots of space for cranky, sunburned families to spread out before someone has a meltdown. I do like the rooms very much despite the fact that we usually stay at 5 star hotels (Grand Cypress or Grand Floridian in Orlando, The Plaza in NY, The Willard in DC and so on) so this is an adjustment downward in luxury, but it is clean, comfortable, spacious, friendly and all the amenities and it’s PRIME location make up for a hard to see run in the carpet here or there. BTW, I gave this 5 stars not because I think it is a 5 star hotel, but because of all the options in Ocean City, Md… I find this to be the best choice for couples or families. Book it and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price !”
Reviews.Author: Smilingeveryday
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn on 17th Street in Feb 2012. Now it was off season and the price was lower than summer but it was worth it. The room are a good size, clean, and comfortable. We chose this hotel for the indoor pool and were not disappointed. Good size, in a very high ceiling room, warm enough to swim in, and clean. I read some of these reviews and was concerned, but once I got there i was quite happy. Not sure if some of these people just need something to complain about or what, but I found no flaws. We stayed in the southern suite instead of the Ocean view side, but could see the ocean anyway so stay in room 604. We had 2 other couples with us and all the rooms are the same. I would like to see them update the couches in the rooms but they were typical hotel couches. The beds and pillows were so comfortable I wanted to take them home !!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MommaLady_3
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I visited Ocean City Maryland for my birthday in December. It was very nice, however, a lot of the attractions were closed for the season. I am sure that in the summer it is wonderful. The room was super clean and the staff were very friendly. Our main reason for visiting was the new Casino @ Ocean Downs. Eventhough I am a table poker player, I still enjoyed playing the slots and the computerized games that rips you off (lol) . If you like a lot of slots then you will love the casino @ Ocean Downs there are several to choose from. We will definitely return, but it will be during the seasonal time so that we will not be limited to the casino only.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in OC”
Reviews.Author: Baltowkids
Reviews.Content: There aren't many luxury options in OC, MD but Holiday Inn is as good as it gets. The pool area is great for the kids. Really, you can't beat it in OC. The new Hilton has the same exact pool (haven't stayed there before) but Holiday Inn is right on the Boardwalk which is a plus. The hotel is one of the newer hotels in OC. The suites are good if you have a family as there are two separate rooms - the front room has a pullout sofa and a table - good for a parent that has a napping child. Since we have been going to OC our entire lives, we know that the pickings are slim for something nice. I just wish it wasn't so ridiculously expensive. But, I would say that if money isn't an option, you should stay here, the newer Hilton or see if you can rent a condo at The Belmont Towers (I hear they are very nice - also expensive). If money is more of an object, we have also stayed at Park Place which is suitable and very convenient. But, we would pick Holiday Inn or Hilton everytime if they weren't so expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.”
Reviews.Author: Buttercup1221
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 207. The furniture was old and worn out, the deadbolt didn't work, there was water damage on the bathroom ceiling....and there was a VCR in the room. A VCR? Who uses those anymore? Does anybody even own any VHS tapes? Overall the room was fine, if the price is right I would stay again. The indoor pool was ok, just really small. The staff was friendly and the restaurant had good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip everytime”
Reviews.Author: Tony N
Reviews.Content: My family and I return to Ocean City every year, and would only stay at the Holiday Inn Suites on 17th street. The staff is attentive and friendly. On occasion traveling with little one's there is a special need and the staff at the Holiday Inn Suites has always gone above and beyond. Well worth visit folks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: R B
Reviews.Content: This is the second year that we have stayed at this hotel. We usually visit February/March weather depending. It is a great location with onsite restaurants as well as indoor pool. Had an oceanview suite which included a living room, separate kitchen, bath with jacuzzi tub and 2 queen beds plus balcony for $99. The staff are friendly, restaurant food is good and the hotel is clean. This is our hotel of choice off season and will remain that way as long as prices stay affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Our little winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: MrGuber
Reviews.Content: Had a great time as always here. It's nice to relax by the pool and let the children enjoy themselves. I will hate to be heading home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: cdepks
Reviews.Content: My family has been coming to this hotel in January for over 10 years. It is a great hotel in a location that has just enough to offer off-season. Kids love indoor pool, rooms are spacious and reasonable ($79-$99) in Jan. Plenty of restaurants open (Bayside Skillet is a must!). Staff is always friendly, restaurant and bar are OK, but reasonable and convenient if you don't want to drive. Love this place and will return every year...

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations and more....”
Reviews.Author: DavidS050
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the weekend of January 6th. I have stayed at the other Holiday Inn on 126th street and the Marriott Beachfront on 15th. The advance, non-refundable rate I found was too good to pass up, so I gave it a try for the first time. This was a good weekend to visit, as the hotel was no where near capacity. Friendly check-in by young, female desk clerk, and I asked for an upgrade for an oceanfront King Bed, which they were unable to do, but instead gave me an Oceanfront two-queen (Room 1413-top floor). Room was very clean and there were no issues, although it took me a couple of minutes to realize that the shower head is recessed into the ceiling in this room, and you stand in the middle of the jacuzzi tub. Pressure was low, but probably had to do with being on the top floor. Had happy hour at hotel bar which offered some very competitive specials for beer and food. Nachos were very tasty. Overall, a great stay, and if I could get the same rate again, I would return again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Summer Happiness”
Reviews.Author: MySunsetProse
Reviews.Content: If you live on the East Coast or somewhere near it, and you want to go to a nice beach and boardwalk, and stay in a location that gives you a lusterous view of the moon sinking into the ocean at night, consider giving the Holiday Inn and Suites in Ocean City, Maryland a try. If you yearn for the sound of seagulls, people laughing and enjoying themselves in the noon, and the sound of waves cresting onto the shore, consider spending a few days at this large hotel with its ample sized rooms. The kitchenette makes it possible to prepare some of your own meals if you desire. While this hotel does have a history of needing to pay more attention to how well the rooms are cleaned, its decent sized balconies, comfortable beds and location location location just enough away from the boardwalk but still within walking distance makes it a gem. If you get an ocean front room, your day can begin with the sun streaming through the open sliding glass doors to the balcony, hearing the fun chatter of the beach and feeling like life is really good. This is a hotel that can accomodate families or groups of friends who want to be together. Our family of five fit nicely into a suite, which is great because it seems many hotel rooms are designed for four people or less. Consider giving yourself a big slice of beach happiness at the Holiday Suites and Inn in Ocean City this summer. It's reasonably priced, nicely situated, and has a wonderful view. Sometimes simple pleasures really can be the best!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: scott-joy
Reviews.Content: My husband and 10 month old stayed here for our family vacation. Staff was great in accommodating and even provided a high chair for our room. Additionally we were using points for part of our stay and the manager allowed us to stay in the same room. We love this place and can't wait to go again in October 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Great Oc Stay!”
Reviews.Author: HonestGuyDelaware
Reviews.Content: The facility and staff were extraordinary. The Christmas decorations were lovely,food was excellent and jacuzzi suites were to die for!! Will definitely be returning..........

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a fishing trip and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: PrettyHazardous
Reviews.Content: Ok hubby and I stayed here for 3 days 2 nights for his fishing trip and we loved it. Staff were really nice. Loved our room it was a south facing suite. It was so big and we loved having the living room full kitchen and bedroom. I was doing school work so it was great to have to a separate room from my hubby to focus on my work. I enjoyed room service bfast but it was pricey. We didn't visit the pool bc there were about 1 million kids in it at all times. But no biggie bc we had a jacuzzi tub in our room. We will definitely stay here for all of his Ocean City fishing trips. Well worth the awesome AAA price we paid. ~Ashley

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: SarahWZ
Reviews.Content: We were put into room 1414. What a wonderful room! It has windows on three sides, and thus has an ocean view, a bay view, and a view long-ways down the island (down the island in the direction away from the inlet). The room is huge with a large bedroom, large sitting room, and nice-sized kitchen. It was very clean and nice utilitarian furnishings. We were in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific getaway”
Reviews.Author: tenknots
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times now, always in the off season, which is a bargain. The suite is large, narrow but long. There is a nice living room with pullout sofa and TV, a small galley kitchen with full size appliances and a good sized bedroom with another TV(ours had two queens). The large bathroom has a triangular two-person jacuzzi that is very comfortable - the included bath salts are a nice bonus. But the best part of this place is the view. From the bedroom, the large sliding glass door faces the open ocean. If you're high enough up, you can't see anything but water from the bedroom. It's truly spectacular if you love to see the ocean stretching away for miles. You might even see whales in the distance. And if the sky is clear, you can see the moon and sun rise out of the ocean, even while laying in bed. With the slider open, you can hear the surf very well, which is wonderfully relaxing. It's about my favorite place to go to unwind. The small restaurant/bar has cheap drinks at happy hour, though that may only be the case in the off season. I was surprised that the breakfast was inexpensive. It may be that there is so much competition in the area. The hotel is right on the boardwalk and there are restaurants everywhere. The beach is very pretty and a great place to lose yourself. Bring your squeeze and make this a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: bmill
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and I was a little dissapointed this time: The housekeeping needs some improvement- tub area was dirty with soap scum, did not get any dish clothes or dish towels. no extra blanket or sheet for sofa bed, The rooms are starting to show their age-tore wall paper under sink in bathroom and frayed carpet and rust on front of refridgerator. The location can't be beat,service was great-we needed something in the room fixed and they were there right away. The staff was very good at the front desk and yes they were very friendly. I will stay there again-reminding myself this is off season and most of the repairs are done over the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: NORMARK2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 2 night stay. Check in and check out were quick and easy. We were offered the choice of a lower or higher floor. We selected higher and got an 8th floor room. A 2 queen bed ocean front suite. The room was nice and pretty well kept. Everything was clean except for some stains on the face of the fridge. We discovered about 8:00 in the evening there was no stopper in the tub. Someone was there in 5 minutes. The entire drain needed to be replaced. Not a project for that time of night. He did a temp fix that worked fine for our stay. The indoor pool was on the cool side for our liking and it strangely shares a large room with the restaurant. We did not eat in the restaurant or use room service. The outdoor pools look nice for the warmer season. Overall a nice stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could have been a 4 Star with a little effort.”
Reviews.Author: W0nderfulLife
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with the size and amenities of the room, which was actually a condo set up, with full kitchen, living room and bedroom w/balcony. Perfect location for my travel to the convention center. The bad part was the pubic hair on the toilet, and when I tried the jacuzzi tub, the blower spouts blew out what looked like mildew coming out and was filling the tub with the debris. The beds were comfortable with lots of pillows and comfy sheets.

Reviews.Title: “The best I've seen in the OC”
Reviews.Author: R P
Reviews.Content: Undoubtedly the best I've seen in the OC. Have stayed several places and enjoyed this one the most. Made the mistake of booking at another hotel because it was cheaper, but, you get what you pay for. Checked out 3 hours later and beelined straight to this hotel. Service is friendly and great, room is clean and SMELLS good, comfortable, absolutely a place you can relax in. Don't get confused, there is only ONE "Holiday Inn Hotels and Suites"!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: SpreeBee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. And for the time of year, late September, the price made the value well worth it. We stayed with our 1 year old and another couple and their 1 year old in two rooms next to each other. I'm not sure if they have adjoining rooms, but ours didn't. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating as well. The rooms were wonderful. There was a living room with small table, TV, couch and chairs. The kitchen had a stove, microwave, full fridge, coffee pot and sink. There were cabinets full of dishes as well. The bathroom was nice and big and the bedroom was very big. Also, just from walking down the boardwalk, it looked like our hotel had the biggest and nicest balconies. We stayed on the 2nd floor and had a great view. I was told the 'Ocean View Suites' began on the second floor and that was fine by us. The beds were very comfortable. With a pack and play (which they supplied), I loved having the extra room and somewhere to set it up so we could stay up a little later and not feel confined to a small space, having to be quiet. The pool was great. It was sloped for the babies to play and had 2 water slides. One was even geared toward younger kids and shaped like a pirate ship. There was a whirl pool and a lazy river that were both a lot of fun. We ate in the restaurant in the hotel one day for breakfast and it was good food. It was in the same large room as the indoor pool that we didn't use. We enjoyed the hotel so much we plan to return next year and stay at the same place.

Reviews.Title: “The last summer hurrah!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nanaiscool
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been our first choice for the past 7 years... in the summer with the grandkids and the fall, just us.. Everything is exactly as ordered.. Friendly, helpful staff, great house keeping, Luxury directly on the boardwalk, but the hotel is elevated so you don't have passers-by looking at you.. great pools, HUGE suites with oversized, fully stocked kitchen.
