Great Jacuzzi tub. Living room with a TV and also a TV in the bedroom.. It is a slower paced season in October. so we were upgraded to an oceanfront/bayview end unit on the 7th floor.. what wonderful views... awesome.. and the great rates helped. Our bathroom doorknob was broken, but the front staff called maintenance and it was fixed while we went for a walk... It was a GREAT convenience having the bar and restaurant in the hotel. Great party atmosphere, and we didn't have to get in the car and go anywhere..kindof like an all-inclusive resort. happy hour was nice and then we returned for a delicious dinner... Everything was clean and comfortable...thanks Theresa for taking care of our room. We used the balcony often to eat and just hang out.. the view was so beautiful.. it was just what we needed before starting a blah winter in PA.. Thanks again to all of the staff.. our visit was wonderful.. see you next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For Little Children”
Reviews.Author: champ123
Reviews.Content: Since it looked like the last week in September was going to be warm, my wife and I decided to take our 4-year old grandson for a week at the beach. We chose this Holiday Inn for two reasons, First the reviews were very good and second, the outdoor kidde pool was still opened. Our choice was a good one. The kidde pool was large and contained a number of very nice features such as heated water, spouts, water slides, whirlpool, and a lazy river. There is a lifeguard in the kidde pool and threre were plenty of chairs for our stuff. My grandson spent literally hours in the kidde pool each day. There is also a separate outdoor pool and an indoor pool but these do not have lifeguards. The room itself was also clean and nice, It contained a sitting area, kitchen and a separate bedroom with a fairly large balcony overlooking the ocean. The kitchen contained a full stove and refrigerator but the counter space in the kitchen was so small that serious cooking was difficult. However, the balcony contained a dining table and four chairs that seemed to beg for some al fresco dining. For the first day we brought some pre-cooked food (steaks and microwave veggies), warmed them up in the kitchen and ate on the deck. Prep time was 10 minutes and everything turned out fine. The hotel was clean and and the personnel were helpful and friendly. The restaurant was next to the indoor pool so you could actually get carryout from the bar and eat poolside if your kids didn't want to leave the pool. The food at the restaurant was reasonably priced and decent. There are many breakfast places within a quarter mile of the hotel. The location of the hotel in the center of the boardwalk about a mile from the inlet where all the rides are. The hotel offers a number of freebies including fruit at the front desk, parking, towels at the pools, laundry facilities, meals for children under twelve in the restaurants, dish detergents, and newpapers. All in all, I can't think of a better place in Ocean City for a family with small children to stay.

Reviews.Title: “best on the beach”
Reviews.Author: chase92852
Reviews.Content: We were actually on a trip in Williamsburg VA but since we got the condo so cheap decided to head up through DC then over to the coast and down to Virginia Beach and spend the night. We had heard that Virginia Beach wasnt a sight to be missed. Yeah as long as you hadnt been to Ocean City MD. Their boardwalk is incredible. Deep wide beach...long well kept boardwalk with shops and restaurants all down the boardwalk on the ocean side. Since I didnt have my computer which is usually how I pick a hotel/resort I stopped at no less then 5 hotels and wanted to see the actual rooms before checking in. Though I dont expect the Four Seasons Im kinda picky. All the rooms I looked at were ocean front but inside dark and dated. Holiday Inn is seldom my first choice but this hotel is not your standard Holiday Inn. We had a top floor Ocean front room...and their rooms are beautiful. More like a suite with a full kitchen, living area and a hot tub on the balcony. Very light and airy. Would recommend highly. The hotel staff was available for anything we needed. There is a good restaurant on site but hit the boardwalk for the local hangouts.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: mtnwmn
Reviews.Content: This place was extremely nice for Ocean City. There was more room than we could ever use! Kitchen was great, bathroom great! Only problem with the room was curtains wouldnt shut all the way so sunlight woke us up. Other than that it was amazing. I left my pillow and called 2 days later and they shipped it to be for free. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.......but a Little Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: K896
Reviews.Content: Couldn't wait to get to your hotel. Unfortunately, check-in was not a good experience, no smiles to welcome you and usually there is mention if you are a priority reward member, but no mention. Room was lovely and spotless, bed very comfortable, but would have liked an ocean view. Staff taking care of rooms, etc. were very nice. Location of hotel was wonderful, boardwalk right in front of you and your beautiful beach!! Pool area - very nice and not too crowded. Liked best - room, pool and beach; least - some of the front desk staff and food needs to improve in Hemmingways. We expected a bit more from a 4-5 star establishment. Hope to visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Ocean City! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: nyrlisa35
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an oceanfront room with a balcony. The rooms were immaculately clean! Bathrooms were clean too. Loved the full kitchen and separate living room area. My 3 1/2 year old slept on the pull out couch. Baby slept in same room in a pack and play provided by the hotel. The beds were comfortable. Pillows a little lumpy. The view from the outside balcony is awesome. Perfect location on the boardwalk. Don't have to drive anywhere unless you want to drive out to dinner or other activities that aren't on the boardwalk. We slept great....the rooms are quiet. The children's pool section was perfect! My children loved the pool and the adults did too! They have a "lazy river" and whirlpool and also a jacuzzi for the adults. They also have two fun slides. Perfect place to stay for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: NY2VA14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few weeks ago, for our first visit to OC. We chose the hotel for it's location & the fact that it had full kitchens. We like to be able to prepare some of our own food & avoid some of the fast food in the area. The layout of the hotel & room is fine. The hotel itself is run down. Nobody takes any pride in picking up litter in the front of the hotel or in the lobby. The room was not cleaned very well. There was a weird odor after housekeeping had been there. It almost smelled like cigarettes. It's too bad that the hotel is not kept up better. We walked up a few blocks to check out the Hilton. It has a similar layout, but had a noticeable difference in the upkeep of the building. It was clean & maintained so much better. We asked guests in the lobby if their rooms were clean & they said they were. Many guests are repeat guests, who come back every year. Not sure when we'll be in OC again, but next time it will be the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: Andrews_Mommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again for the 10+ time. Each hotel room is a 1 bedroom apartment so the setup is ideal. The hotel is ideally located on the boardwalk -- so kids can ride their bikes and/or take the tram to the end of the boardwalk to the arcade. The hotel pool is awesome -- the pirate ship, slide and pool with the current is a big hit. Room service food is ok -- not the best I've ever had but better than a lot of room service food. Expensive though -- a dinner consisting of salad, drink and dessert around $40. Rooms are expensive and hotel customer service is pretty hit or miss. The hotel is constantly booked so they don't have to do a good job -- because they know the hotel is always overbooked.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, would absolutely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its high ratings on Trip Advisor, and were definitely not disappointed. We booked a "Direct Oceanfront" room, which turned out to be level with the beach, so our balcony had two steps down to the beach, with a wonderful view of the ocean, along with palm trees. Our room was very clean, and the layout was great, with lots of light coming in on two sides of our room. Although we did not swim in the outdoor pool due to cooler temps, we did take advantage of the pool bar, which is a really nice touch and helps enhance the "I'm on vacation!" feeling. The hotel is walking distance to several good places to eat (The Dough Roller (an OC classic), and Dead Freddie's) as well as a beach-supply store. The only negative comment I have is our room was not cleaned until very late in the day, and the housekeeper did not take the dirty coffee cups, wash the coffee pot, or bring fresh cups. Other than that, we loved this hotel, and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: danrodjr
Reviews.Content: This hotel will go out of thier way to please! Loved it, will be a return guest!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeBuyer
Reviews.Content: I moved my family to the Holiday Inn after a terrible experience at nother local hotel. We got a suite overlooking the beach, which was pricey, but well worth it. The staff was friendly, the beach was accessible, and the pool was a dream come true for my kids. The overall experience was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: zambony
Reviews.Content: We paid extra $50+tax (per night) to get an oceanfront view suite instead of oceanfront suite. It is supposed to be a corner suite so that you can see the ocean from two different angles. We got a corner suite but it was on the first floor; the room does not have balcony despite of website description. Since there is a bar for the swimming pool, there is only one view -a tiny view of ocean and tons of pool view. Nice trick to get extra $50 during busy season. I guess your chance of getting this deal is 1/14 as this is 14th floor building. Of course, 2nd floor is also called a "view" suite since it has at least balcony. BTW, we also add breakfast for adults with extra $10. They will give you $20 credit for breakfast per room. But it is probably hard to pay less than $10 per adult. The breakfast is not great at this hotel. Their breakfast buffet ($9.99) do not include coffee or juice. They are both extra. Linens are quite sandy even after we asked to change them. The jacuzzi is also sandy as this is a beach hotel with "great" housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel but will need updates VERY soon and new cleaning staff also!!!”
Reviews.Author: dontstayathome
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Holiday Inn Suites/17th Street for years now and with each year it becomes a bit more rundown. Don't get me wrong....it's a great place but is definately not as nice as it was 10 years ago. The units are in desperate need of updating....new couches/chairs in livingroom, new dressers in bedrooms/livingrooms, new tables on the balcony (ours actually had a piece broken out of it this year and cracked in a different spot) and new kitchen plates, utensils, pots and pans. The cleaning staff did a HORRIBLE job in our unit (7th floor) and I saw them standing around in the hallways and sitting in the units more than anything else. Our beds were NEVER made and only changed once in 7 days after we called and asked them to remove the stained blanket from one of our beds from when we checked in!! Kitchen and bathroom floors weren't swept and the sweeper was never ran in the bedroom. We did call for towels a couple times and they were delivered quickly. The free fruit at the front desk and free USA Today's are wonderful perks. There is also FREE laundry facilities on each floor and 40cent sodas from the vending machines! That's a deal! I love the regular daylight front desk staff (overnight staff is never as nice/great).....there are a couple reps there that have been there for quite a few years along with the managers who are awesome. The gentleman who seems to oversee alot of the employees (i forget his name but we spoke to him briefly while staying there this year....he said he's been there since the 4th floor was being built) is also a super guy and has been there every year since we have stayed. Pools are great (kids pool is always very crowded) and the food and drinks at the pool are good too. Location on the boardwalk is perfect. This hotel has so much going for it but if housekeeping issues and renovation issues aren't soon addressed it will loose alot of business I'm afraid (especially when you are paying almost $500/night in the summer!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place To Stay, Perfect For Kids”
Reviews.Author: caliboo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The pool is perfect for kids. The lazy river is small, but the kids loved it. The slides kept them amused for a while. We got a one bedroom suite, which was pretty spacious, and it had a full kitchen, which was nice. Not sure it was worth almost $500.00 a night, but still, we'd go back. I expect to pay more on the boardwalk. Location is great, roughly the middle of the boardwalk, in the center of everything. I have only 2 complaints. The restaurant here is awful. Coral Reef, I think it's called. Food was awful, service was awful. Bartenders were great, but that is the only part of the restaurant I can recommend. My other complaint was that we did not get either of the two wake up calls we ordered. Had we had something scheduled and missed it, we'd be upset. We were upset anyway, not to have gotten the promised call, but if we had missed an event or something, that would have been even worse. After complaining, we set one for the next day, and were promised it would come through. Alas, it did not. Could be an issue, but didn't affect our day too much. All in all, the perfect place to stay in Ocean City, and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Always an excellent stay....”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunLongIsland
Reviews.Content: Am currently here and having an awesome stay. This is our second stay at this property. The kids 13,11 and 4 love the beach and the pools - especially the water slide. The room is very clean and we have a beautiful view of the ocean. We love the location on the boardwalk. The kitchen has everything we need - except bring a bigger frying pan if you plan on making pancakes. The staff is friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back next year”
Reviews.Author: BeachMama101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights in July with our two children who are 3 and 6. Our suite was great and we loved everything about it. The room was super clean, the beds very comfortable, and having the kitchen is a great feature that allows you to save on eating out all the time (3 meals out is just to much for our kids at there ages). The adult pool does not get over crowded, and while the kids pool is more crowded, it is just so much fun and we took the kids every day. The boardwalk is a flight of stairs down from the pool, so you have a lot of privacy. I can't say enough about how much we loved this hotel and we honestly would not want to stay anywhere else now that we've been here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Firefly20
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice and was very satisfied both times. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the food was great and the location was perfect! My husband and I had an efficiency suite that was very comfortable with a balcony overlooking the ocean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: Very clean room with very comfortable beds. Paid about $500 per night for a 2 queen bed oceanfront suite in July. The suite had a bedroom with 2 queen beds and a flat screen TV. There was a large balcony off the bedroom with a great view of the boardwalk, beach, and ocean. There was a kitchen with a full sized refrigerator, stove, microwave, and dishwasher. It was stocked with pots, pans, plates, glasses, flatware etc. There was a living/dining room area with a table big enough to seat 4-6 people, a sleeper sofa, and another flat screen TV. Our room was on the 5th floor and had a very nice oceanfront view. While the room was fairly expensive, we were not nickel and dimed to death. 12oz cans of Coca Cola products were only 40 cents in the vending machines and there were washers and dryers available for use at no charge. There was free fresh fruit available in the lobby each day. All you can eat breakfast in the restaurant was about $10 plus beverage. The pools were very nice, especially the kiddy pool. I can't wait to come back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “So amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Hollymc228
Reviews.Content: This is seriously the BEST on OCM! I have 2 small children and the pool here is beyond awesome! Perfect for them! Everyday we start at the beach and when they get bored we move up to the pool! My only complaint is the waitress's at the Pool! Do yourself a favor and walk to the bar and get it yourself! Some, not all, of these girls need some waitress training to say the least! Horrible! Anyway, the rooms could use updating for the price of the room.....but love how sound proof they are! Great location and oh yeah go to DaVincis a few streets down if you love real Italian food! Yum! Can't wait for 2012!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in OC!”
Reviews.Author: cimeyers
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 6 nights the last week of July. The hotel was everything we hoped for. My wife and I are both from Maryland and have been going to Ocean City since we were kids. I feel like I have stayed in almost every major hotel there, from The Breakers to the Carousel, and a dozen condos from the inlet to Fenwick. The Holiday Inn Suites on 17th Street is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in at Ocean City. Anyone who has ever been to OC knows that cleanliness is relative; but this place was objectively clean. Our toddler loved the kids pool. She played on the whale and the small fountains and it was great to have a pool where she could stand. In addition to being clean, the room, a king ocean front, was gigantic. Both my wife and I loved the view and the little one loved eating breakfast on the balcony. I liked that we didn’t have to go out for breakfast and lunch every day, as there was a full kitchen and even a dishwasher in the room. The gym was clean and uncrowded (to the extent that is a word). The fruit in the lobby was a nice touch, and the staff was very pleasant. As far as complaints, the bed was a little soft for me, but that is hardly a complaint. The price is also a little higher than most places in OC, BUT, you get what you pay for. It was absolutely worth it. My wife and I agreed that we are going back next year, hopefully for two trips.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: drumclub
Reviews.Content: The Good : Great location, lots of room, great view of the beach and ocean, wonderul service by the bellmen and the front desk, neat (but small) kid's pool. The Bad: Rooms are a bit dated in some areas (stains on living room furniture); Do yourself a favor and do not look under the bed or behind anything or in the corners if you are a clean freak; Kid's pool opens at 9am, so be sure to be there before then to get in line for a table that has an umbrella or a lounge chair. The Ugly: Although the food was pretty good at the hotel restaurant, we had probably the worst service EVER! I actually had a waitress tell me that she had "a million things to do and would get to me shortly" when I asked her for some condiments that should have already been with the meal. In the end, we had used points to stay there and would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “spring Get Away”
Reviews.Author: mjbot
Reviews.Content: Clean Holiday Inn! Right on Beach. In summer season very easy to get to beach and fun. We had suite and if a family wanted to stay here it would be great. Mom can cook dinner and save money. I think for a young family this would be great. You can do the beach and save money by not eating out. Not really our thing but we went to the beach for free from Pittsburgh. If you are on a budget with a young family I think you can be very happy here!

Reviews.Title: “Never Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Baconstrip
Reviews.Content: We continue to stay that at this property year after year....always exceptional service, clean rooms, comfy beds, great food and great location. The gym is great! Newer equipment, always clean and well maintained. This is the only property I've ever stayed at where the washers and dryers are free! Such a great amenity, I wish all beach properties offered this.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Backoftheboard
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Holiday Inn on the boardwalk for about the fifth time in the last ten years. The staff is always friendly and very helpful. The rooms are clean and spacious although they are due for some updating i.e. losing the wallpaper, replacing carpet, etc. Our kids always love the activity pool as well. Only problem with the place is the price. Like everything in Ocean City, MD you pay way too much for the quality that you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but in need of an update.”
Reviews.Author: flashfearless
Reviews.Content: We usually stay here when visiting Ocean City because of the amenities and location. You can't argue with being able to walk the boardwalk at will and with the nice pools. It is nice having a mini kitchen, but the rooms are in need of attention and updates. For the huge bend over prices this place charges, I think that I expect better. Some items of concern: 1) The worst showerhead in the business; bring a cup to get the sand and shampoo out of your hair because this thing wouldn't even rinse off your sunscreen. 2) The hotel room door rattled and was loose, causing anyone who sleeps in the front room to lose sleep. 3) Noisy dishwasher 4) Hardware on sliding glass door broken for lock 5) Not enough parking 6) Beds need updating.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families-we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelergirl007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn at Ocean City for three nights and four days. It truly was a great hotel and very customer-service oriented. The location was great-right on the beach, but a bit of a walk to the amusement park (located on First St). The rooms were always cleaned and the suite was a nice size. The kitchen was great and even had a full-size refrigerator. We ordered room service from the cafe downstairs and the food was very good. The two pools are great and the hotel even has a gameroom. I wish we could have stayed longer, because there are many things to do in and around Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “MEDIOCRE HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MPMAZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nites on spur of moment trip. Rooms are well worn and dated, but satisfactorily cleaned. Public spaces NOT CLEAN. Hotel is run by kids and it shows. Excellent kidde pool, but poorly cleaned with garbage floating in pool and at bottom at days start, Lifeguards excercise little control over rowdy kids who ruin it for the rest- bringing in full sized boogie boards. Lured in with "KIDS EAT FREE" with and adult pitch, WHICH IS A JOKE. We got breakfast buffet and were told 7 year old had to order off kids menu...FINE. BUT THEY BROUGHT HIM A PLATE WITH A SINGLE PANCAKE AND SINGLE SLICE OF BACON....NO JOKE! THEN CHARGED US AS IF HE HAD EATEN BUFFET. Pure pandemonium, food LOUSY to boot. DONT EAT HERE! The only thing this place has going for it is a great location on boardwalk & ocean. Haven't stayed in a HOLIDAY INN for years and NOT GOING BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: phishlover
Reviews.Content: If you want to be able to walk the Boardwalk in the morning or stroll at night after dinner, step out onto the beach from your hotel, and walk to numerous other attractions and restaurants this is the place for you. We have been going to this hotel for over 10 years, having decided not to invest in a condo. For a small family not on a tight budget it is great. The only reason we do not rate it a "5" is that it is starting to show a little age and the rooms need a makeover in terms of furniture and furnishings. The Coral Reef Restaurant is a nice casual eating area adjacent to the indoor pool which is a decent size but not huge. The food is good. Hemingway's Restaurant, off the lobby, is more upscale and even though we have never chosen to dine in it, my wife's boss raves about it and goes to it even though he does not stay in the hotel. The front desk staff could not be more courteous, pleasant and helpful. The typical room has two queen size beds and a decent sized flat screen tv; a small kitchette, and a dining/seating area with a sleep sofa. The bathroom is large with a jacuzzi and double sink. All rooms have safes. Our experience with housekeeping has been marvelous. We always feel compelled to leave a tip. There is a decent sized outdoor adult pool and bar with food and a great, great kids outdoor pool. There is sufficient parking for one vehicle per room. However, there is on street parking in the general vicinity. Now the downside. In-season the roomrates are approaching $500 a night for an ocean front room. We think it worth it but others might not. Anyway, at those rates we feel it's time for a spruce up of the facility. But for now, we plan on going back soon. There just aren't as many hotels/motels on the Boardwalk as good as this.

Reviews.Title: “Best I've stayed at OCMD”
Reviews.Author: misc03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best, cleanest hotel I've stayed in at Ocean City. I know there may be more around that I didn't see, but from all of them that I've stayed, this is the best. The suites have lots of room and the appliances are more than sufficient. The jacuzzi tubs in each room is a great extra touch. The restaurants are excellent and even serve you poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, rooms just need a bit more cleaning”
Reviews.Author: LetsGetaway98
Reviews.Content: My family & I visit OC every summer and have stayed at this hotel since it opened. We love the layout and the oceanfront rooms are great to go out and enjoy the ocean from the balcony. My only complaint is for at least the past 3-4 years, every time we arrive, the room isn't as clean as I would like. We find food under the sofa when we pull out the hide a bed and there seems to be leftover dirt in alot of areas all over the room. I'm sure the housekeeping staff is on a tight schedule, but when you pay hundreds of dollars for a room per night, it would nice to know it had been thoroughly cleaned before you arrive. We like the fact there are laundry facilities on each floor and we can wash our beach towels, but this year, the laundry room/vending machine room had a horrible odor the entire time we were there. Other than that, we love the hotel. The front desk staff are always friendly & courteous and if we have needed extra towels, they bring them within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool and nice room”
Reviews.Author: jodim
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a short weekend. Got there at 1pm and our 8th floor room was ready. We received a parking pass and was lucky enough to get a spot right by the entrance. Left our car there and never moved. We got wrist bands for the pool and towel cards. Room: living room with tv, small table, sofa bed, cushioned chair. Hall with full kitchen. Bath with whirlpool 2 person tub, bedroom with door with 2 queens and tv, balconey with table and chairs. Bath had shampoo, lotion, makeup remover, shower caps, bath salts. We dod not really use kitvhen but had coffee, dishwasher, full fridge. Warning: sofa bed is not comfortable. Just a super thin mattress with springs. Pillows were plump so bring your own if you like flat ones. Pool: My kids (12,10,8) went to the beach, washed off their feet at the hose, and played in the pool for hours. They have a pool 3-5 feet oval on one side. The other side has a kid pool with adult hot tub overlooking kid area. There is a small and large slide, lazy river, 3 foot pool, whirlpool. Not many umbrellas or tables but plenty of available chairs. Area: Captains Table(yum), minature golf, Philips, ice cream are within walking distance. Sad: Got woken up at 2pm from neighbors on the balcony. Called front desk to complain but had a hour of laughing and hearing the conversation even with our slider closed. I was close to the slider so could hear it more. So sad that people would do that!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: SunloverMaryland
Reviews.Content: We headed to OC for a girls weekend with my Mom, my 2 daughters and a friend. (5 girls) We checked in around 11:30 on a Thursday night. Our first impressions of our rsuite and the hotel were very good. The room was spacious and well laid out. Full kitchen, jacuzzi tub & rain shower, dining table, fold out sofa, and a large balcony with a great view of the awesome pools and the ocean. The hotel itself is really nice. It has 3 great pools, nice resteraunts, very conveniant location and pleasant front desk. However, my reason for the lower rating was because of the housekeeping. I would have easily given an "Excellant" rating if not for the housekeeping issues. When we arrived late Thursday night I called the front desk to request an extra blanket and pillow cases for the pillow for the fold out sofa. (No pillow cases on the pillows?) After about an hour no one had come yet. I had 2 young girsl to get to bed and it was well after midnight. Not to mention, the tile floors were really gross to walk on, there was trash under the fold out and on the floor alongside the bed, the bathroom and the toilet needed to be wiped down, we requested extra towels from the housekeeper and never got them, there was one small working light in the bathroom and the rest weren't fixed until the next day, we had to sit the trash can in the middle of the floor in order to get it emptied and take a roll of toilet paper from the cart. So, hotel management...if you are listening, you might want to pay closer attention to your housekeeping staff, because they are LAZY and based on some conversations I heard from them in the halls they don't care about their jobs. Also, supposed to be free wifi, but we never found the signal. Maybe, it was just me but I don't think so. Very limited conveniant parking, but extra lots across the street. Thankfully, I got good parking after driving around a bit. Overall, I would go back and give it another try.

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous hotel, just steps from the beach”
Reviews.Author: A_and_Ls_mom
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn and Suites was a beautiful place to stay for our vacation in Ocean City. You literally walk out of the hotel, go down a flight of steps and you are on the boardwalk with the beach just a few feet farther. We stayed in a two-room suite with a full kitchen which was very luxurious. My husband and I had our privacy and the kids had everything they needed in the living room with a pullout couch. All the staff was very friendly and attentive. The only complaint I had was about the housekeeping staff. For some reason our room was never cleaned when we came back in the afternoons. We were at the end of the hall and they must have been planning to clean our room last. Twice we had to call for them to come and clean in the late afternoon (3 pm or so) and once we just called for extra towels. We probably could have resolved the issue if we had talked to the front desk but we just kept expecting our room to be cleaned when we came back from the beach after lunch. We were still very happy with our stay and would stay there again - just make sure we talked to housekeeping about when the room needed to be cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is over rated! Priced too high”
Reviews.Content: This hotel for the price IS NOT WORTH IT.It's more money to stay than the Hilton? this is an average hotel,nothing spectacular.The rooms aren't as nice as they look .The bathroom looked nice but you had to be in their a long time to get the soap off and rinse the shampoo from your hair,the jucuzzi tub did not work.The beds were uncomfortabel,and so was the sofa in the living area.We could hear the people up stairs from us. the blackout drapes was not thick enoght on the sliding glass doors, the sun woke us up at 6:00a.m. every morning.The nice thing is the hotle is ocean front and on the board walk,and the pool area was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: alikatt18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our family vacation and it was the best time! We had 2 handicapped people with us and they were able to walk out of their room to the pool and beach. It was great! Grandma could watch the kids play on the beach from a shady spot by the pool! The kids loved the mini waterpark at the hotel! We have been to ocean city many times but this was the best! We are already planning our return trip for next year! We will stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean rooms, wonderful location, amazing kids' pool!”
Reviews.Author: MicheleInMD
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Holiday Inn in a suite. Our room was spacious, clean, and wonderful for our family of four. Only negative, was that we were on the 4th floor, near the street (not the ocean) so we got the noise from the hotel air conditioners beside our balcony, and the noise from the street (heavy, loud, traffic/horns/mufflers) whenever the ac units weren't running. We complained, but there were no other rooms available. DEFINITELY request a high floor and ocean front. As nice as the ocean front would be, I'd hate to be on the first few floors there, since they over look the two pools, which were also incredibly noisy during our stay. The pools were amazing. Two areas...one for adults, and one for kids. The kids pool had two slides (suitable for little ones) and a crazy whirlpool area that my tweens thought was great. We couldn't get them out until they were so tired they could hardly stand. Worked for us :) Our immaculate suite included a wonderful king-sized bed, flat screen TV and DVD player in the bedroom, a queen sleeper sofa, Flat screen TV, VHS player, and table and 4 chairs in the "living room" and a full size fridge, oven, stove, microwave, toaster, dish washer, and coffee maker in the galley kitchen between the two rooms. The bathroom included a whirlpool tub and rain shower head. It was great, but I can't imagine anyone with mobility challenges getting in and out of that shower (in the jacuzzi tub) without assistance. The sides of the jacuzzi/shower were very high. Fresh fruit in the lobby daily :) Overall, I think the best place to stay on the boardwalk...and perfect views of the Air Show from the pool and beach directly in front. Felt like VIPs!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul5795
Reviews.Content: The suite was big, with a separate kitchen and living room, and a big tub with a rainfall shower. Check-in went smooth, and we got free parking very close to the hotel. Location is great right on the Boardwalk. Pools were nice (one sort of kiddie pool, separated from a more adult pool). Although our suite was on the first floor and just steps from Reception, it was very quiet. We got an excellent deal through Expedia unpublished rates -- only $104 (plus taxes and fees) per night. Because of that, we did not manage to get a suite with a view, but our suite had a very nice terrace (with table and chairs) that opened out on to the pool area. This could have been a problem had the pool been open late into the night, but it closed at 6 PM -- probably because it was Senior Week at OC and the hotel did not want a bunch of drunken high school kids in the pool area late at night. That worked out great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: emvf
Reviews.Content: We had ants in our 12th floor room, bird poop baked on balcony furniture, dishes & silverware had to be washed (lipstick on a glass in the cabinet), breakfast room service was 90 min. late, next day went to cafe for breakfast, coffee carafe had crud on outside. Roomate had diarrhea all night from Hemingway's meal & stale rolls. Drinks at dinner & at pool couldn't taste any alcohol. In the rush to leave, I left my ipod on the night stand. I called later that evening and reported it. I was told everyone was gone for the day and it was not in lost and found. I called the following day and spoke with Joe. He told me Steve would go look for it and call me back but Brenda was in charge of lost and found and was gone for the day. No one called me back that day. I called the following day and no one was available to help me. Finally, Monday morning Brenda called and said my ipod was not in lost in found and hung up. I stayed there for 5 night and this is all the response I got. Next year I'll be at the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Undoubtedly it is a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: sunngod
Reviews.Content: This hotel in many respects is what you would expect to find in a typical Holiday Inn. It looks like a relatively new hotel, but as with any beach hotel they seem to age very quickly. The room itself seemed to be a tale of different eras. You enter into a dark living room. It is reminiscent of something from the 90s. There is an odd ceramic tile floor that seems totally out of place. There is a sleeper sofa and a TV. You then enter into the 80's with a very basic kitchen and the absolutely least expensive appliances and cabinets money can buy. We are talking lower than builders grade quality. The facet leaked like crazy. The refrigerator made a loud noise when it kicked on, but that was easily drowned by the dishwasher which sounded like a jet engine. We didn't use the stove, and it looked very clean and hardly used. The bathroom still carried the 80's theme with the exception of some nice wall tile. The shower curtain was missing several hooks and appeared to be in bad need of replacement. The drop ceiling was rusted. The bath tub looked like it had been caulked by a 5 year old. Not the worst I have seen, but considering the cost of the room it was a bit of a letdown. Finally into the modern era. The bedroom was very nice. New furniture, bedding, carpet and curtains. The balcony was nice. We had a 14 floor room with an amazing view. There are table and chairs on the balcony. The pool area was very crowded. Lots of people hoarding chairs. By 11am it was impossible to find one. Well, let’s be correct. There were plenty that were empty, and many stayed empty the entire day except for the towels that people placed on them. The hotel really should create a storage place around the pool for people to store their items and keep the chairs open for people that are actually going to sit in them. The same is true for tables. Especially around lunch. They should be reserved for people that are eating, and not for holding a cooler and beach toys. The only real negatives we experienced were the AC didn't work the first night. It was 74 degrees in our room. We called down and a tech arrived within 30 mins. He messed around with it for about 15 mins and said he fixed it. Well he got it down to 73 degrees and still very humid. The next morning I asked the front desk and they said they would send someone up. At 4pm it was still 74 degrees and I called down again. They apologized and said there was a mistake and would send someone back up. The new tech arrived and said there was a part that was bad, and fixed the issue. The room finally started cooling down. The other issue we had was that our neighbors decided to have a party on their balcony at 11:30pm. I called the front desk and they said they would take care of it. Within 5 mins the screaming and yelling stopped and all was quiet. Overall it is a good hotel. I don't think it is a great value for the quality that you are receiving. I probably wouldn't stay here again. I would probably stay at the Hilton which is about the same price, and is nicer, but doesn't have the boardwalk location.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for a better hotel in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Travels_with_JLB
Reviews.Content: First time in OC .... traveling with my wife and we took a couple of days to unwind here. I could not be more pleased! Everything is first-class, and the view of the ocean from our 7th floor suite is magnificent. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. From the moment you walk into the hotel till the moment you leave, you will find little to complain about here. You are met on the ground floor by a charming young man who gladly assists you with your luggage cart, with getting you an elevator, opening doors for you, and gladly answering any questions you have. The front desk staff is exceptional and will go above and beyond to make your stay the best it can be. Ask for Meaghan when making your reservations. She is an angel! The suite we had was an end unit with 2 queen beds. The suite was enormous with both bay and oceanfront views, and also side ocean and bay views. Comfy, comfy, comfy! 2 large flat screen tv's so hubby and I could each watch our shows at night. An awesome walk in shower with three showerheads, including a rainfall showerhead. Jacuzzi tub in the room that was more than big enough for the two of us (but we didn't get a chance to use it). New kitchen with all the necessities. Big fluffy towels and all the little extras like bath salts, shower caps, body lotion and more. And the food in the cafe when we had breakfast was served good and hot by a very attentive waitress who never made us ask for coffee or juice refills. All three of the pools were in use during our stay and the kiddie pool almost made me wish I was 8 again. Water slide, whirlpools, and a whale that sprays the little ones all looked like so much fun! All in all, I highly reccommend the Holiday Inn Suites on 17th St in Ocean City Md. I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: mdgal24
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to OC in 20 years, but my mother had never been despite living more than half her life in Maryland. So I took her and my fiancee in the off-season. It was the best time to be there! No crowds! I researched hotels carefully and found this one. Great location, bedroom facing the ocean, restaurant on premises. Mom just couldn't get over how nice the room was and loved going on the balcony to look at the ocean. The food was really good, especially their crab dip, which I'm particular about. I can't really find one thing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: mogleonard
Reviews.Content: Came down for a golf weekend and though the weather was a little cold the accomodations were great.Joe (concierge) and his staff made sure we had everything.I will be going down again soon with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite for a girls' night out”
Reviews.Author: amysavona
Reviews.Content: Five girlfriends and I recently stayed here. Perfect for a girls' night out - the stocked kitchen and ample space in the living area allowed us to have a few drinks and some conversation before we went out. Conveniently located for pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. Great service and very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Ocean front”
Reviews.Author: JTBrooke
Reviews.Content: We had a great room and experience at the holiday inn on 17th street. We ate at the bar, which was very good food and then our room was clean and we slept great. The rate was good and we couldn't believe the views. It was a five star night. I will be stating there any time I am in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: cheertravels
Reviews.Content: travelled with a large group for a cheerleading convention and some checked out because of bed bugs in their room. looked out our 3rd floor window and sure enough there was a huge dumpster filled with discarded mattresses and box springs! the holiday inn oceanfront has roaches as well.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of heaven.....”
Reviews.Author: Yahna
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel on Saturday, March 12th during the St. Patricks Day celebration. We ABSOLUTELY LOVED it!. We stayed in an Oceanfront room. Even though it was off season, it was beautiful. Everything was clean and the bed was so comfortabe. it was wonderful waking up and being able to see the ocean from our bed. Our room was a jacuzzi suite which was another extra added perk. the staff was pleasant and professional. A special thank you to Natalie, Kevin and there was another gentleman at the front desk when we checked in that was very patient and pleasant....maybe Milo???????? ....not sure .....but thank you.........if you are looking for a place for a quick romantic getaway...off season....this is the place.....probably not best off season if you want to take advantage of the restaurants and so forth. I think most places open for the season on april 1st. We are already talking about when we are coming back and bringing our family and friends.....we would ABSOLUTELY stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Snobs”
Reviews.Author: Fanny_65
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the rudest employees I have ever encountered! I usually stay with Holiday Inn, and this has to be the worst staffed hotel. If you like snobs and people who don't care about their job, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the sunrise over the ocean-without leaving bed”
Reviews.Author: jessnmike
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed here in the off season the prices were still a bit steep- BUT that being said you get what you pay for. Stay was very nice, rooms were clean- no carpets in our room. The view was AMAZING! Balcony was a nice size, table and chairs so you could dine overlooking the beach/boardwalk. Location is right on the boardwalk so it's easy to get to and from beach. Bed was so-so although I'm very picky. Large rooms- separate bathroom, living, eating, and bed areas. Bedroom had it's own door so if you have people come to your room you can still feel at home with your privacy. Two large tvs. Basically felt like I was in an apartment with the size! There was limited things open around the town but they provide you with menus of local places so you can call around and see whats good and open. Also had a book of things to do. Friendly staff. Always someone around if you needed towels or a question answered. Indoor pool in the dining area, nice size gym as well. Very big outdoor pool as well (closed so not sure how that was). Best point- watching the sunrise on our balcony during our stay. It was perfect. Worst point- if you're looking for a lot to do and like to have a lot of options as far as dining is concerned don't go during off season.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl Let Down ... Dirty room and rude”
Reviews.Author: ralston0123
Reviews.Content: Arrived Feb 4 2011 early evening,checked in ... staff at the front desk were wonderful (wish they had been who we dealt with the whole 3 days we were there). Went up to our room unpacked and started to get ready to go out for the evening ... noticed the bathroom was filthy. The toilet looked like it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. Headed out, stopped at the front desk and told them the problem in which they said it would be dealt with right away. Came back from a n evening out and toilet was clean. Next day getting ready for the day ... I'm questioned by my sister as to if I had already had a shower? I hadn't and she pointed out the there was an open bottle of shampoo and used soap sitting on the to ledge!!! Called down to the front desk and was assured it would be cleaned right away. It was quite a while before someone showed up. The room attendant told me she had cleaned the room, so I showed her what we found .... next thing you know it wasn't she who had done this .... there was another attendant working that does a very poor job. (own it girl, it was your fault) The next day is Super Bowl, we head out enjoy the day and sights come back to our room and see that it had not been attended to ... no coffee, no coffee cups the usual things replenished each day. Get ready to go out to a local Steelers Bar to watch the 2nd half of the game ... ask the guy at the front desk to please call us a cab ... at that he noticed my Steelers shirt and made a few unsolicited comments on how he doesn't like the Steelers (When you're in the hospitality industry you don't bash your customers)... calls a cab company tells them where we want to go and hangs up and says hmm that wasn't much help and pretty much says the cab wouldn't take us to the bar we wanted to go to because they celebrate the Steelers ... Calls us another cab says it will be there with in 5 minutes. We waited 20 minutes and I went back in to let him know it had not shown up ... he was busy playing with his cell phone hardly looked up at me and said it will get here in a minute. (he was sooooo rude!!!!) Next morning opened a packet of coffee we had brought with us and drank our morning coffee from bowls!!! Upon check out I was asked how our stay was in which I told him everything I just wrote in this review, and they guys says ... sorry to hear about that!!! We really weren't all that full not to get service. Have a nice trip home!! WE WILL NEVER EVER STAY HERE AGAIN. Would not recommend to my worse enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suebar1958
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been visiting Ocean City in the summer for many years with our entire family. About 10 years ago we came back for a few days in the winter,just the two of us for a romantic get away. At first we tried several hotels, then one year we stayed at the Holiday Inn on 17th Street. We never stayed anywhere else since. We love the way the hotel decorates for Christmas. The place is very clean,has a wonderful staff and the room is an excellent place to stay. Nothing like taking a nice hot jacuzzi in the bathroom and then sitting out on the private balcony watching the ocean to relax . A paper is delivered out side your door every morning. Free fruit is available in the lobby and a high speed internert connection is free in every suite. This year we brought our 4 year old granddaughter along. We took her to the Winterfest of Lights,swam in the indoor pool(which we had all to ourselves),ate at Grotto's pizza,Waterman's Seafood and Coin's. Played games in the hotel game room,watched movies,walked on the beach and a mostly empty boardwalk and had a wonderful time. My granddaughter cried when we had to leave for home. She wanted to stay at the hotel.I got a great rate online for the room(less than $90 a night) and believe me it was worth much more. So if you want to spend some time in Ocean City in the winter, stay at the Holiday Inn. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond, they have a "quality" department!”
Reviews.Author: Roadtripsgalore
Reviews.Content: I called for an extra blanket for the sofa bed, he came right away. While he was here I complained someone nearby was smoking (in the non-smoking section) it was getting into our room. Within 5 minutes he returned with this little amazing ozone machine from a "quality" department. Worked so well I want one at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeyDaNut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a copuple of days including Thanksgving. We took a jacuzzi suite on the smoking floor. Excellent! Anteroom: Sleep sofa seats 2-3, comfy chair, dining table & 4 chairs, flat panel TV on 3-drawer dresser (has pillows for the sleep sofa), VCR (really! The DVD is in the bedroom), couple of lamps. Kitchen: well-equipped with utensils, plates, a few cooking pots/pans, dishwasher, microwave, can opener, blender (yay!), fridge, stove, and coffeemaker. Hotel supplies two each decaf & regular coffee in filter pouches as well as sugar, pink sweetener, powdered creamer & a stirrer in three or four packs. Bathroom: dual sinks, good-sized three-head shower, regular commode. Sunlamp (I think) and built-in hairdryer. Hotel supplies nice soap (citrus mint when we were there), individual mouthwash, conditioner, shampoo, shower caps. Bedroom: Roomy, equipped with 2-person jacuzzi (bedoom jacuzzi available ONLY in select rooms; some rooms have the jacuzzi in the bathroom), mirrored closet, 4-drawer drsser, TV cabinet with a couple of drawers, flat panel and DVD, upholstered chair, king bed, 2 nightstands. The bed was uncomfortable to both of us but I have recently had back surgery and we have a ridiculously expensive memory foam mattress (worth it, let me assure you!) to compare to, so that's a little unfair. They provide 2 soft and 2 firm pillows with indicators for which are which. I liked the firm, my wife felt no difference. Balcony: Table, 4 chairs. Sliding glass door and screen. The 2 windows don't open! Opening the balcony door airs out the place reasonably well. We opened the room door also and almost got knocked down by a few gusts! The hotel provides extra towels at the jacuzzi and some bath salts. We used them and our own bubble powder at different times. Ocean City water seems to be quite hard and nothing could raise more than a faint mat of sad little bubbles that clung to each other but eventually gave up. The jacuzzi is roomy enough for two Americans or three Europeans. It may hold as many as... oh, I'd better not. We ordered room service twice, dinnner the day we arrived and the "pre-order" breakfast (you'll find a form on the nightstand) the day we left. Both meals were delivered when they said they would be and the quality was good. Both orders had exactly one error-- incorrect side order, wrong beverage. A correction was not requested as the errors were actually preferable-- the fries served were delicous sweet potato and the wrong drink was an orange juice for apple juice and my wife says, "Oh, sheesh, I meant to tell you to get me an OJ." And there it was. Maybe the hotel is psychic? There was an 18% "service charge" for the dinner we ordered so be careful about adding a tip The breakfast states there is an 18% gratuity added to the price so, again, be careful about adding a tip. The suite was well-presented at arrival, very orderly and clean. The dishes all were spotless as were the eating utensils. Everything except the very back of the top of the fridge was dusted. The staff were all pleasant and polite. This did not come cheap. We did pay quite a bit but we did get quite a trip. I am confident in saying you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “great and relaxing weekend in the fall season”
Reviews.Author: vistacruiser69
Reviews.Content: just returned from a wonderful weekend at the holiday inn suites in ocean city, and the report is all good, with nothing to complain about...the location in town was ideal, and the off-season pace was ideal, too, though many things shut down after summer, enough going on to enjoy being there....from what i hear, summer is crazy, so fall is ideal for my needs...you can walk out of the hotel right on the boardwalk and walk for miles....renting a bike for an hour was great!...sunsets from the inlet and pier are beautiful...the suites are very comfortable and luxurious by my standards..we had a southern view balcony, with a great view of the beach and town and bay since we got a lucky draw on the 7th floor...most of the front desk staff was friendly, and our housekeeper was very nice...had such a pleasant fall weekend there that am already looking forward to a winter escape, too!...ps--don't forget to sleep with the balcony door open!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ON the boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: BestPlacesintheUSA
Reviews.Content: We were here in the off-season and because of Priority Club got upgraded to the top floor. It was AWESOME, and we couldn't have beat the price off the strip! We fell asleep every night with the patio door open and the sound of the waves, and we awoke every morning to the sunrise. It just doesn't get any better than that. We ate most of our meals on the balcony since we had a kitchenette. We never used the indoor pool,opting for the beach instead. Our floor even had free laundry, and the parking was free, too. I highly recommend this hotel in Ocean City, right on the boardwalk. To save money, go in the off-season. It's quieter then anyway.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Back. Helpful booking tip.”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelohyeah
Reviews.Content: Positives: We were here a year ago and this time our stay was also very good. Friendly staff, room was a little smelly but it aired out within a half hour. Room was spacious with a living room, bath and kitchen area, then bedroom which opened to a balcony overlooking the ocean. Ample free parking even for bigger rigs like a camper. Loved the balcony and the sound of the ocean all night long. It was windy that weekend but we were protected from it and could enjoy being outside. Negative: We had to flush the toilet at least twice, sometimes three times to get everything gone. The drain in the shower was annoyingly slow. Tip: I booked through Southwest Airlines. Expedia, Travelocity, Orbitz and Hotels.com were all $20 or more a night for the SAME room and you had to pre-pay. Southwest had the best price and they didn't require full payment. In fact they said payment would be made at check-out. Yes, you still are required to use a credit card number when you do your reservation, but no charges were made to ours until we checked out. Also, we originally book one for one night. We decided to extend our stay but the Hotel staff said weekend rates were higher. We used our iphone to access Southwest's website, found the rate was $10 less a night than the rate the hotel staff quoted, showed them Southwest's quote and the hotel agreed to give us the room for that rate. That's great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly relaxing in a peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: ashlydr
Reviews.Content: We had a great fall weekend oceanside - too rainy to swim outdoors (pool or beach), then head to the indoor pool. The resturaunt had ambiance and a nice selection. the rooms were great and very comfortable. Sleeping was easy! Being right on the boardwalk there were also a lot of opportunities for other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great girls getaway!”
Reviews.Author: sunnytravels29
Reviews.Content: There were five of us that slept comfortably (one of us brought an inflatable mattress) in this suite-type hotel. Very spacious with a full kitchen dividing the bedroom and living area. The hotel pools (one for adults and one for kids, also includes a large hot tub) were open pre-Memorial Day weekend...one of the few hotels on the boardwalk which has the pool elevated up a story from the boardwalk (lots of privacy from the public eye). Great location, walkable to lots of things right on the boardwalk. We paid a very reasonable $220(approx)/night but looks like rates at least double during peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on the East Coast”
Reviews.Author: Jake1432
Reviews.Content: Best hotel. Great views. Best pool on East Coast for little kids. so fun! Hotel is super expensive but if you go right before summer or in September, rates are reasonable. If you stay there- try the crab sherry soup. We order alot of it. It is the best soup.

Reviews.Title: “Still Okay, but getting dingy”
Reviews.Author: traveling81
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have stayed here now every year for about 7 years. Sometimes 2-3 times a year. This hotel is owned by Harrison Hospitality, who also owns many of the poorer rated hotels in Ocean City. (Harrison Hell..I mean Hall, Plim Plaza) They have a reputation for having one hotel that is like the flagship, and then they leave the rest fall in to disrepair. The old flagship was the Quality Inn next to this hotel. Then they built this Holiday Inn, and let that one slide. About 3 years ago, they opened up the Hilton on 30th street as thier new flagship, and they have let the Holiday in slide now. We have stayed here repeatedly because we like being on the boardwalk, and it is the nicest option if you want to be able to walk to everything. Since the Hilton opened, the rooms are noticably dirtier, and the staff is less than accomodating. In my two stays there this year, both rooms were fairly run down looking. Couch cushions needed to be replaced. They Bathroom showhead had nasty buildup all over it. Everything just seemed unclean. I have also had issues with parking, and there not being spots. They are not good about keeping non guests out their lots. The Hilton has an automatic gate..guess thats cost too much to install here also. The internet (both wired, and wireless) was not working one night during my stay. I needed to do work..and they basically told me tough...it will be fixed tomorrow. It all really is a shame because this really is a nice hotel, and all it would take is a little TLC to have a experiance similar to to Hilton. That should not be hard at $450-$500 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Holiday Inn I've Visited”
Reviews.Author: Dad-With-Two-Kids
Reviews.Content: This is not your streotypical Holiday Inn. I've been to a number of Ocean City hotels on or near the boardwalk and this is the best one except for the Hilton and the possibly the Dunes Manor. It is next to the Quality Inn on the Boardwalk and is the more upscale of the two - but more expensive. It is a hard call which we will return to next year. The Quality Inn is more than adequate. We shall see. A big plus is the location. It is up the boardwalk enough not to be noisy at night, but not too far from the shops, restaurants, etc. Also, it is within walking distance off the boardwalk to a Catholic Church, CVS pharmacy, mini golf, and assorted takeout places. Our efficiency room was very nice and clean. The restaurant was adequate but we liked the Quality Inn restaurant better. The restaurant is next to the indoor pool which is nicer than the Qulaity Inn's indoor pool. The outdoor kid's pool outside is exceptional and is shaded by the hotel in the afternoon. The bottom line is that the inside of the hotel and its rooms are a bit nicer, show less wear and tear, and the furniture nicer than the Quality Inn. but it comes at a premium price.

Reviews.Title: “Another awesome stay at Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: elon1989
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for about the last 5 years. The staff is wonderful and very professional. They all seem to go out of their way to ensure that we enjoy our stay. If you have kids, this place is must! The property has an activity pool with a water slide and a lazy river and there is another outside pool that is catered more to the adults, including a pool bar! The bartenders at the outside bar could not be any friendlier. They remember us from year to year and they even remember what all us of drink. They are the best . The front desk staff is great and see that everything that you need when you check in is taken care of. The manager is very "visable" and very polite and always has a nice thing or two to say to our kids. Joe the concierge could not be any friendlier and will go out of his way to meet any of your needs. He has called a top restaurant for reservations for us and then called a cab to take us there and gave us his "complimentry cab" card. We really like this place and I am sure you will be happy as well!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation at the Perfect Hotel with a First Class Staff”
Reviews.Author: RDH1inc
Reviews.Content: I have traveled and stayed in upscale hotels all over the world. The overall experience my family and I had this summer was second to none. The wonderful accommadations in a perfect location is difficult to beat. The rooms, pools, parking areas, restaurants, and lobby area were clean, the service was awesome, and the entire staff had a very friendly manner each day. I was amazed at the cleanliness with the amount of traffic going through the hotel each day. The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful throughout the week. Any reasonable request we had was granted with a friendly smile. As parents with teenage children we were very pleased with the feeling of safety in the hotel. We felt very comfortable allowing our children to travel back and forth to our room on their own. The location is so special with so many activities and restaurants around you, that you could stay a week and never need a car. Also, with a location at 17th street, you are a short walk to all of the excitement on the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location, great views”
Reviews.Author: KarenY_9
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel right on the ocean with oceanfront balcony, full kitchen. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Hotel has a restaurant (which we didn't use), three pools (one indoors) and most anything else you'd need for a stay at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Why is the indoor pool so cold and why is the outdoor one closed by 6p?!!!!”
Reviews.Author: darlin249
Reviews.Content: Its utterly ridiculous to me why a hotel would have 3 pools and then close them at 6 pm. WHY? If you are looking to use the pool for a nice evening swim here forget it. Even the indoor pool is freezing cold. For the money they get for the hotel rooms, they can't afford to heat the water? As previous reviewers mentioned, people "saving" beach chairs is a problem too. The location is good, but I paid a high price for the use of the pools and was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BLONDIE111977
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean. was quite,lots of room. bathroom was big, as well as the bedroom, and livingroom, staff was excellant.right on the boardwalk, beds were just right, tvs in livingroom and bedroon ,plus dvd players vcr, coffee pot,microwave, fridge,freezer,stove,it is really nice will stay here again and plan to soon

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here for 3 nights and 4 days...”
Reviews.Author: kasjmdcfd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and 4 days. Our first time to Ocean City. We tried the Hilton but it was booked and they reccomended Holiday Inn. Location was excellent and the suite layout worked well. The hotel itself could have been cleaner and needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in OC MD”
Reviews.Author: McGJJJ
Reviews.Content: In the past we have always stayed at smaller, less expensive places a block or 2 from the beach. This year we decided to splurge and try this Holiday Inn on the boardwalk.... probably twice as expensive as the place we stayed last year. The oceanfront view from our room on the 11th floor was AMAZING! It was too hot to sit out on the deck in the morning with the direct sun, but by early afternoon it was partially shaded with a great breeze. My kids tried all 3 pools.... the indoor pool was larger than expected but the water too cold for me, I think because it shares the space with a restaurant. Both outdoor pools were nice and warm. They especially loved the kids pool, since it had jets in areas that push you around a whirlpool and river. We thought the room was very nice and clean -- I think from reading some other reviews, it really depends what you are used too. The kitchen was fully equipped with most things needed for cooking -- however, 2 things missing were a cookie sheet-type pan (for baking a pizza or chicken nuggets, etc) and oven mitts. Maybe these were just missing from our particular room ,,... but there really was everything else. The beds were super-comfortable! The kids tried out the jacuzzi tub and liked it but found it's very loud. Location is great... steps to the beach and a 10-20 minute walk to the busier end of the boardwalk with the arcades. The only frustration we had, and this was mentioned in a previous review, is that it is nearly IMPOSSIBLE to find a chair in either outdoor pool area. Guests seem to go out there early in the morning and "reserve" a chair with a towel, and then leave. 2 mornings we were there, from our deck I counted 30-40 "reserved" chairs by 8:30 am when there were no more than 6 people actually in the pool area. And people also tend to reserve a chair for each family member, including little kids, which really isn't necessary. There is a small sign about not leaving belongings on a chair when you leave the pool area but it's ignored. We were lucky to find 1 chair for the 5 of us to share, and a few times I just sat at the edge of the pool with our stuff to watch the kids. It would be great if the hotel could come up with a solution for this, since common sense and consideration is obviously lacking. Overall, we had a great time and would stay here again... though probably not every year because of the higher cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Pool for Kids, Could be Cleaner”
Reviews.Author: lps113
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to OCMD and I was a little apprehensive about it..... I was getting mixed reactions from family and friends about choosing OCMD as a "family vacation." I was told it would be "raunchy", "overcrowded" and "dirty." However, I was pleasantly surprised that it was none of these and our family of five.... kids ages are 10, 9, 5 had a great time. I choose the Holiday Inn Hotels and Suites because of the kids pool..... slides, whirlpools, fountains, etc.... they had a blast and would stay there all day if we let them. The only problem I found was that by 10am all the chairs around the pool had been "reserved" with towels and such so there was never a free chair to sit at. I wish hotels would stop that... it is my pet-peeve in life! Anyway, the pool was great. There are two other pools as well... one indoor (water was very cold) and another outdoor which was more for the adults... but kids could go there too. The hotel itself is in a good location... not so close to the "busy" side of the boardwalk where the amusement park is, but close enough that you could walk there in 20 minutes down the boardwalk or you can get the tram ($3 each way per person... pricey!) The hotel is directly on the boardwalk and the beach is right across. We brought our own chairs and umbrella to set up. The water can be rough. My older children loved boogie boarding in the waves but my 5 year old was fearful of the waves and did not go in the water. The inside of the hotel is OK. It is very expensive for what you get, but ALL the hotels on the beach are this way. The beds were very comfortable, but overall the room was a little outdated and not the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at. However, I would stay there again because of its location and the kids pool. One side note......we ate at Philips all you can eat........a must! Go before 6 or the line will be out the door and around the corner. Go hungry.... !

Reviews.Title: “This Holiday Inn goes further down-hill every year!”
Reviews.Author: Luke1497
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Holiday Inn and Suites in Ocean City (17th Street) almost every year for the last 9-10 years. This year I used Priority Club Points for one of the nights and paid $479+tax for the second night (they did not have any Priority Club rooms available). When I booked the hotel the operator assured me that even though I had two confirmation numbers I would have the same room. When I checked in I explained to the front desk employee that I had two confirmation numbers and she said that it would not be a problem. My family and I got situated the first night and unpacked all of our bags and put everything away. The next afternoon I received a phone call from Jenny at the front desk telling me that I needed to return to the hotel to move my belongings to my new room. She said that they don't have the same room "type" available for me any longer. What does "same room type" mean? Let me explain, I guess when you are a loyal Holiday Inn Priority Club member they don't give you the same rooms as the other guests. From that point forward Jenny at the front desk only said "this is your new room, there is nothing we can do for you, if you want a room tonight this is where you will be staying". Admittedly I dropped from a Platinum level member to a gold level member this year but I still accumulate a lot of points each year with Priority Club. Unfortunately for Holiday Inn, the treatment I received at this property has me reconsidering my loyalty to their chain of hotels. Somebody in management should look up the research that Nielson Research Company did a few years back that shows that 5x as many people hear about a bad experience over a good experience. I will be sure and make ita apoint to tell five times more people about my bad experience at this property than my good experiences!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY FROM START TO FINISH”
Reviews.Author: Mellymel3918
Reviews.Content: My husband, tween daughter (turned 13 on 7/12) and I had the pleasure of staying at this Holiday Inn and Suites from 7/10-7/12. This was our first stay at this Holiday Inn. I booked the reservation back in April using a combination of Priority Club Reward Points and cash. I only had to pay a total of around $225.00 out of pocket for both nights so we only ended up paying around $112.50 per night for a room that normally would book for $449.00 a night which is the nightly rate it was showing as on the web at the time of my booking. If you are not already a member of the Holiday Inn Priority Club Rewards Club then it is definately worth joining. It is free to join and you can rack up a lot of extra bonus points fairly easily through promotions by the program involving stays within a certain time frame, You can also easily rack up big points by subscribing(NEW only) to Direct TV, Netflix,Chase credit card etc to name a few. Just make sure that you register for any of these offers through the Priority Club Website link for any offers for Direct TV, NetFlix, Chase credit card etc or you will not be eligible to receive the points. Now on to my review. A southern view was the only option with booking a Priority Club Rewards night. The room description said that it had a balcony but I expected that we would be facing the street or not have a view of the ocean. Boy, was I surprised! but more about that later. The Holiday Inn was very clean,modern, and inviting from the outside and we were able to find a parking space in the main parking lot by the hotel. There is also a parking area across the street. There was several polite young men assisting with baggage as we entered the lower lobby. There were stairs as well as 4 elevators.The lobby was very inviting with marble floors, nice lighting,railing by the stairs and overall nice decor.There were 2 restaurants on this level as well as an indoor pool. There were 3 guest relations clerks at the reception desk checking in guests which was fantastic as our check in went very quickly and smoothly. This was the best check in experience that I ever had anywhere! Theye also gave you cards to get pools towels which you got back when you turned them in and purple bracelets for everyone in your party to show that you were a Holiday Inn guest. There were also large baskets filled with grapefruit, oranges, and banana's for the guests as well as a basket with packets of bath salts to enjoy in the whirlpool tub in your suite. We checked in with such ease. There was no long wait for one of the 4 elevators even with there being 14 floors. We got to our room on the 8th floor and were so deligthted when we opened the door to our suite. There was a sleeper sofa,table and chairs, chair with ottoman and a flat screen TV to name a few. There was even a ceiling fan. From there,was a hall that contained the kitchen on the left and bathroom on the right. The kitchen contained a fridge, stove,dishwasher, coffee pot with the fixings, toaster, electric can opener. It was also fully furnished with dinnerware,eating utensils,cookware to name a few. It was a fully functioning kitchen ready for use. There was even dishwashing powder,liquid dishwashing detergent, and even a dish towel. The bathroom was large,clean, and spacious with Bath and Body Works amenties provided as well as bath salts(I believe those may have been Crabtree and Evelyn but unsure???) A blowdryer was provided abd the bathroom also had a double sink. It had an amazing whirlpool tub for two and a rainforest shower for lack of a better work.The shower was a round disk in the ceiling. We then moved on to the bedroom which was located past the kitchen/bathroom. It had a door that could be closed for privacy which was especially nice if you had 2 families staying there and someone was sleeping on the sleeper sofa. The bedroom had 2 queen beds and another TV located in an armoire.It was very tastefully furnished. There was a closet with a full length mirror on the door and an extra nice touch was a full size safe that you could program with your own combination. This was great to put valuables in while in the beach. Our southern view balcony had a nice beach view even though our room was on the side of the hotel. We were in room 804 which was great as the room location was as closest as you could get to beach without having an oceanfront room. The balconies had a solid wall for privacy but since our room was on the end closet to the beach, we had an unobstructed open side facing the beach. There wwere 2 outdoor pools that included an adult pool and a very nice childrens pool with a lazy river,nice slides, and other play areas in the pool.We did not utilize any of the pools due to our short stay but they really looked inviting and the kids were having a ball in the kids pools as well as the adults. There were steps from the lobby that took you directly between these 2 pools and right on the boardwalk and right on the beach. There were also several nice shops located right on the boardwalk including a nice jewelwry store-Mark Douglas Jewelers. I puchased some very cute turtle earrings for my daughter there. The beach was very clean and not overly crowded by the hotel. I would also like to say that our room was very,very clean and that we were provided with fresh towels in a timely fashion during our stay. The room was also very quiet and I slept great as the bed bed and linens were very comfy. We also had the good fortune to secure a parking spot in the parking garage and left our car there the whole time as everything was within walking distance and the tram passed by frequently though a little expensive-$3.00 for 1 person for 1 way trip but they do offer discount cards. I was also impressed that one of the housekeeping staff spoke to another guest in the elevator regarding that she remembered him from his visit the previous summer. WOW! All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Checkout was also a breeze as the clerk advised that Priority Club took care of everything and that we didn't need to do anything.
