Check in is 3:00 pm and checkout is 11:00 am. I only have one regret about this stay in that I wish that it could have been much, much longer. It was so relaxing and we will definately be back as fast as I can rack up those Priority Club points. I was also very impressed about how VERY CLEAN,CLEAN,CLEAN that the suite and bathroom was as I am very pickly about these things. Thanks for a fantastic stay from start to finish. You rock and should be #1 in TripAdvisor as far as I am concerned!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: coffe_20032000
Reviews.Content: -We returned from dinner and found that we had been robbed. -The suite doors do not shut on their own, you must slam them shut. -Housekeeping was late -Your suppose to have on a wristband to use the facilities but they do not enforce this rule and it seems that all of the riffraff roaming up and down the boardwalk know this and take advantage. -The night after we were robbed we were coming back from dinner and witnessed three juveniles attempting to steal a car from in the parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy our stays”
Reviews.Author: arthistorynut
Reviews.Content: My family always goes in January and stays for a long weekend and my parents stay there a lot. We have always been very happy with the hotel. Such a fun place in the winter time! The rooms are clean, beds super comfy. Let's put it this way... years ago when I went for a weekend, I ended up having a severe case of the flu and had to stay many more day and I was very confortable being there. You always want to be in your own bed but I was very comfy there.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: KAHS
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fully booked during our stay. Parking lot near hotel was full. But the two lots (Holiday Inn lots) across the street were fine. All parking was free. We stayed during Senior Week and had no problems. I traveled with my family (husband and 3 young kids). I noticed every family on our floor included young kids. I’m glad for that!!! We never heard noise at night. No partying on our floor! Front desk employees VERY friendly (Keith, Natalie, Rocco). The guy that helped with our luggage was very helpful (Mitch). Elevators moved quickly. We never waited longer than a minute for any of the four elevators. Housekeeping (Raquel) was quick and responsive. We needed an extra blanket for one of the kids… got it within 10 minutes after request. Received a USA Today newspaper every morning at our door. Various fruit offered at front desk area (bananas, oranges, apples, grape fruit, peaches). Rooms were spacious and clean. Although, tile floor would get sticky from the water and sand from the kids in and out of the room. Ocean front room was sweet!! There was carpeting in bedroom. Large flat screen TV in living room with kitchen table and 4 chairs. Also included a chair and ottoman, and double pull-out sofa. Ceiling fan in living room. Large bathroom with Jacuzzi tub. Kids played in it every night before bed. Glad I brought bubbles! Built-in hair dryer in bathroom. Double sinks in bathroom. Bedroom had TV and DVD player. Full-size ironing board with iron. Balcony had 4 chairs and small table. Four telephones located throughout suite. Kitchen was nice size too. Had full-size microwave, full-size stove/oven. Only one burner worked though. Full-size fridge (2 ice trays included). Full-size dishwasher (detergent included). Also included: blender, toaster, 4 cup coffee pot (4 bags of coffee included with cream/sugar), electric can opener, 2 skillets, 3 different size pots, 9 dinner plates, 8 salad plates, 3 saucers, 5 bowls, 6 coffee cups, 9 drinking glasses, 6 juice glasses, 3 wine glasses, 2 champagne glasses, cork screw, veggie peeler, 2 baking sheets, 8 piece set of utensils (forks, spoons, soup spoons, butter knives), large cooking utensils, 1 steak knife, bottle opener, cutting board, 1 dish towel, 1 dish rag, dish soap provided. I brought a roll of paper towels for the stay… glad I did that! Also located on our floor was 2 washers and 2 dryers. There was some mold in the washer, but they were free. No coins needed. No laundry soap provided nor offered in a vending machine. There was also an ice machine with soda pop machine (Coke, Diet Coke, Sprite, Dasani, Neste Iced tea)… all drinks only .40cents each. Candy/snack machine was priced from .60cents to a $1. The restaurant was decent, but priced a little high. Indoor bar was nice… bartender Terry was excellent. She always remembered our room-number when we charged beverages. Hotel offered room service, but we never ordered. Pools were nice. Indoor pool was always empty... except older people swimming in it. The kiddie-pool was very nice. Not overly crowded. 2 life-guards were on duty. 2 small slides and lazy river was cool. Just a handful of umbrellas in pool areas to block sun. I felt those were taken fairly early in the morning. Free towels at pool. Hot tub was ok… I never saw little kids in it. Adult outdoor pool was nice… not crowded. Outdoor bar was nice… $2 beer specials. Also had snack food for kids (nachos, hot dogs, fries, etc). Small area to sit in shade at bar area too. Bartenders walking around pool area ready to serve drinks/food. By 2pm half the pool areas are shaded from the sun (hotel is blocking sun)… which is nice. Nice sandy beach… not a lot of shells. We brought our own sand toys for the kids to play. You can rent umbrellas, chairs, boogie boards at the beach entrance from hotel. This was NOT owned by the hotel. Will’s Beach Service= Umbrella was $15/day. Chair $10/day, mini-chair $7/day, boogie board $5/hour or $13/day. I definitely will stay at this hotel again… it’s conveniently located on the boardwalk. We walked to the end of the boardwalk to have dinner. A train runs on the boardwalk during the evening costing $3/person. We rented bikes/surrey on 20thStreet off of boardwalk. They accepted the $5 competitor coupon from the place located on 8th Street. So, large surrey for an hour was $20 with coupon. Every evening before we went to dinner we stopped at the front desk asking if they had dinner coupons for the place we were heading to… and don’t you know it… the front desk gave us bigger discount coupons than what we found in all the coupon books/guides found in lobby area. Definitely ask the front desk for coupons!! As for the pricing of this hotel… I think it’s expensive. Try priceline.com or calling Holiday Inn directly. I wrote every detail down from the hotel because these were the things I wanted to know before my trip and couldn’t find. I hope this helps others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtravelled1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a nice, easy to get to location. Parking was a slight problem as non handicap people kept parking in the handicapped spot closest to the hotel. My mother who walks with canes had to walk futher then necessary. It was difficult at times to even get close enough to drop her off. Our room; a semi-suite was on the eleventh floor, and was comfortably furished. The couch and chair in the living room could use more padding but otherwise were okay. The bedroom was great. Beds were roomy and comfortable and even the pillows were good! Make sure you ask for a ocean/beach facing room. There were a couple of things that I felt should be brought to the attention of the management or mainteance. The sliding screen door to the patio was falling off it's tracks and was very difficult to open. All the fasets from the kitchen sink to the bathroom shower leaked. Just enough to be annyoing. And we didn't get serviced the first day we were there. She dropped in about 6 PM to ask if we wanted service and we were just settling in for dinner. No thanks! RECOMMANDATION: Check with the hotel or even the OCean City Website and find out when SENIOR Week is, because even though we were on the eleventh floor the noise from the kids partying ALL Night was defening. Never got a goodnights sleep. One night we were woken up at 4:30 AM with two guys arguring and police being called. We stayed the weekend of June 11th. This years SENIOR WEEKEND!! Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice location”
Reviews.Author: somerssalt
Reviews.Content: I live in Maryland and have been going to Ocean City every summer since the kids were born (has it really been 15 years?) always staying for a week in a high-rise condo in North Ocean City. In addition to the week uptown this year I promised the kids we'd also take a 3-day mid-week mini-trip and stay in a hotel right on the boardwalk, so they could experience something new. I chose the Holiday Inn Suites and it was great. Two outdoor and one indoor pools, directly on the boardwalk, well maintained rooms and common areas, nice staff, free parking, 3-room suite with kitchen, great beds (even the sleep-sofa was ok to sleep on), cold and quiet air conditioning, fantastic big bathroom with oversized whirlpool tub and double sinks, big TVs with cable, no wait for elevators, plenty of carts to take luggage to rooms, a hose on the boardwalk to wash the sand off your feet, wireless internet in the room, I could go on and on. I'm trying to think of something bad to say: the handle on the toilet broke off but a man came within ten minutes of my call and fixed it in about two minutes so that's nothing to complain about. My room started to get hot around bedtime one night and when I went over to the thermostat to see what was going on I noticed a sign stating that the a/c would not work if the patio door was ajar, and sure enough the kids had not closed it all of the way. So we had a great experience at this hotel. No regrets whatsoever. I see that's it's the #3 rated hotel in OC and it deserves it. I'll have to try out #1 and #2 to see how it could be any better: maybe some chocolate treats left on the pillows?

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: hi_kity
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! This is about the nicest place I've stayed in O.C., although I haven't tried the Hilton. The rooms were large, clean and very comfortable. I loved the jacuzzi in the room, and the little kitchen was very handy. Listened to the ocean waves at night...heavenly! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing get away!!”
Reviews.Author: mommacita4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was much more than I ever hoped for. The suite was large and very comfortable. You enter into a living room complete with a flat screen and VHS. Then you walk through the full kitchen area, complete with anything you would need for light meals, pots, pans, blender, toaster,etc. Then you walk into the bedroom complete with jucuzzi tub, another flat screen with VCR and the amazing view from the balcony. The shower has three heads which was great to come back to after walking the board walk. One of the best things was the two out door pools. One was an "activity" pool with small slides and things for the kids so at the other pool you could swim or just relax without a lot of little kids splashing and making noise. Everyone was happy, those of us who just wanted to quietly read and the parents who didn't have to worry about their kids bothering people and especially the kids who just wanted to have a good time. Everyone won! The hotel its self is so well built that I ended up there during "senior week" and I didn't hear anything from any other room, even though I had kids beside me. I'll definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “I'm a Starwood or better traveler and this beach hotel met my standards”
Reviews.Author: BrenKen1
Reviews.Content: We searched high and low for a chain hotel on the beach. Although this hotel was not our first choice...we are happy we ended up staying there. First of all the staff, even the newly hired staff, were all very nice, polite, attentive and just made the hotel better. Brian was the manager on duty and I complimented him on his hiring and training. Ok, the room, we had a corner suite ocean front and were quite comfortable. Something about taking a jacuzzi watching and listening to the ocean. We ate breakfast there everyday and service was fast and made to order. Location? the best, walk out to the beach and turn to the left and you hit the beginning of the boardwalk...close but not too close. The pool set up was nice with a kiddie side and an adult side with bar! The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and location was the best. Also, for some nice local eating and drinking we took a $12 taxi to Harborside... highly recommend going there for food and music...great for adults! I gave this hotel 5 stars based on the fact that it is a beach hotel.... so in it's element it is a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: CT_traveler999
Reviews.Content: Much better than we expected. Right on the beach. Large suites with full kitchen and useable balcony facing the ocean. Exceptionally clean. Large pool area water slides for kids. Quiet. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: E_Shay
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel in Ocean City that I have stayed in. The rooms were wonderful, and CLEAN. There were NO PETS allowed which I thought was great. The cleaning staff was excellent, along with the front desk. The room service food, was the best. The noise level was minimal, even though we had an ocean front suite. Even with all the people walking down the boardwalk, I was able to keep the balcony door open while I slept. This place was heaven! A full kitchen, with dishes, really took me by surprise. There is just not enough space to give this place the praise it deserved. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SugarMagnolia923
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Ocean City each year for SpringFest weekend. For the past few years we’ve stayed here. We choose this hotel because it’s on the Boardwalk and within walking distance to all the Boardwalk attractions, we love the whirlpool tub in the bathroom, the beds are comfy and the view from the rooms is awesome. Also, when you get off the elevators on your floor, they have large windows where you can see the entire bay side of Ocean City! This year we went down without a reservation and the only rooms they had left were Southern view rooms. Even the view from there was good. We could see the ocean, all the way down the boulevard to the pier and when it was really clear, we could even see Assateague. The only problem we encountered this time was when we opened the sliding door in the bedroom (we like to sleep with it open), the entrance door in the living room made a lot of blowing/wind noise, but it was an especially windy weekend so that might have been the reason. We love Holiday Inn and Suites and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable suite, good location”
Reviews.Author: valdivine
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a group of friends (5 ladies) for a girls weekend. I was concerned that the room would feel cramped with that many people. But it didn't! The suite was great! There was a full living room and kitchen. The beds were comfortable and the room clean. The location is great too. It is right on the boardwalk and near many restaurants and activities (CVS across the street too). Our room had a great view of the ocean and a nice balcony on which to sit and relax. There were two outdoor pools. One pool was geared towards kids. It had a lazy river current to float you around the pool (which is kind of strong for the little kids) and two water slides. It also has an outdoor hot tub (for the adults). It was really nice to be able to sit in the hot tub overlooking the beach and boardwalk. The restaurant on the premises was sufficient, but not bad. There is a nice jewelry store downstairs on the boardwalk that will give you a discount if you are staying at the hotel. I would definitely like to bring friends or family here next time we come to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: kim0430
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a quick weekend getaway. We had a wonderful time. We had a corner king suite, so I believe that our room was a little bigger than some, and it was huge. Nice jacuzzi tub in the bedroom was a fun touch. The kitchen area was more than what we needed, but stocked nicely with newer appliances. The living area was roomy. The couch and chair a little older, but not uncomfortable. TVs nice, but had a VCR in the bedroom...would have preferred a DVD player. The DVD was in the living room area. Not that we spent a lot of time watching TV, but did bring one movie. No on demand movies, which was a little different. The pools outside looked very nice. People were in them and sitting around them. We didn't get it as it was still a little cold for our liking. The indoor pool area was nice enough, a little small, but typical for OC. Please be aware that they do require one nights deposit. I specifically asked this when I booked on the 1-800 holiday # when I called to book, and they told me there wasn't a charge to book. I was more than a little ticked when I looked at my bank acct, and saw the 1 night charge. The hotel manager was not helpful, and just blamed the 1 800 number for the mixup. The hotel management NEVER did anything to help correct the mix-up, even after the guest relations dept promised me money off my stay, and free breakfast. When we checked in no one knew of the issues. After 4 calls to the 1-800 number, the guest relations dept finally grabbed the ball and addressed my concerns, and quite nicely, I might add.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach35
Reviews.Content: I received a free nights stay at the Holiday Inn, 17th St and the Boardwalk. The hotel was great, very clean, bright and cheerful. The staff was very helpful and attentive. The hotel is at a great location on the boardwalk, and the views are fantastic. The indoor pool is a little small, but adequate. The exercise room is also adequate for a hotel. Our suite was very spacious and the beds were quite comfortable. I was also impressed that the hotel had washers and dryers for the guests use. Even though we didn't use it, I loved the idea that if we got caught in the rain, or my son made a mess, we could have done laundry without lugging everything to a Laundromat. My only complaint with the hotel, was the water pressure in the shower was not great. The whirlpool tub easily made up for it though!

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City Favorite”
Reviews.Author: MsLibrarian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last summer before we went on our honeymoon in Greece. We just drove down from Philly, to get a mini pre honeymoon break and we didn't have any idea where we were going to stay, however my husband had mention he saw this Holiday Inn on Trip Advisor and it had great reviews. So we just walked in and ask for a room on the spot and it was more than what we expected. They gave us a suite and it was clean, roomy, comfortable, modern and fantastic view of the beach. The hotel is in the middle of everything and right on the beach. It has its' own private pool if you choose to stay off the beach. We are definitely staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Experience”
Reviews.Author: RudyMc
Reviews.Content: I planned a kidnap for my husband & I to Ocean City, MD. Stayed at the Holiday Inn on 17th Street and glad we did. The room was spacious, well maintained and beautiful. The ocean view was spectacular! Indoor pool was warm and very clean. Love that the bar was open 365 days a year. Sometimes hotels will cut corners and close the bar for the winter months. Not at this Holiday Inn, everything was top notch!! Delicious Cuban sandwich and gin & tonic for lunch! MMMmm!! Staff was exceptional! Everyone spoke and was so willing to help. By far the nicest Holiday Inn I have ever stayed at. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a vacation or weekend kidnap for your spouse! We will definately be going back in season to enjoy the beautiful beaches and sites of Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: klb0521
Reviews.Content: Sorry this review is late. My husband and I stayed here Oct 10-12th to celebrate our 4th anniversary. We were going to book a southern view suite, but as a surprise, my husband booked an ocean view suite! We had a lovely view of the ocean. The one problem we had that was taken care of right way, was our balcony was swarmed with bugs and a few were inside on our sliding door. One call down to the front desk and two men came armed with bug spray and they went to work. No problems after that! The room was very, very spacious and clean. I loved the fact that we went off season, so the town was not over run with vacationers, but there were still many people in town that weekend. I would truly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - here's some hopefully helpful hints”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelohyeah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid-week (Tu-Th) December 2009. Lobby not on ground level - it's up a floor - staff was quite friendly, no problems checking in. No express check out. Lots of free parking with overflow across the street. Looks like great outdoor pools but they're closed for the season right now. Indoor pool was nice. If your key doesn't work to open the pool door just push the handicap access button and it will open or enter through the gates in the cafe. The poolside cafe was a kind of cheap looking, but we found we could get the same food items at the same price in the nicer dining room area (Hemingway's). It all comes from the same kitchen! There's no complimentary breakfast though they had some fruit on the front desk (banana's and oranges). Layton's, a family restaurant, is now open year round and is located across the street next the CVS (on the main drag). They had some impressive specials and dyno biscuits and cost a lot less than the hotel cafe. The room itself was good. Had a rain shower head above the whirlpool tub, both the bed and the sofa (sleeper) rooms had flat screen TV's. One TV had a DVD, the other a VCR. The balcony was spacious - a nice table and 4 chairs were provided. I'd go back to this hotel, not sure what it's like during summer season, but for a quiet and relaxing getaway it worked great. The one complaint I have was when I booked through the 1-800 number, the agent was VERY difficult to understand (probably not located in America). I had to repeat back everything to make sure I understood her. She took my credit card information and then LIED saying since the hotel was booked to capacity there would be no refund if we had to cancel. Turns out the hotel was NOT booked to capacity. If this happens again in the off season I will simply not book and take my chances when I get there. However, this was a problem with the reservation line, not the hotel, so I don't hold it against them.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations (for O.C.) right in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: JJPizzo
Reviews.Content: In Ocean City terms, this is a five star hotel. Clean rooms in good repair, 2 outside and one inside pool. Bars and waitresses at the pools so you can have a cocktail and watch the kids in the pool. Been staying there ever since it was built. A little pricey compared to other places on the boards, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, great location, top notch service, no complaints, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: sac2008
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding stay at this hotel earlier this week. It is the nicest Holiday Inn that I have ever stayed at and is, in my opinion, the best hotel on the boardwalk. The staff members are friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and still looks new even though it's been open since spring 2001. It is certainly an improvement over the two motels that were here before (Sandyhill and Ocean Park). There are two large outdoor pools and an indoor pool. We liked the heated activity pool. They also have a fitness center which we did not get to use. On almost every floor there are washers, dryers, vending machines, and ice machines. We got to the hotel around 11 AM Monday and our room wasn't quite ready yet. Brian, the manager on duty, took our cell phone number and called us when the room was ready. The room that we were assigned (120) was very spacious and really nice. The living room has an L-shaped sofa and a huge TV. The bedroom has two queen beds and a whirlpool tub. However, this particular room overlooks the hot tub and activity pool, which we did not like. There is no view of the ocean and the balcony is not private at all. We went back to the front desk and Brian gave us the keys to two other corner rooms to check out (1116 and 805). We chose room 805, which was nice. It has a sofa bed in the living room and the bedroom had a king bed and whirlpool tub. The bathroom has a large shower with 3 showerheads, which was awesome! The room also has a kitchen and a private balcony with a table and four chairs. This Holiday Inn has not been "relaunched" yet, but will probably be once the renovations at the adjacent Quality Inn are completed (both hotels are owned by the Harrison Group).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: MookieandPookie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Wife on our Honeymoon. My Father booked and payed for the room as a wedding present for us. He was told by the concierge that we would receive a special rate, as well as a welcome basket since it was a Honeymoon trip. Upon arrival, we had no basket. When we inquired about the missing basket at the front desk, we were told it was a mix up on the part of the concierge, who thought I was a friend of his with the same name. The basket was to be a personal gift from him to his friend. We also found out that the rate quoted to my Father was not being honored because there was no record of it. The whole story sounded a bit far fetched to me, but they were very accommodating and worked things out. The staff was very helpful and courteous, room service and housekeeping were wonderful, the view was incredible, (as you can see from my photo). There were a few minor problems, such as broken cabinet hinges, no cold water in the bathroom, frayed carpet, slightly dirty jacuzzi tub, a bit of noise from kiddie pool, as another reviewer pointed out. Parking also seemed a bit limited, since we could not find a spot when we returned to our hotel in the evenings. Overall, this was the largest and nicest room I have stayed in. I think it was well worth the money my Father spent, even with the little mix up. I would recommend the Holiday Inn and Suites, and I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: momoo
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at HI Suites. The first time did not impress me, but this time was much better. It was much cleaner with clean comfortable furniture, and very soft, comfortable furniture. We had a south facing room and it had excellent ocean and bay views, but was very noisy with street, boardwalk, and neighboring hotel noise. So we didn't leave the patio door open at night. There are some things that could be updated, but we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well, Hold on A Minute”
Reviews.Author: rbbigs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just okay. First, the good news. The hotel staff works with the energy of a 5-Star hotel to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel is mostly clean; which is hard being located directly on the boardwalk/beach. However, this is a Holiday Inn and is not a luxury hotel. The hotel amenities, room fixtures/furniture, decor, comfort level is average. The food is standard Holiday Inn with a whole grain not to found anywhere on the property. If you are only looking for location then this is the right place. If you are looking for upscale comfort, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family fun!”
Reviews.Author: beachykeen135
Reviews.Content: My wife and children stayed here recently for two nights and had a wonderful experience! The kids pool was great and my wife and I were able to enjoy some time alone at the pool while they played. It was right on the beach making it easy to move from the beach to the pool, which we did because the waves were too rough one day. CVS, and Phillips seafood buffet are in walking distance as well as many other stores and restaurants. We ordered desert one night through their room service and found it to be extremely good! I highly recommend this hotel for families that want the best amenities a vacation can offer, as well as high quality rooms and suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but it is expensive”
Reviews.Author: kklldd
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time at the Holiday Inn. Really nice that it's at a quieter part of the boardwalk (17th street) because the lower the # the louder the boardwalk is. The best part for us was the kiddie pool. We have a 6 year old and a 2 year old. The 2 year old didn't want to go to the beach at all. She just wanted to go in the kiddie pool. And the 6 year old wanted to do both the beach and the pool. The pool has a small slide and a larger curvy slide. It has currents (not too strong) that carry you around the edges of the pool. It is really a ton of fun. My husband and I really enjoyed our time in the pool with the kids. A really nice touch is that they give each of you a pool card (we received 4) and you turn it in to receive a clean towel. Then when you are done with the towels, you turn them in to get your card back. It's really nice having a clean, dry towel every time you go to the pool. During the week there wasn't much of an issue with getting a chair. We never sat in the chairs anyway so we just threw all of our towels on to one chair. On Saturday I did see a small line waiting before the pool opened at 9am. So weekends might be a bit more crowded. The rooms are spacious. We had 2 queen beds. Then another room has a pull-out couch. Our 6 year old slept on the couch . We brought our own crib (yes, my husband tears it down and sets it up.). We put that in the room with the couch. Put the kids to bed early which was nice. The beds were comfortable. We were on the 11th floor. The maids on our floor were very attentive. I requested extra towels and they delivered them within a half hour. Our rooms and towels were changed every day. Never had any issues with unclean rooms. The shower could have used a little more power but probably an energy conserving type. Cupboards had dishes, bowls, utensils, pots and pans. There were no baking sheets or hot pads. I did bring my own baking sheet (just in case) because we wanted to bake cookies. It was lots of fun baking cookies in our hotel room. Yum! Kids loved it! Has a dishwasher and they give you dishwashing liquid and dishwasher detergent every day. We always grabbed a bunch of apples and bananas at the front desk on our way back to the room. We didn't eat at the restaurant. We grocery shopped at a very resonably priced Food Lion across the bridge. Ate breakfast and lunch in the room every day. Ate dinner out every night. Had a great time. It was almost $500 a night when you add in state and hotel taxes. That was a little hard to stomach. They told me it's $391 a night (not included any taxes) vs. $439 a night if you reserve 7 nights or more. We only stayed 4 nights this time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: Redbudian
Reviews.Content: Our extended family booked a few rooms here for a long weekend during peak season. The hotel itself is in a great location, right on the beach and near everything. The rooms have a living area with a sofa bed, then the kitchen and bathroom in the middle, then the bedroom area near the window with the view. We used one room as the meeting place to make meals/eat and hang out and there was plenty of space for everyone. We were right next to the kiddie pool, which was actually great because we could walk through an iron privacy gate to the pool, then back into the room the same way (no trip through the lobby in a soggy swimsuit). It was still private in the room and quiet when we needed to sleep (the pool opens at 9 a.,m. then closes at 6 p.m.). The kiddie pool is great for a wide variety of ages with 2 slides, a lazy river and a whirlpool. Lifeguards were placed in 2 spots to monitor the pool, so it was very safe. It was also nice to have the option to choose the pool or beach or both each day. Our only complaints were: 1) we did have an issue with the cleanliness in one of the rooms. The tub had mildew in the jets. On bed looked as if it was re-made and never changed (we requested new and made them ourselves). The dishes, blender and dishwasher were all very dirty. Even the trash cans had stuck-on food and used tissues on the bottom. I actually bought cleaning products and cleaned the room myself before we could use it because houskeeping could not respond to our needs right away. And 2) the pool closes at 6 p.m. even during peak season when it is light out until almost 9 p.m. Again we stayed right next to the kiddie pool and even we thought it was way too early.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. The outdoor pool areas (kiddie and regular) were a mirror image of the Hilton pool areas with the exception of the Hilton's swim-up pool bar. Great pool area for kids. Whoever put the hot tub (for adults only) in the back of the kiddie pool area was an idiot. Kids are all around it and want to go in it and the hot tub closes when the kiddie pool area closes. (During our stay, the kiddie area and the hot tub sometimes closed earlier than the stated times. We were asked to leave the hot tub early once during our stay.) Had to turn in cards to get towels. I don't know if they were also serving as lifeguards, but the two teenagers running the towel area were normally not at the "towel hut" and at times there was a sign saying that you had to go to the front hotel desk to get towels. Despite the sign, the front desk staff seem aggravated that they had to hand out towels. Otherwise, front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. Indoor pool area is nice but is located next to the restaurant with no walls between them. No hot tub or jacuzzi in indoor pool area. Restaurant was very expensive, even for breakfast. I would recommend passing on the $20/day meal vouchers for $10/day and go eat somewhere else. The suites are beautiful as well. Room was very clean, including the tile livingroom. Rooms had a lot of nice little extras like flat screen TV's, ceiling fans, blender, and jacuzzi tub. Only complaint was the hot tub closing at 4 PM or earlier during our stay in early June. Management said that it was so that people in the hot tub did not disturb the people in the poolside rooms, which were approx 25-30 feet from the hot tubs. (Who needs complete quiet before 9PM?) Should add hot tubs to the adult swimming area and/or the indoor pool area. Also, the room next door to ours ordered room service and the tray and dishes sat in the hall for over 24 hours. Had some covered parking under the hotel and private balconies, both of which are rare in Ocean City. Rooms were extremely quiet and everything seemed new. I checked out a bunch of other hotels this year while we were there and the Hilton (#1) and the Holiday Inn on the boardwalk (a close 2nd) are the two nicest by far. Unfortunately, most of the other nice hotels (like the Grand Hotel) are starting to show their age and go downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: grand_illusion
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 20-May 24. The hotel is very nice. We arrived early, around 1pm and our room was not ready. They gave us our parking pass, we went and had lunch and returned around 3pm. We did not get what we requested, but it was just a request, and we were not promised anything so no complaint there. The room was clean. Our shower did not work well, we called the front desk and they sent someone up fairly quick, and he fixed the problem. The maid did a nice job cleaning, however we never got our room done until late afternoon. The maids seem like they have a awful lot of rooms to clean. However she did a nice job, just later than I prefer. The pools are very nice, the staff very friendly and helpful. I have no complaints about this hotel and would stay again. In fact, we will most likely go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great stay”
Reviews.Author: lenk58
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Holiday Inn and it was great. The location on 17th on the Boardwalk is hard to beat. I like staying on the Boardwal and would not stay off it. The rooms were very clean and the maid ws great. The Coral reef Bar was fun and very friendly(especially Adam the bartender). The rates this year were discounted due to the economy and the value was outstanding. If you are looking for a great spot in the best location with all the amenities, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bartTcat
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel and it has become my favorite in Ocean City. Rooms a huge and CLEAN. Breath taking views from ocean front balconies. Can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marylander12
Reviews.Content: When I book a hotel room, at the very minimum I expect clean rooms and courteous staff. Holiday Inn Suites provided both - and a great view to boot! I plan to book again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: hark1976
Reviews.Content: I would stay there over and over again because their beds are so comfortable and the sheets are so soft. I was staying there for a cheerleading competition and the service was great and freindly. The only issue is that the tile floors in the entrance of the room could be much cleaner. They look clean but when walking around in your bare feet you can see the dirt. Other than that, I the food at the resturant is great, the bar is great, and the location is perfect. I wish I could go in the summer because the pools outside looked like they would be wonderful during the season.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: DCskadoodle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have done a bunch of trips to Ocean City, and have been cruising coastal highway since were were kids. OC has lots of options when it comes to lodging, but many seem to have fallen into at least some level of disrepair. Not the Holiday Inn, however. This hotel offers consistently good service, clean rooms that seem to outshine most of the other Holiday Inns I have stayed in, and a fantastic location. I would definitely recommend the Holiday Inn to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “You will love this place”
Reviews.Author: elon89
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, but usually in the summer. We decided to go down to the Holiday Inn in the middle of the winter so our kids could enjoy the pool, game room and just to get away. The staff as usual, were very friendly and our accomadations were perfect. Most of the staff remembered us and our children from last July when we last stayed at this property. The set-up of this hotel is great. The indoor pool is located just a few yards from the Corral Reef Restuarant. Therefore, the kids can swin in the pool and the adults can enjoy a few cocktails while keeping their eyes on the children. The rooms were very clean and beds are very comfortable and have nice sheets (not the usual sandpaper type sheets at most hotels). The maids seemed to sense when we would be gone for a few hours and when we returned our room was again spotless. In my mind, with or without kids, this is the best hotel in Ocean City. We can't wait to come back this summer! During the summer, this place is awesome. There is a kids activity pool that features a water slide, lazy river, water jets and a mini slide for the really young kids. The other pool is more geared to the adults and has a pool bar and grille. In both pools, there are plenty of wait staff to take your drink and food orders. And as a bonus, this hotel is right on the boardwalk. We literally park our cars when we get here and do not get into them the entire time we are here. You can walk to many attractions and restaurants and if we need to travel someplace, the hotel staff will get you a cab in minutes! Trust me taking a cab is the way to go in this town. It is cheap and safe! Thanks again to the staff of this fabulous hotel and see you in July 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Great Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: riverriders
Reviews.Content: My wife, kids and I stayed for 3 days between Christmas and New Years. We enjoyed our visit. The hotel has spacious suites with a seperate bedroom. They have an indoor pool, bar and restaurant. We got a great rate of $99 by just showing up and asking for a rate at the desk. The best rate we got ahead of time was $129. There was hardly anyone at the hotel. The staff person gave us an oceanfront room on the 14th (top) floor with a view that was hard to beat. The rooms were clean and the kids ate free for breakfast each day. There wasn't much going on in that part of Ocean City this time of year, but since it was on the board walk, we went out each morning with the kids and let them ride their bikes. They even made the Ocean City paper one day. We had to go up to 74th street or so to find restaurants and things to do. We played at the indoor put put one day and went ice skating another day. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure!!”
Reviews.Author: MDcouple
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a handful of times with my husband. Most of them have been during the off season. I decided on a whim to come down for a few days right before Christmas this year. After checking rates online, I decided to change it and not make reservations. When I got to the front desk the two attendants were wonderful, gave me a fabulous rate and even took the time to recommend restaurants that were open and explained the holiday lights OC has every year. The rooms are SO comfortable. Even more comfortable than I remember. The beds have great linens and it's so nice to be able to cook your own food instead of having to eat out the whole time (each room has a kitchen) My girlfriend, her daughter, and I loved the pool. It was so relaxing and warm. We unfortunately did not get to grab a drink at the bar or eat there. The only gripe I had was the room we had was on the 14th floor and the wireless internet signal did not reach up there. I requested a high floor due to the view. They said they were in the middle of upgrading and offered an ethernet cord to use in the outlet. One other gripe was the stove and cooking utensils were a bit worn. The burner was tilted so the pan kept sliding off a bit as I was trying to cook. Other than that it's my favorite hotel in OC, and I've stayed at quite a few! I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Southern Suite, great off-season value, view to die for, comfy room.”
Reviews.Author: sailorgirl45
Reviews.Content: Stayed first week of Oct. for four nights. We went without reservations and we were glad we did. The HI was where we most wanted to stay so we tried them first. Had only a few vacancies due to car show coming in middle of the week. Had oceanfront but we looked at the southern view room first and were so satisfied that we took it without looking at oceanfront suites. Offered us a rate of $89.00 a night and we jumped on it. It was myself and my boyfriend and my sister and her husband and we were very comfortable in the room. We were on the ninth floor(highest for southern view) and the 2nd suite over from the oceanfront. Two double beds in bedroom with TV armoire and VCR, additional dresser, side chair, large closet with mirroed doors. Bathroom consisited of jucuzzi tub, rainfall showerhead, lots of thick fluffy towels and nice amenities. Living room had a comfy sofa, reading chair and ottoman another TV armoire with DVD player and a table with four chairs. Full kitchen with everything you would need to make a meal. The view from the balcony was one of the best I've had while in OC. You could fully see and hear the ocean, as well as the bay on the other side. We a had a wonderful view of the city all the way to the inlet and over to Assautegue. On clear days you could see the ponies. The city was so pretty lit up at night. See pictures but please forgive my poor picture taking abilities. The indoor pool as a perfect 80 degrees everyday and was a nice way to warm up after a cool evening stroll on the boardwalk. All staff was attentive and friendly. Housekeeping keep our room spotless. One of the best parts is that they participate in a enviromental preservation program. If you hang your towels up they leave the same ones in the room(our maid even refolded and made them look pretty again everyday). Sheets are changed every three days and after checkouts of course. This saves water and detergent and it something that I think every hotel should do. We tried the pool cafe for an afternoon snack and it was very good. Ordered som appys and drinks and it was delivered promptly and our server was very sweet. Even though they were almost full we never had a problem with elevators or parking. Ocean City was a buzz and almost all restaurants,shops on boardwalk and amusements were open. We had a great week and a lot had to do with our wonderful suite and fantastic view fron the Holiday Inn. Already planning to go back for the Air Show in June and will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: kmflutist
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn & Suites for a romantic weekend getaway. We arrived 4 hours prior to check-in time due to the approaching tropical storm. We relaxed in the hotel restaurant/bar/pool area while we were waiting for our room to be ready. The bartender was very friendly and although overpriced, the food was great (everything in OC seems to be overpriced). We were pleasantly surprised when they informed us our room was ready at 1pm (2 hrs prior to check in time). We booked the king bed corner suite with jacuzzi in the room. It was quite a spacious suite with a fully stocked kitchen area (blender, toaster, coffee pot, utensils, pots/pans, etc). The linens were clean and the bed very comfortable. The floors were all tile and we mistakenly assumed they were mopped between guests. My husband spilled a bit of water on the floor and used a white washcloth to wipe it up. We were a bit disturbed when we found the washcloth had turned a brownish-gray. Other than the floor, the room seemed to be very clean. The hotel is definitely starting to show its age, but we saw nothing that interfered with our ability to enjoy our stay. We've recently stayed at the OC Hilton and have to admit that the Hilton was much nicer/newer but you wind up paying up to $100-$200 more per night. Due to the price break, we will definitely be staying at the Holiday Inn & Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Great offseason weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: silverbow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a whim. It was a Friday morning and decided we wanted to get away for a couple of nights. I was surprised that when my husband called the property they were extremely helpful in getting us the least expensive package they could find (I guess we got lucky because it was offseason). Anyway, we paid $199 for the weekend and that price included a $50 gift certificate for dinner and a chilled bottle of wine waiting upon arrival. The room was immaculate - very clean and well stocked. There was a living/dining room with a couch/seat/coffee table and TV. The dining area was small - can't imagine a family sitting down for dinner there..but it was nice to have. There was a full "galley" style kitchen and a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. The bedroom was nice and had another TV. The balcony overlooked the beach and had a table with four chairs. The staff was very nice and we liked the food at the restaurant the one night we ate there. Loved the indoor pool. It was November so obviously the outdoor pools were closed but man, did they look like fun! Yes, this place is "pricier" but overall I think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I would call it satisfactory for the most part...”
Reviews.Author: christyk0104
Reviews.Content: This place was okay, but I wouldn't say that it's worth the steep price. For the price you're paying, you can get a MUCH nicer place at one of the condo's. The only problem with condos is that you have to bring your own towels and linens, but I think the next time I go to OC, I will deal with that inconvenience. The location is ideal, there is no question about that. But the suite itself doesn't really live up to expectations, i.e.it's not as nice as the pictures on the website. I will say this though, the bed was VERY comfortable, and the bathroom was pretty big for a hotel. The housekeeper did a good job every day, but the hotel should have a broom in the closet for guests to use to sweep up the sand. Also, there were dish towels but no dish RAGS....no huge deal, but I found that quite odd. The kids pool was nice, but man do those kids scream...this is not the place to go for young couples with no children. All in all, it was better than your average hotel at Ocean City. But for this kind of money, you're better off staying at one of the condos instead.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: deannamort
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this property for four nights. Except for a shaky part during the booking process the entire experience was amazing. The hotel is very clean, the staff beyond helpful, and rooms spacious. My daughter and nieces loved the pool!!! We have been to ocean city for the past five years and will now make this property our new destination!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: madisonmomof2
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time in Oceancity and the first time that we stay here. It was awesome. The pools were great and the kids ate for free which saved alot of money for lunch and breakfast. We stayed 5 nights and only got in our car on the 4th night to drive down to the bay. Everything is within walking distance. We will be going back here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY -BUT HIGH IN PRICE”
Reviews.Author: daiseymae88
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Holiday Inn within a year. The room layout and view are great! My only complaint here is the sofa beds need to be replaced. They do have stains and are soft in spots. I was surprised to find this in a hotel of this level. My kids LOVED the pool, but I agree with other reviewers, some guests do hog the chairs. They come early in the morning (during our stay, I did not witness a long line to get in), drop off towels on as many as six chairs then leave until later in the day. It would be nice if the hotel could limit them in some way. I found the staff very friendly, the only fault here would be inexperience as most are kids themselves. I LOVED room service! I have to say for us $500 for a nights stay in Ocean City is a bit steep, but everything you might need is within walking distance of the hotel. And at least until my kids are older I don't see how I can take them back to a "regular" pool!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Visit I Have Ever Had in OC”
Reviews.Author: ginagirl62
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Oc over the years. Holiday inn on 17th street was by far the best yet. all of the employees and managment went above and beyond there duties to make my family and I very at home. The kiddie pool was the best pool in ocean city. Holiday inn on 17th street offered many ammenities for all ages. To top it off they are located right on the boardwalk with a beauitful view of the ocean. Thank you to All Holiday Inn And suites Staff for making this the best visit to oc my family and i have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “like being on a cruise,with no ship”
Reviews.Author: firefighterstubbs
Reviews.Content: I would like to take the time to say how wonderful my stay was at the Holiday Inn. Everyone on the staff was very GREAT!!!! I wish everyone was as kind as they were. My face will be seen more there . The manager and the staff well lets just say u have a 1,000 score with me. I can not say much more to how great my stay was with the Holiday Inn & Suites in Ocean City Maryland it was like I WAS RIGHT AT HOME !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: JennandFam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of June 2008 and had a great time! We had a beautiful view of the ocean and upon checking in, our room was very clean and ready for our stay. Although we were right on the beach, my kids and husband wanted to stay at the kid pool all day. They had so much fun on the slides and lazy river. I am pregnant and had some special food needs by the pool and the staff took care of me. Lifeguard staff was very personable to my children and watched the pool well I thought. Housekeeping was good about bringing extra towels and toiletries as needed. Will definitely stay at this hotel again! Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at The Holiday Inn Suites”
Reviews.Author: golfnut45
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Holiday Inn suites. The rooms are like apartments with the tile floors and large roomy showers. It was very very clean from the rooms to the grounds. My 5 kids loved the pool and daddy loved the pool bar. Highly recomended and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “agre poor service”
Reviews.Author: lucky021_8
Reviews.Content: Agree with priorityclubgold...very overpriced...rooms were dirty...tub had mold and staff not friendly at all...they could not answer even the most basic questions about the area, or the hotel. If you asked about anything you got a loud sigh and a roll of the eyes it was like i was bothering them. I always thought holiday inn was a class act but i will never go out of my way to stay at one again, especially this one. SERVICE AT THE POOL WAS TERRIBLE AND OVERPRICED, ROOM OVERPRICED,STAFF NOT FRIENDLY, AND I ALSO GOT CHARGED DIFFERENT PRICES FOR THE SAME THING ON DIFFERENT DAYS. Stay at the comfort inn, you'll be happier and so will your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: priorityclubgold
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very OVERPRICED or what you get...$525.00 per night..First of all this hotel is run for the comfort of the employees. we had a problem with check in...cant check in early if you are a priority club member...actually you can't check in at the official check in time either..why.. because the maids dont start cleaning the rooms until 9:00am..guess they dont want to get them out of bed too early... childrens pool doesnt open until 9:00am and closes at 6:oopm..so the employees won't get over eight hours...the "pool towels" are regulated as if they are made of gold...one per person only..they , cover only half a pool chair and are below WAL-MART quality...i"ve seen better at MOTEL6...(bring your own towels) THE ROOMS..:Our refrigerator did not work in our room upon arrival..(did I mention that the room costs$525.00 per night)and the next day the safe died...both were repaired.. the windows were dirty when we arrived and after three nights they still have the same smudge marks left by a child from a previous stay (the employees dont' do windows(we got to keep our employees happy!!) the hot tub in the room had mold in it.....Every morning my wife would go down to the rest. to get take out coffee..every morning the price would change for each cup..$2.50- $2.95...the pool waitress would charge DOUBLE what the pool bar charges for drinks ( the pool bar charges $2.00 per coke..the waitress would charge $4.00 per coke...make sure you walk the 40 feet to the pool bar to get your drinks...you must check out at the front counter when you leave..every holiday inn i've ever stayed at slips your bill under the door the morning of check out or you have tv checkout...not here you wait in line to check out....!!.poor management!! NO SPECIAL TREATMENT FOR PRIORITY CLUB MEMBERS....GOOD THINGS: GREAT LOCATION...THE ROOMS WERE VERY NICE otherwise...MY SUGGESTION save yourself $200. per night and stay next door at the QUALITY INN..same beach ..same location.. better beach bar..adult pool just as good ..rooms not as nice but at $500 plus (with taxes)the HOLIDAY INN IS NOT WORTH THE MONEY........

Reviews.Title: “Priority Club member's review.....”
Reviews.Author: MRFRIENDLY
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here in the past. Once, there was a fire alarm everynight we stayed! It was awful but the management was very kind and refunded our points! During that stay we were on an upper floor and the people in wheelchairs felt they had to "get out", and attempted to crawl down the stairs. I had them "shelter in place" until I could get to the front desk to determine if everything was OK. It was a false alarm (kids) and I had to drag one of the handicapped patrons back up the steps to his wheelchair. The hotel is very modern, with phase III firemen's elevators, sprinklered rooms and passages, ventilated stairwells and smoke detectors/alarms throughout. A speaker system to communicate with the handicapped patrons in the event of a fire alarm would be helpful. Management should know to assist or shelter in place the wheelchair patrons during a fire alarm. Anyway we were there from the 14th through 17th and it was wonderful! Brian is allways super helpful! The fruit basket is great! We had a bad toilet and light fixture and they were both repaired within moments of our call! The beds are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in at any HI (and we have stayed at about 60 different HI's, accumilating a quarter of a million points). We had a southern view room (less sun in the morning) and we accidently slept to about 10 every morning! We had 2 kids with us and they loved it! The pools are great! The food is great at the restaurants! We had a smoking room (we don't smoke, but it was all that was available) but it didn't smell bad at all, in fact, only once in a while there would be a whisp of cigarette smell, but nothing offensive. But, the couch cushions had some stains (yuck) the bathrooms show the heavy use they get, with some problems with caulking, etc., but otherwise very comfortable and RELAXING! The maids were great and very friendly! Bellhops very friendly and helpful, hallways very tidy and clean and cool and comfortable (I HATE warm hallways). We got to check out a little later as PRICLUB members and were very very pleased as usual with this stay. It is a very family (younger kids) oriented hotel and is right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but Pool Hours Ruined Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer711
Reviews.Content: The hotel was an 11 on a scale of 1 to 10 in every regard except one: the children's pool and the hot tub close at 6:00 each day. Everyone we met at the hotel was shocked to learn that they couldn't enjoy the hot tub in the evening hours when the sun isn't beating down. There is no reason it couldn't stay open at least until 8 or 9:00. The kids would also enjoy using the pool a little longer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you hear...”
Reviews.Author: 2008Family4
Reviews.Content: We are originally from the East Coast. My parents used to take the family to Daytona Beach every summer when we were kids. And I used to go to Seaside Heights and Wildwood when I was in High School. My wife used to go to Ocean City when she was growing up. We decided on Ocean City; I didn't know a thing about it.... We don't live anywhere near the Atlantic Ocean. We were forced to make our decision on instinct and believing marketing. We spent countless hours on the Internet. We chose this awful totally misrepresented hole in the wall. The front desk staff were completely unattentive. The room was next to the elevator which was noisy as heck. The vending machines were vandalized. The restaurant was an embarrassment. Items were missing from our room when we returned from the beach. We tried to escalate our concerns to Mgmt but they only offered to find us another Hotel. They could care less if we or anyone else stays. They are making money hand over fist and can afford to lose business... NEVER AGAIN... NEVER EVER AGAIN will I believe what I read on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “10th time's the better!”
Reviews.Author: DFCQ11
Reviews.Content: This is our tenth time at this hotel (not this year.)!It is paradise.Clean Clean and Clean!Although a little pricey.My family loves it!

Reviews.Title: “Love O.C. and this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dontstayathome
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Holiday Inn Suites on 17th Street/Boardwalk! We spent 7 very comfortable nights there recently. This is our 5th year staying here and we have always been very happy. Location is key! I must say though the hotel rooms are starting to show some wear......furniture is marked a little, some loose hinges on the kitchen cabinets, a couple chip marks on the ceramic tiles, etc. Pools are wonderful and the lifeguards are super. There is someone always somewhere cleaning or repairing something....they definately take pride in their hotel. Fresh fruit at the front desk 24 hrs. a day...nice touch. Saw a "free" magic show Saturday evening in the conference room...very cute for kids. Cleaning ladies/gentlemen do a super job each day. Very happy with this hotel and it's employees!

Reviews.Title: “Careful ....”
Reviews.Author: lasoul
Reviews.Content: Be careful ... there are a couple Holiday Inns in Ocean City. I think a few of the reviews were actually for the Holiday Inn, Ocean City which is about 7 miles from the boardwalk area and one was for the Holiday Inn at 17th Street. The Holiday Inn Hotels and Suites Ocean City is located on 67th Street. The boardwalk ends on 27th Street. Beautiful areas, no matter where you stay, but make sure the comment you're reading is actually about particular hotel you're looking into!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lavarlover
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! We absolutely loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to Quality Inn for Undergoing Renovations!”
Reviews.Author: tip
Reviews.Content: We orginally were going to stay at the Quality Inn Boardwalk in Ocean City for five days which we booked a month in advance, When we arrived on the 27th of April the front desk told me that they had left a message on our phone the day before informing us that they would be closing the entire property for a day during the week due to renovatons. The clerk saw the fire in my eyes and realized that we never received that message since we were in Pennyslvania for the previous three days due to our daughter's wedding. "Not to worry" she told us as they had arranged for us to stay at the Holiday Inn next door for the same low rate of $61 for an ocean front balcony room. Needless to say, I was a little wary, but the desk clerk assured us that we would have a terrific room and that the price would be honored. Once we arrived at the Holiday Inn, the clerk told me twice that I was getting a steal. And a steal it was indeed! We had a suite which included a combination sitting room and dining area, a full kitchen including pots, pans, and dishes, a huge bedroom with a jacuzzi, and a balcony overlooking the ocean from the 11th floor and yes, all for the agreed upon price of $61 per night. I should have been wearing a mask! The hotel was spotless. Housekeeping was terrific. We received a newspaper each day and there was always fresh fruit in the lobby. We did not ultize the indoor pool or the restaurant, but they looked terrific. Now of course mid-week, the last week in April and early May is off season, but the Holiday Inn is a first class hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to staying again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunbunny924
Reviews.Content: After leaving another hotel in OC we ended up here and I couldn't have been happier with the friendly, helpful staff and the super clean and very spacious rooms I was thoroughly happy we made the move.. The pools (indoor/outdoor) were wonderful very clean and well maintained. I will definitely be staying here again this year!!

Reviews.Title: “Grammy's Delight”
Reviews.Author: GrammmyYvonne
Reviews.Content: We, my 6 year old grandson & I had a fabulous vacation. This was our 2nd year here and we'll go back each summer till he gets thinking spending time with Grammy is silly. He ADORES the kiddy pool. It is truly spectular!!! I just sit and read my book and relax.. He is in the pool from the time it opens till it closes. We order out food by the pool. Kids eat free when and order is placed with an adult food order. It's great. The luggage boys who greet you are the BEST !! They helped Grammy with my every wish. Parking my car, helping unload, being attentive to my grandson. Great young men. The front desk folks were also great. Food is very good. Some evenings we are beat from sun and fun, so we call room service. They are prompt, courterous, and great food.. We kick back in the air conditioning and watch cartoons and have a delightful meal. Room service is good. Maid service is good. We catch the train in front of the hotel and ride it downtown to the rides and play lands. That is one of our plans. The hotel also provides entertainment for the little ones in the early evening. We never have to get in the car once we arrive. Our every wish is handled by or from the hotel I only have one complaint...the darn fire alarm has gone off both times we stayed there. It is very scarey for the little ones to be drug from their beds, outside, and then trying to get them back to sleep. I will never stay at any other hotel as long as I vacation with my Grandchildren. Love everything about it and the staff. Thanks HOliday Inn on 17th Street...we'll be seeing you in July.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay even in the off season”
Reviews.Author: Maggie2001
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Ocean City and despite some bad weather we had a great time. The hotel staff was wonderful ; especially to children. Many thanks to Tim in the kitchen who was constantly returning things that our kids left in the dining room. Also kids eat free every meal and the meals are all kid friendly. The rooms all have living rooms, kitchens, large bathrooms and ours even had a hot tube in the room. The living room has a large TV and a VCR. A TV is also in the bedroom. It is the perfect set up for having some private time away from the kids. There is a down side to visiting OC in the spring. Many of the attractions weren't open and the outside pools were closed. But we found enough to to do to keep the kids occupied. The indoor pool was clean and we typically had the place to ourselves. We plan to return in September when places will still be open but you don't experience the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: pearlmom2
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel on line and the pictures looked so nice. So I called and made our reservation. The person who took our reservation was very helpful. Check in time is 3pm but my husband and I arrived early and our room was ready so they let us check in early. The lobby of the hotel was very clean and pretty. When we first walked into the room I couldnt believe how nice and spacious it was.The suite is HUGE!! Everything was perfect. It was very clean. The bathroom was huge. If I really wanted to nit pick the ONLY bad thing I could say about this place is that the water pressure in the shower was terrible. Hardly any pressure at all. The bed was a little uncomfortable.That is the only bad things I can say. The hotel bar is nice but a little pricy. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hannasgrace
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Ocean City in November 2007 while in town on business. i was pleasantly surprised with this hotel, as you never know what you'll get when you stay at a Holiday Inn. I did stay during the offseason, but I would consider bringing my family here during the summer. The hotel staff was great. They upgraded my room one of the perks to staying during the offseason), and were very helpful. The room was comfortable- it included a jacuzzi bath, very large bathroom, fully equipped kitchen, bedroom, and living area. The living area included a couch, oversized chair, DVD player, VCR, large table and chairs. There was also a kiddie pool that included a lazy river, splash area, and slides.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: newb85
Reviews.Content: The suite my aunt and I stayed in was very nice! We were up above the kiddie pool though (for the last two days it was open) so it was a little noisy during the daytime, but all was quiet once it shut down for the night. The unfortunate thing is that the hot tub is in the same area as the kiddie pool so that closed as well. The indoor pool is OK. I would not try swimming in it when the kiddie pool is closed because all the kids get out of their pool and come inside. Also, the indoor pool is a little odd since it occupies the same space as the restaurant. When you think about it a restaurant always seems to be cold and an indoor pool area always seems to be hot--so which one do you think wins this argument? Bring lots of towels! (Or use the pool towels the hotel provides.) Also, there aren't any beach chairs provided so bring/buy/rent your own. (Apparently there's a rental place right under the hotel, it just isn't open in the off-season when I was there.) The restaurant is pretty good, I ate one breakfast and one dinner there. And I had a couple drinks from the bar as well. The staff is very nice. My favorite part of our room had to be the porch--it was very nice to sit outside. The jacuzzi bathtub was also very wonderful although it might be hard for the elderly or obese to get in and out of (the shower is in the tub--they're not separate!). I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: boredattheshore
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Nov. 8 & 9. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The facility is one of the cleaniest I have ever stayed in. Didn't have that musty shore smell to it. The staff was always cleaning the hallways, lobby etc. Our rooms were very spacious and well appointed. Fridge, cabinets, tub, carpet nothing looked worn at all. Very well taken care of. The game room and indoor pool were clean and nice. My one complaint would be the indoor pool is literally in the bar area. There is a small gate and a few plastic trees but little privacy. It was great on Thursday b/c it is the off season and pretty empty but the hotel was full Friday night. A very loud group of happy hour guests at 7pm in the bar area pretty much made it inappropriate for my 7 year old to swim in the pool. Plus, there was a live band in the bar and the lead singer used the f word at least twice in 15 minutes. Its nice that the bedroom is in the back of the suite. That way if there is noise in the hallway, you can still sleep peacefully. My parents took my son to the game room and my husband and I had a nice meal in the Coral Reef Restaurant. The island mahi mahi was yummy and the crab soup was excellent. Our server Michael was very nice and provided good service. Nice decor, linen table cloths and cool paintings of Hemingway. The prices were a little less that I would of expected. It was a nice trip. We are glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: klong3
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED our stay at this hotel!! Highly recommend it to anyone. Customer service was top notch and cleanliness of the facility was, too! The housekeeper was terrific and wet-mopped our bathroom floor each day - unheard of! The cost was terrific $79.00/nite + tax/room chg for 3 adults and 1 child. The suite was just immaculate and luxurious. Staff was very accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: stephanie y
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay with kids. The kiddie pool/area was great. I have never seen such a unique outdoor pool! And the indoor pool was very nice as well. The room was very nice - wonderful kitchen and bathroom. The only bad things were a fire drill, a leaky toilet, and the ac in our room not working one night. We still had a very nice time and will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: edgeduller
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the last week of September. The suite was great, the pool was great. Our 2 kids (2 & 1) really enjoyed the outdoor kiddie pool, with its slides and whirlpools. We waited until near the end of our trip to eat at the hotel resturant, and it turned out to be the best one we ate at for breakfast and dinner. The only complaints I have are the bed comforters need to be updated (a little shabby), and the first day our maid didn't get to cleaning our room until about 4:30, when we arrived back from the pool/beach and needed to get showered up. Other than those minor issues, this place was wonderful and I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Shadowlane
Reviews.Content: On July 8 2007, I went online and reserved an oceanfront king room with jacuzzi for September 10 - 13. I have done this twice before. There is no place for special requests on the website, so I called one week before our stay to request a room between the 7th and 14th floor, preferably a corner. This is the same arrangement I have made twice before, and the staff graciously honored that request each time. This time, upon arrival, I was given the option of a corner room on the first floor, or a smaller room on the second floor. Both of these rooms are directly in front of the swimming pools. On the first floor there were people walking around on the patio directly outside the room! Having no other choice, I opted for the 2nd floor, where we endured the screams of children in the kiddie pool until 6:00 pm. We hoped for peace at night, then had to call staff to remove teenagers from the "closed" pool area after dark. After several unsatisfactory conversations with the staff, including the manager on duty, I informed them we would be checking out the next day, since they would not provide us with the room I thought had been booked. I was then told we could not have the room because the people in it decided to stay longer. Last year, we asked to stay longer, and were told we would have to move to another room, which we did. Why did the staff not make these people move to another room??? The staff was completely indifferent to our comfort, and obviously did not value us a customers. The next day, we checked out without getting an apology from anyone, then had to go to the Ocean City department of tourism to find new lodging. We also went on a nighttime beach walk to see if the corner rooms from the 7th to 14th floors were occupied, and it appeared many were not. Two days of our vacation was ruined by the lazy and disrespectful Holiday Inn staff, any of whom could have exerted a little effort to put us into the type of room I rquested. This is a lovely hotel, and I will miss staying there. Too bad the staff seems unhappy, and passes that feeling along to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, except...”
Reviews.Author: Anitsiva
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. We had a great time, the kids loved the pool. It’s in a great spot. Not too close to the hustle and bustle of the boardwalk but within walking distance or you can take the tram. The rooms are nicely laid out, the view was spectacular. One of the best hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. I would have given it 5 stars except that those darn fire alarms seem to be alive and well. At 10pm on Saturday evening the alarm went off. Woke our 3 and 4 year old up. We of course evacuated as requested. We were allowed back into our room about 15 minutes later. Thought that was over until, 8am when the alarm went off again. It’s too bad this seems to keep happening to this hotel. It really is a nuisance. My 3 year old was so afraid that there was going to be a fire the remainder of our trip, he kept asking about it. Overall a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: my2angels
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days at the HI Suites and it wasn't enough. The children loved the pool with all the slides and spent hours on end enjoying it. Yes, as the previous traveler stated there is a problem with people waiting on line two hours prior to pool opening to take the best chairs and tables. I don't know why she had to add the "chubby" people comment .... that's ridiculous and malicous. Anyway... the kiddie pool was very busy, but it's expected during July and August.... if it gets too crowded the beach is just steps away and there is an adult pool as well. The pools opened at 9 and closed at 6. I think that's a bit late to open and early to close, but I figure it's due to the fact that they have pool side rooms. Never waited at the pool side bar... sat my Chubby Ars down in a chair and used the waitress service... yes it was a little slow, but hey your on vacation. Only complaint about the bar service was that the drinks were very weak. When I asked them to spike it up they charged $2.00 on top of the 6$ for another shot. As far as the room goes, everyone is going to have a different experience..... In a large hotel there's going to be some that have a problem. We on the other hand had a lovely King/jacuzzi oceanfront suite. Everything seemed clean. The bed was delightful... linens crisp, great mattress and a lot of fluffy pillows. Our two children slept on the sleeper sofa and said it wa cozy. Loved the fact that they had their own room and their on DVD and TV. Hubby and I enjoyed some privacy while they were busy in the living room. Nice kitchen. Everything you could possible need, even down to a blender. We enjoyed the shower head, but could see how one would not enjoy the fact that you can't adjust it... I think they call it a rainfall head or something. Kids ate free with paying adult at the pool side and in the restaurant. Had breakfast on the last day and it was very good and reasonable. Pool side menu is very reasonably priced and loved that the kids ate free! (I guess they made it up on the drinks LOL). Not crazy about the indoor pool being right next to the open (atrium type) restaurant. I was a little turned off of the smell of chlorine prior to eating. Once your in there you don't notice it any longer. Great for the rainy day we had on Friday. They also have a small game room and they post activities for the children throughout the hotel. If you want a hotel on the boardwalk and it's important to have a nice pool and facilities for the children... this is the best place. I walked up and down that boardwalk and there in nothing that comes close. Now if you don't care to be on the boardwalk then for the same money go to the Hilton ocean front. Last year we stayed at the Park Place which has been rated #2 for the last year or two and were absolutely miserable with that horrible pool. The locating is great (very busy part of the b.w.), the rooms were very small, but clean.
