But when the children have had enough of the beach and want to have fun at a nice pool and you go to that street facing little (not so clean) pool... well it was a drag. So this year we went for the big bucks and you get what you pay for (although all OC hotels are overpriced in season). It killed me to pay $425 a nigth plus tax for a H.I., but it was worth it because it had everything we wanted in a family getaway. If we didn't require the nice pool and only wanted the beach and location then there would be other choices. The Holiday Inn Suites was wonderful. Can't wait for next year. p.s. the Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place but I expected more for the money...”
Reviews.Author: immrn2000
Reviews.Content: ﻿Just back from the Holiday Inn in Ocean City after a brief (and unexpected) stay there. We had originally booked three nites at the Quality Inn Boardwalk next door but found it to be such a dump upon arrival that we walked over begging for a vacancy. The friendly counter clerk claimed she had only one available–a two room suite that was almost 3 times the cost of what we had planned to spend originally. The place was gorgeous though and, after a long day of travel, we decided to stay. Our room was equipped with an older big screen TV in the living area, a complete kitchen, a very cool jacuzzi in the bedroom, a nicely tiled bathroom with a double shower and great views on three sides. I’ve been coming to OC for years and this is by far the nicest place I’ve seen. But...there were some things I did not like. The bathroom shower had these cheap pinpoint shower heads that cannot be adjusted so if youve gotten too much sun, taking a shower can hurt. A recliner in the living room seemed old, worn and hard to operate. When I put my hand down on the inside in search of a control lever, I discovered goop and crumbs that had not been cleaned. The balcony, bed headboards, phone and TV remote also seemed grungy. One TV remote was missing completely and I had to ask for new batteries for the one I had. The soda machine in the vending room was broken. And I found it odd how they put a washer and dryer in the vending room –the dryer kept the place too warm and melted the chocolates dispensed by the candy machine. The indoor pool seemed nice though and was thoughtfully laid out with the Coral Reef restaurant/bar just next to it. Although while we were having dinner there at about 9 pm one evening the pool was full of kids yelling “Marco-Polo” at each other. The outside pools were overly crowded and I watched with disdain from our balcony each morning as chubby people with tattoos would claim entire rows of lounge chairs for their comrades who wouldnt show up until later in the day. Although there were signs asking guests not to do this, nobody on staff challenged the practice. The outside pool bar was chaotic as well. I spent about 10 minutes being completely ignored one afternoon before being able to place an order. While waiting, I couldnt help but to grimace as I watched the cook run his hands along his hair and sweaty neck, get a dirty ladder out from under the counter to stand on, put it back and then proceed to use his bare hands scooping up food to put on plates. I didnt see anyone behind the counter wash their hands the whole time I was there. The food was all pretty good though as OC standards go–just don’t watch it being made.. Our big gripe though was the water coming out of the bathroom ceiling starting on the second day. This seems to be a common problem here. A call down to maintenance before we went to the beach for the day should have resolved it, but we returned later to a bathroom with gunk all over the toilet and floor from an apparent attempted repair...yet the waterfall from the ceiling continued to flow. Fearing it was 'toilet water', I called the front desk at 6pm to report the ongoing flood and was assured that maintenance would be right up....but I did not hear anything until about an hour later when three latina housekeepers came to the door to offer me extra towels. When I asked about the flood, they radioed for help and then explained the maintenance guy was working on the problem at a different location or something...I don’t know.... Anyway, the maintenance guy finally shows up about ½ hour after that and explained that he needed to replace some pipes in the ceiling the next day. Apparently the family on the floor above us had been instructed not to use their shower at all until the repairs were made–and no other rooms were available for anyone to move to. So, the next morning we got up and just decided to go home a day early. I just could not justify spending $450/nite for a room without unfettered access to a clean, working bathroom and did not want to have to relocate elsewhere. Manager Brian was a good guy about it all though...apologized and comped me a nite for the trouble. All in all though, this is a nice place with a good location and a friendly staff. I would really like to see the management be more proactive though at these rates and pay attention to details of maintenance, housekeeping and good customer service. The Quality Inn Boardwalk next door at one point (in the not so distant past) was the gem of the boardwalk but has since been driven into the ground by seemingly uncaring management. The jury is still out on the Holiday Inn though–hopefully the right people will recognize the incredible potential of the place, work out the kinks and have us all not wanting to stay anywhere else. If you can afford it–give it a try. And insist that they deliver a consistent, first-class experience every time.

Reviews.Title: “There is still no other OC hotel like HI Suites”
Reviews.Author: Charlestonnext
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the HI Suites several times over the last couple of years and have found the hotel exceptional in accommodations, location and service. Would consider the Hilton but too far up on 35th. HI located at 17th. An almost perfect location for quieter boardwalk life. The rooms, including the bath, are spacious enough that 4 adults aren't running into each other. The balcony is large enough to seat us comfortably. And what a view. Didn't see any Atlantic Dolphins this visit from the balcony. One thing they could improve on is the water pressure for showers. The hotel, rooms and furniture do appear a little worn. But for us, HI Suites is still the only hotel we would consider staying now or in the future. Parking has never really been an issue with us. Would we prefer to always park under the hotel and out of the sun, why yes, but that is not realistic. Our special thanks to Brian and his staff for giving us another wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest stay, liked it better in the past”
Reviews.Author: august7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a short beach vacation with our 14 month old and my inlaws- we decided to stay at the Holiday Inn, where we had previously enjoyed our stay (albeit in the off season). I was disappointed with the hotel, to put it mildly. We truly enjoyed our time at the beach, and the location of the hotel is unbeatable. However, the amenities were not up to par for a hotel that charges what they charge per night. The day after we arrived, our room on the fourth floor had water all over the bathroom floor. It was leaking from the ceiling whenever the room above was using their shower or bath. We contacted maintanence and they came and worked on the room while we were out. Well, the next day there was more leaking and while I was in the shower, the entire shower curtain bar came down from the ceiling! The water in the ceiling tiles must have made the screws loosen. Maintanence came and fixed the curtain bar, but there was more leaking on our check out day and there was dirt all over the tub from either the leaking or maintanence in the tub to fix it. There was also the parking problem that everyone mentioned- both my inlaws and my family had cars there, and we were originally charged for having more than 2 adults in the room, so we expected to get 2 parking passes. They were not able to give more than 1 pass, so we parked on the street. They did remove the charge for the additional people in the room though, so we were happy with that. The pool area was nice, very crowded in the kids part, but always clean in the morning and the towels were clean and warm. The restaurants were clean and the staff was very nice and helpful, the food was better than I expected it to be. In the end, they did not charge us for one night plus tax because of the bathroom issue, so I am pleased with how the issue was resolved, but I am surprised they aren't keeping up the hotel better than this. If this doesn't improve, in a few years the hotel will deteriorate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay, Great Boardwalk Location, Great Pool, Kitchen, Jacuzzi, View”
Reviews.Author: jjensik11
Reviews.Content: Came here in June of 2006 for a week's vacation with my parents and girlfriend. While I don't remember the exact price we paid, although I do know it was on the pricey side, it was worth every penny. Service was amazing and you could get anything you wanted just by calling the front desk, which for the price is to be expected. Make sure to get an oceanview because the view from the balcony was amazing. We had 2 queen beds in our room, and although they weren't spectacular they were clean and there was a TV there and we hooked up the dvd player from the living room and watched movies at night. The kitchen was outstanding with a full refrigerator, stove, microwave, and dishwasher we saved a lot of money we would have spent eating out. Then there was the bathroom, which was extremely clean, had dual sinks and a jacuzzi included, the jacuzzi was amazing especially after a long day walking the boardwalk. The living room was also very nice with a dining room table a TV with a DVD player sofa and matching sofa chair. As an added bonus high-speed internet is included at no additional cost, which for a weeklong trip is becoming an essential. There are 2 outdoor pools, 1 for kids and 1 for adults, as well as an outdoor hot tub. We only got to go once because of cooler weather. The kids pool is very nice although it is very busy. The adult pool is very simple, but was very uncrowded. Both of the pools overlook the ocean which is right on the otherside of the boardwalk from the Holiday Inn. The Hilton Suites has gotten a lot of good reviews; however the location of the Holiday Inn is a lot better than the Holiday Inn especially when it comes to access to the boardwalk. The Holiday Inn is on a quieter part of the boardwalk then if it was closer to the pier; however it is still close enough that walking to the end isn't out of the question. I would also recommend getting up to ride bikes when it is permitted early in the morning. If you are looking for a hotel for any stay longer than 3 or 4 days, I don't think any Ocean City hotel could compare to the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this year”
Reviews.Author: cu50
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Cruisin' OC with this being our 2nd stay at this Holiday Inn. Not as wonderful as last year. The staff at the front desk had their moments of being helpful to being curt with visitors. This was based on several inquiries at the front desk I overheard. Upon arriving, found the counters in the kitchen dirty with spilled coffee, had to ask daily for towels to accommodate four adults, numerous stains on the bed quilts when turned down (yuk!), and couch was soiled with dark stains. The Coral Reef's food was okay but the service was very, very slow. Their desserts were prettier than they tasted and very pricey. However, the view was great. Take an oceanfront floor from 6th through 12th to get a great view. If you take a lower floor, the pool will obstruct your view. Nice selection of fruit in front lobby but no courtesy coffee or tea. Parking was spacious. The kids loved the indoor and outdoor pools. Plenty of seating around pools. Even though a few problems I will still stay there again hoping for a better stay next time and only because the first stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, as usual”
Reviews.Author: carnesmd
Reviews.Content: I travel to Ocean City at least twice a year, and this is always my hotel of choice. Having learned about the property while attending a business meeting in their conference room, I became an instant fan. The rooms are spacious and great when traveling with a group. Full kitchen, jacuzzi tub, private balcony, large living room with TV/DVD player, and plenty of closet space are a few of the ammenities that make this property comfortable. The location at mid-boardwalk is great for walking north or south on the boards, yet the area is much more quite than the inlet area. The pool side cafe is wonderful - make sure you try the shrimp, mango, avocado salsa! I've never had a problem with staff; they have been nothing less than friendly and efficient. In-season rates are high, but are comparable to many nicer properties in OC.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: smartypants01
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night (May 12th) at the Holiday Inn and Suites Ocean City and had a perfect stay. Our room was spacious and clean. The kitchen area was stocked with coffee and dish soap and the bathroom had the normal shampoo and soap as well as bath salts, mouthwash and more - nice little touches. We discovered as we were leaving that there were free washer and dryers in the vending area on our floor (4th floor). Wish we had found those earlier as we could have used them to dry our swimsuits. We were able to use the indoor pool which we enjoyed. The hotel supplied large towels by the pool and there were nice bathroom/changing rooms near the pool. The outdoor pools were not open yet, as it was still too cold. The outdoor pools look like a lot of fun - especially the kids themed pool with it's slide and water sprayers. We are looking forward to bringing the kids back when it is warmer to take advantage of the pools. The highlight of the hotel (to us) was the awesome ocean view from our balcony. We had an ocean front room and I must say the balconies are huge. They have a full size round glass patio table and four chairs on them, and there is still plenty of open space to walk around. These are not your average balconies - you can easily spend time on them watching the pools and the beach. We had no problems with our stay and would be happy to return. One thing to note is the hotel does charge your credit card for the full deposit immediately when you make the reservation. In our case that was the full charge (tax included) for our one night. We thought this was unusual, as the policy is normally that they only charge you if you cancel without proper advance notice. Just a heads up, though, because it will come through on your credit card immediately and that might be an issue if you weren't expecting it.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to pre-pay just to reserve a room.”
Reviews.Author: cnp21225
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I stayed last weekend, looking for a quick getaway before the crowds descend. Like the previous review, the hotel also charged our credit card when we made the reservation, rather than when we checked out, or at least arrived. More than a week before our anticipated stay, Boyfriend called to cancel - and was told we didn't give enough notice, so we would be charged anyway. He made 2 more attempts to cancel by phone, at least to cancel the second night, and was told the same thing - at one point the woman told him he "should have thought about the timing" when he made the reservation! We ended up going, thinking we would rather go than waste the money, but by the time we drove there I was ready for heads to roll. After a fight the hotel ended up cancelling our second night, but we were told it was a "courtesy" and that the hotel's standard was to charge for at least the first night to ensure they didn't get stuck with the room without time to offer to another customer. Not sure how other hotels in OC handle reservations, but for what it's worth I recommend reading the fine print carefully when you reserve to make sure you don't authorize a pre-check-in charge; if they try to get you for a night and you've tried to give more than 24 hours notice of cancellation, tell them you didn't sign a contract and that you intend to dispute the charge with your credit card company as an unauthorized charge and contact the Better Business Bureau to comlain.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: lisa111
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days starting April 1. We had stayed here twice before and were not disappointed once again. We have a 14 year old daughter who brought a friend. They had a blast, although the weather didn't cooperate. They loved the indoor pool, small game room and cafe area. Of course, being on the boardwalk was a big plus, and it's certainly quieter at this end of the boardwalk. All of the staff were very very helpful, including the manager. They gave us good restaurant recommendations too. The room was great, no problems. The view was wonderful, of course. Everything was clean and in working order. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ColdUpHereHopkinton
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for the last two years. I have just cancelled my reservation for July 2007 due to the unprofessional nature of the hotel's manager. Be very careful when booking. This is a rare case of a hotel debiting your credit card prematurely for the first nights stay rather than reserve the room under your name, which is common practice. The hotel debited my debit card, early March $463.25 for a reservation in July!. When I called the manager to explain, she was very rude and looked at my call as a nuisance rather than an opportunity to help me keep my favorable view of this hotel. Unfortunately, it only takes one bad interaction to change your view, especially when you are paying $465.00 a night or over three thousand dollars for a week. Suffice it to say, my family and I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great price!!”
Reviews.Author: thhtorah
Reviews.Content: Wonderful quiet hotel. the suite I ordered online through their website was only $60 and they upgraded us upon arrival to an oceanfron suite. the suit had a full kitchen and a nice sized living room and bedroom. the bathroom had a real jaccuzi for 2 in it. the staff was great and sent up a pac n play within 2 or 3 minutes of check in (which was VERY fast). loved it and wil be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as usual!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinebiscuit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed Nov. 6th. We only had one more day of vacation left and decided to stay in OC one more night. We had stayed two nights at the Paradise Plaza. It was ok there but having stayed at the Holiday Inn several times before we new how nice it was. Still the best place we have ever stayed. I can't wait to try The Hilton for our anniversary in January.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: MonieB
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I followed the advice of others on this website. This hotel was great. I booked an advance pay southern view room online. We recieved a free upgrade to oceanfront. The suite was very clean. The jacuzzi was great. We loved the free paper everyday and all of the staff at the hotel were very helpful with recommendations for places to eat and things to do. The location was perfect--- right on the beach. The hotel itself was clean and very well cared for. We really lucked out on the weather. We arrived on 10/2 to 70 degree weather. The next two days were in the 80's. Then, it did get chilly, but we will definitely go back again this time next year. If you love sales, this is the time to go. Everything was on sale.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bluedreams1810
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here for our 4 year anniversary in November. We didn't really get a summer vacation and we really needed to get away so we decided to go in November. My sister recommended the hotel because they had booked a 2 night stay and ended up staying 8 nights because they loved it so much. So we decided to give it a try. The hotel was really nice inside and out. It was still kind of busy even tho it was winter. The indoor pool was nice, but a bit chilly for winter. lol. The rooms were nice! they were clean and the jacuzzi tub was awesome!! The room was a really nice size! Had a living room and a kitchen.. which was all neat and tidy. We had a beautiful room. We spent most of our time in the bedroom because of the ocean view. It was such a beautiful view. We were about 6th floor. We slept with our balcony doors open to hear the ocean, but I doubt that would work in the hot summer. haha We did have problems with our heat when we arrived, but we called the front desk and they were up w/i minutes to fix it. The people at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful. We didn't swim in the pool of course, but what we saw of it it looked really nice. I would def. recommend this hotel! We are actually going back again Oct 4-7th 2006. I'm hoping it's not too crowded, but it seems like it's going to be. I enjoyed the peacefulness we got last time when we went in November.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: tina013
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn on 17th Street is a pretty nice hotel. As some of the other write ups stated it does need a few little touch ups. The rooms could use some paint, the balconies could use a good cleaning and the rugs and furnishings could also use a good cleaning. My husband and I just came back from a weeks stay at this hotel. The staff was very pleasent and the maid service was also very good. We did not have any problems with the alarms going off. We stayed on the 12th floor and the view was wonderful!!! Also if you stay at this hotel after Labor Day the price is cut in half. We were very satisfied with this hotel and would definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be updated--run down”
Reviews.Author: krisandtony
Reviews.Content: Went Labor Day weekend-Tuesday. Been here 3 other times. Place is bit rundown. Here are problems: - condom wrapper under bed that i discovered when looking for son's toy. Maid didnt clean well -The bed linens are worn- bedskirt ad drwaings on them from a kid. My kid pointed out " Look at happy faces" -Mold--bathroom was moldy as was kitchen tiles near fridge -Bathroom--rain shower doesnt get out shampoo. I had to fill cups of water from sink to rinse kid's hair Bar/Food-- Was good but service to get drink at pool bar and inside STUNK! One bartender would give kid's meals free, other made you pay if they were eating by pool. Pool- inside pool was plain NASTY!! Hair floating around, looked like scuzzy bathtub shared by many. Needs to be filtered better Outside kiddie pool-- kids love it BUT only 1 life gaurd on duty and he did very little. They changed hot tub rules to 16 and over (Used to be for everyone) Now all Lguards do is police that area instead of drowning kids. The pool sides were scuzzy. Few years ago someone wiped down walls of pool daily. Not anymore. I asked hkeeping for more towels--they said no. Called front desk- They brought some up. People grab tables by pool then sit at beach all day. Very little hotel can do. -Game room-- like a game closet with older games Went to Hilton. Although it isnt on boardwalk, it was gorgeous!! Starbucks inside, good game room with ride on games, clean pool. I think since price is same, I'll head there next time

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: 1momof2kids
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel for families. We had an ocean front view with two queen size beds. This was very comfortable for my husband and two kids ages 2 and 4. There was plenty of room for all of us. The hotel staff was friendly. We did not have any problems with the hotel. There are plenty of places to eat near the hotel. No problem with the free parking. We stayed during the peek holiday season. With 2 young kids we needed a suite. Though it cost us $409 per night ($445 inlcuding taxes). if we go back again we will stay this hotel again. Maybe when my kids get older we will not need a suite, and will find something less expensive. They had some activities planned for kids at the hotel, we did not have time to do them. We had a nice view of the beach and the pool. The view from the 10th floor was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a view...”
Reviews.Author: spontaneoustrip
Reviews.Content: We made a three night trip (August 28-31) to Ocean City. I am so glad we stayed here...We arrived very early--0830 (having left our home early to avoid any traffic) and felt so lucky to be checked right in. There is a fresh fruit basket right at the front desk that seemed bottomless. The queen size beds were very comfortable, the kitchen filled with a good amount of basic necessities (including an initial courtesy amount of dish soap and dishwasher soap), and two TVs. The balcony was very private--and what a view. We had sprung for ocean front view and it was worth every penny. The dolphins entertained us every morning, and the beach and ocean create an awesome view. We experienced no alarms going off. Our room was closest to the elevators and right across from the courtesy laundry machines and we were never bothered by any noises. Although the rooms were cleaned later in the day...who cares? I left notes for the cleaning staff if there was something I wanted special attention for and they always accommodated my requests. I really liked the location---just outside the busiest parts of the boardwalk so the noise level was minimal, but close enough to dart out for many of those tasty boardwalk treats and fun. The pool areas were nice and there were daily activities for the kids. We will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Faulty alarm system!”
Reviews.Author: theatremom
Reviews.Content: All of the comments regarding the alarms sounding in the middle of the night are absolutely true! We stayed at this property this past weekend, and at 2:30 a.m. we were awakened by loud blasts, flashing lights, and a voice over a loudspeaker saying to evacuate the premises. Having read the previous warnings, I must say I was not surprised, but nevertheless, very annoyed. When I asked the front desk manager why this problem keeps happening again and again, she replied, "Oh, someone's smoke alarm went off in one room." She tried to deny that this was a recurring problem. When I said, "Trip Advisor has listed several reviews that mention this problem," she said, "Oh yes, well we have to follow safety rules." I suggested they look into the issue, and she seemed not at all concerned about running a hotel where guests are awakened at 2:30 a.m. Another guest told me when he stayed here a few months ago the same alarms went off twice in one night! He said he was hoping for the best this time, but then muttered, "never again." For the prices this hotel charges they need to address problems like this. Not once did anyone from management offer an apology to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: cinyou
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We had booked a southern view room and were pleased to find out that we were upgraded to a partial ocean view. The room was clean (usually not until late in the day but there was a card in the room that told you it probably wouldn't be cleaned until late afternoon). The beds were comfortable, but the sheets were the so rough and itchy I could hardly stand it. The jacuzzi tub was nice, but what is up with the shower?!? It was a disk mounted to the celing that "rained" down on you, which made for little water pressure. My kids loved the activity pool which was very clean and warm. The location was perfect, everything on the boardwalk was with in walking distance. My only complaint is about the pool side service. We flagged someone down to place an order who told us we were not in her section, but she would send the other girl over. The other girl would start heading toward us and get stopped by someone else and never make it over. About an hour later the first girl walked by , I stopped her again and asked if she could serve us now, she said she couldn't because she was off the clock. However this time she went and got a third girl and brought her too us, both of whom appologized. There needs to be a better system in place so everyone gets served, not only those closest to the bar station!

Reviews.Title: “Big Expense--Lots of Problems”
Reviews.Author: msbart
Reviews.Content: We did a seven night stay. Aug 5-12, 2006. Family of four, 2 kids ages 13 and 15. This was anything but a vacation thanks to this hotel. First of all we only had one remote for two T.V.'s and when we requested another from the front desk personnel they proceeded to fight us and state that the room "was inspected by a manager" prior to our arrival and the remotes were there. Eventually, they gave me another one. The next morning, our safe needed to be opened as the previous renter must have locked it. This too, the front desk personnel stated, "was inspected by a manager" prior to our arrival and it was open. Next is when the hell began. On our second night there at 3:30 in the morning the fire alarms sounded with a siren, strobe lights, and a booming voices screaming for us to evacuate the building immediately. As they dumped all 2000 people onto Atlantic Ave., it was found to be a false alarm. The next day we requested a couple extra bath towels from our housekeeping staff. When our room was done that day we didn't have two extra towels, we had none, NONE...We had to call the front desk to get towels to shower that evening. We never got any so we went to the front desk to get them an hour and a half after calling for them. Next night at 1:30 in the morning, again, we were rammed out of bed due to the fire alarms be set off again with sirens, flashing strobes, and a screaming voice to evacuate immediately. Again for yet another false alarm resulting in 2000 people outside on the boardwalk this time. Next day, again another towel issue and going to the front desk to pick some up. We were on the fourth floor, and our ice machine was out of order and we had only one dryer for laundry. Our room vents were completely packed with dust and mold and the furniture had stains on it. It seemed as though none of the furnishings had been cleaned. The top of the refrigerator was disgusting. Housekeeping was never there before 4:00 in the afternoon and then the beds were hap hazardly made, and we could never get any dish towels not to mention bath towels. The balcony table was filthy and the screen door could not be used as it did not fit in the track properly. Parking was also a nightmare. This was a real disappointment considering this is one of the most expensive hotels in Ocean City. The fire alarm thing was extremely disturbing, especially to children. It made for sleepless nights, every night. People with small children had to deal with the terror these kids felt and it was un-called for. Also, we found out that these alarms sounded "twice" at 2:00 and 4:00 in the morning on the night prior to our arrival. I won't ever make a mistake of staying at a Harrison Group hotel again. I have been going to Ocean City for 45 years and have never had such a bad experience. There are alot of hotels in Ocean City and this proves that you don't always get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but have been in a lot better hotels for the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: PhillySunshine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, but considering all the "wonderful" reviews on this website, I expected a lot more - a whole lot more. My children are 9 and 11 and though they did use the activity pool during our stay, it's not something that they raved about - my daughter actually stated at one point it was really dirty with murky water, stuff floating in it (probably from swim diapers) and lots and lots of sand (there is a hose to hose yourself off, but obviously it's not used enough). There were adults using the equipment, without children and actually butting in front of lines (this type of behavior is no reflection on the hotel, but inconsiderate and obnoxious people in general). We found it quite rude how people actually stood in line waiting for the activity pool area to open, just so they could set up their towels and leave; one family set up towels in both pool areas and then did not come back to the adult pool until 3:00 in the afternoon, when the other pool looses all sun - outrageous that the management allows this type of behavior. The sample products (shampoo, lotion, etc.) were abundant and the room was generally clean, but showing some where (stains on sofa, screen patio door was ripped and extremely hard to open and dried "gunk - which was either spit or food" on the patio table. At $409 a night I really expected a lot more - there should have been entertainment by the adult pool (the guy that sings in the lounge at dinner and after, would have been wonderful). A magician walks around during the dinner hour for the kids activities - for the price there should be more offered. The food at the outdoor bar, was very good, but the restaurant was pricey - my husband's steak was market price at 32.99 - outrageous! All in all a nice hotel, but most definetely not worth the money. I think back to our vacation last year in Myrtle Beach - Sea Watch and we paid less than half what this hotel was - and got a lot more bang for our buck - and nicer memories too.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families w/kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 days (July 1-8). This hotel is a true gem! The room was very clean and well maintained throughout our stay. We stayed on the 10th floor and the ocean view was spectacular. Each balcony is private so you felt as if you were not in a hotel with 210 rooms!! With 2 adults, 2 teenagers and 2 under twelve, there was ample room for all, though we required extra bath linen each day. Staff was courteous and helpful. An added bonus: complimentary laundry machines on most floors and free postage to send post cards at the front desk. The real deal sealer is the pool area w its kiddie pool and poolside beverage and snack service. While the kids enjoyed the really neat whirlpool, lazy river and slide, you can place an order for smoothies and such without taking your eyes off the kids. We will be back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in on the Monday before Mothers day and knew immediately we wanted to stay longer then our original Friday check out. Service was so great the let us have the weekend for the same rate we paid during the week.... wow saved us 250.00. The cafe was great to eat at with good service. Next time I go to O.C I will be sure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good with a few excepts!”
Reviews.Author: NomoreJamacia
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Ocean city Maryland at the Holiday Inn Suites. This was our second year. The hotel is very clean, and the staff is very helpful and give good service. The only thing this place needs to do is get new mattress for their pull out sofas, they are paper thin, and very uncomfortable. My children had to put the cushions from the sofa under the matress to get some comfort. If you are planning to have someone sleep on this bring something to help for comfort. You cant get a good night sleep on this paper mattress. Our maid Luppe give us wonderful service all week.

Reviews.Title: “All of the Good Staff Sent down to the Hilton?”
Reviews.Author: traveling81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites last year, and it was one of the best hotel experiances we have ever had. Such as the case, we booked it for cruise weekend in May. Much to are dismay, our room that we were paying over $240 a night for(off season rates) was beyond disgusting! There was sode all over the walls and ceilings in the kitchen, the plates and all in the kitchen were dirty, the furniture looked a bit more tattered than I remember, and worst of all, there was a "bodily fluid" stain on the bed ruffle that was completly digusting. We complained, and they still made us spend the night in the room after removing the offending bed ruffle. The next day, they informed us that they had taken $30 off our bill to compensate (wow way to extend yourself). I really got the impression that they had sent all the good staff down the street to the Hilton that was opening, and left the B-Team for this weekend. All in all, though (next to the Hilton), this is by far the best place to stay in OC. My only other real gripe is that the indoor pool is right in the middle of a cafe/bar area...which make swimming kinda akward.

Reviews.Title: “Another Nice Stay... Great Service... Rooms Could Use a Little Updating”
Reviews.Author: Melb33
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Holiday Inn Suites in Ocean City, Maryland. We booked our room a year in advance, after having enjoyed a wonderful stay in June 2005. Once again, service at this hotel was very good. From the friendly girls at the front desk to the wonderful waitress who served us a great breakfast, to Lupe, our cheerful and helpful housekeeper, we were treated exceptionally well the entire week. Our room was always cleaned early in the day so that we were able to have lunch in our room on a day when the rain chased us in from the beach. The pools at the hotel are wonderful! Always clean and in good condition. The fresh fruit at the front desk always plentiful. We made good use of the hotel's free washers and dryers so that dirty laundry (especially beach towels) was not an issue when we got home. My only slight complaints are as follows: The mattress on the sofabed was extremely thin and uncomfortable. The door to our bedroom had no stop on it and each time the balcony door was open, the bedroom door slammed shut. Overall this is still, by far, the nicest hotel on the boardwalk. A few maintenance details in the room should not stop you from booking your stay here, especially once you walk the boardwalk and see, for yourself, the other places which in no way compare to this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best in OC for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night @ this hotel - it was booked for the time we needed it. Perfect view of the ocean. The pool is wonderful and adequate for children - it is not only big but also fun. Staff - friendly - some. The first place I always go is the bathroom to ck for mold - no trace! Highly recommended. Washer and drier free on each floor. Request 3rd floor or above for minimal noise from boardwalk and pool. Bring plenty of H2O and fruits - Phillips - best restaurant - try the crab bisque $4.99 - with the complimentary bread and a house salad ( huge) $2.99 makes a perfect meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: PATraveler28
Reviews.Content: I am extremely fussy when it comes to hotels. I never sleep on hotel pillows or use the blankets...and never walk barefoot. Yes, a little extreme, I know. However, at the Holiday Inn I was completely at ease. Our room was very nice...very clean and the staff was very courteous. My husband, son and I had a terrific long weekend thanks to Holiday Inn's high standards!

Reviews.Title: “Our Room Wasn't that great”
Reviews.Author: pocopicketNewYork
Reviews.Content: Well when I walked into our room found that the bedskirt was torn and battered so picked it up to find someone else hair brush under the bed skit. The pots and pans in the kitchen were filty and the furnishing need cleaning and re-painting. For the price that you pay they could at least press the sheets when you turn down a bed that has wrinkled sheets what do you think??

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ymitchell
Reviews.Content: Went to Ocean City in April 2006 and finally stayed at the Holliday Inn Hotel & Suites (which is always booked during the summer months). We had the 1 bedroom, ocean front suite w/private balcony and jacuzzi. What an excellent room and very clean! The 3-head shower was to die for....what a nice massage. I've been going to Ocean City for about 7 years now and have stayed at numerous hotels on the "strip" and this hotel is now #1 on my list. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel on the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Kkleopatrajones
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff best hotel on the beach and the suites are sooooo great. My family and I really enjoyed the room and the beach view was great but because it was May it was too cold to enjoy it in person.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. A true suite. Kitchen, separate room for parents.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good beach. Pizza, etc nearby. CVS across the street. Parking fills up fast and you may have to park across the street - no big deal though - 60 sec. walk. Tram will stop in front of hotel. Very good pool for kids with slide, vortex pool, etc. Another pool for laps next to it. Heated pool inside. All very clean. Breakfast at their restaurant was pretty good and never a wait. Easy access to Coastal Highway. Room was very clean and had all amenities. Try to get at least floor 3 and up for quietness if you are on the oceanfront side. Free broadband access in the room. Bring ethernet cord with your computer. Overall, a very pleasant stay. I would go back here on next trip with kids. Suite might be overkill for just a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Look no place else.”
Reviews.Author: Patrck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel on a regular basis for pleasure. The minute we walked into this Holiday Inn & Suites we were very impressed. The rooms are very large, living rooms with DVD players, full kitchens, and large bedrooms with a two person jacuzzi. Bathrooms were very spacious with large walk in showers,(rain fall showerhead). Let me assure you all, Holiday Day Inn & Suites have "rasied the bar" with this one. In my opinion they were flawless. Perfect for romance, great for a family! We only intended to stay for two days, stayed four, why? Well with a notice not a bill under our door saying we could extent our stay for 50% less the already reasonable rate we recieved. I'm still blown away with that gesture, a corporate company giving me a break! Thank You (Hoiday Inn Staff) you were excellent in our eye's, simply flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful hotel experience we've ever had !!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2GoPlaces08
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a weekend stay at the Holiday Inn Suites on 17th Street in Ocean City. This is our second stay at this hotel within the past month. We like to take little mini-vacations in the wintertime to beat the winter blues. Ocean City is usually our pick because of the close distance. This is now our family's favorite hotel in O.C. At least during off-season. We usually rent a condo in the summertime, as most hotels are extremely expensive. We used to frequently stay at the Nassau in the Oceanfront building. Since the Nassau is no longer there, we decided to try the newer Holiday Inn because we had admired it from the outside. We fell in love with it! The kids love it too! There is a wonderful indoor pool and bar in the pool area (the kids enjoyed swimming, while my husband watched games at the bar enjoying a drink). Mom could take advantage of some quite time enjoying the jacuzzi tub bath. It was heavenly!! The rooms are very clean and decorated so nicely. The room service was excellent, the food was excellent, the staff was excellent, and I could go on and on.... One other nice feature was that in the vending area on each floor, there were a washer and dryer which the guests are free to use (providing our own detergent of course). Since most places have coin-operating laundry, I thought this was very convenient! They also have a great exercise room as well as a little arcade. It's a great off-season place!! Also, there is a VCR PLUS a DVD in each suite. Kids brought tapes, mom and dad brought DVD's. It was an awesome hotel!! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the third year we have stayed at this hotel. The rooms are clean, the size is wonderful. We are a family of four and my family enjoys bringing extras with them yet we don't feel crowded into the room. The hotel provides wonderful extras of their own. There is always lots of little bath items in the room. There is a basket of fresh fruit in the lobby. There is a secure location to lock up your bike if you decided to bring your own (you can rent them if you don't want to go through the hassle of bringing them yourself.) The balcony is wonderful and private. It is big enough that a family of four can enjoy a meal out there. There is plenty to do. We like going to Assateague island and seeing the wild horses. The pools at the hotel are a godsend for a mother of two little boys. They play for ours in the kids pool that has slides and other activities. That gives me some downtime to read and relax. This is the ultimate family resort and this hotel is wonderful place to stay. We go after labor day when the weather is good but the rates are less, however it is well worth every penny. The only item that I would change in the hotel is that they should put in wireless computer access. Being used to broadband, waiting for a dial up to load is sometimes frustrating but that is such a minor item it is only mentioned here as an afterthought. The staff is always polite and helpful and you can't help but feeling like a queen after a week in this palatial location!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else again”
Reviews.Author: flattop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn on 17th st and boardwalk. All i can say is this hotel is awesome.The front desk is very helpful, the rooms are the nicest I've stayed in. Our room had 2 queen beds,large tv with dvd player,desk,balconey with furniture,large bathroom with double sinks,large jacuzzi tube w/shower, full size kitchen appliances ie fridge,stove,dishwasher,microwave sink then also has a living room with a couch, lounge chair, another tv w/ tape player and dinette table. Granted we couldn't use the outdoor pools but the looked pretty cool--fake palm trees around and in the pool,a slide and a jungle gym in the pool for kids to climb on.They have a gym, indoor pool, restaurant and bar. We even got a newspaper every morning--nice touch. We are going to try to make excuses now to go back to OC and stay at this great hotel-- off season prices are low and affordable--only ran $119.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptionally nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Toofaraway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites, Ocean City, on October 30, 2005. The area where the hotel is located is very convenient to the general area. The hotel is very well-kept, and the suites are large, clean, and well-furnished. We had a large balcony with an outstanding ocean view. Although we were there on off season, the rate was extremely reasonable. I understand that previous reviews have noted that in high season, it is expensive.The food in the restaurant was good. The area around the hotel was well kept and attractive. We would definitely return ([probably not in high season, though).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and loved this place and can't wait to come back someday. The staff was very professional and courteous. When we checked in, they gave us a really nice bottle of champange since it was our honeymoon. The room was awesome, nice hot tub, 3 headed shower, very nice accomodations. We have highly recommended this hotel to all of our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This motel is above average, its cost is a little more than some of the others but its worth it if you prefer staying in a quality motel. Very comfortable and the restaurant and pools were great. Another thing I liked was the fact that there was a parking garage, it was nice not having to load my vehicle and not have to do it in the rain!

Reviews.Title: “My Mouth Watered”
Reviews.Author: OCFanatic
Reviews.Content: I will be returning to Ocean City because of this hotel. It was like being at a private resort in the Carribean. The staff takes care of you and you only when you need them and they are so very pleasant. Each staff member we encounted is a true asset to the Holiday Inn. Our room was big and spacious and extremely clean and well furnished. Even the pull-out sofa was very comfortable. We got maid service in the afternoon and you would think that our room was the only room she cleaned and straightened for that day because she took such special care in doing her job. The amenities are very plentiful. You could walk out of the front of the hotel and either lounge in the kid pool with 2 water slides and a lazy river or lounge in the adult pool on the other side of the front of the hotel or walk down a flight of steps and take a stroll on the boardwalk, catch the tram or walk to the guarded beach straight ahead. If you are looking to take a honeymoon, a second honeymoom or just a vacation with the family, this is the place to stay. We've stayed at the fancier hotels all over the U.S. the past few years and by far this one out does them all. I still get goosebumps when I think of how beautiful and relaxing this hotel was and how gracious the staff was our entire stay. Thank you Holiday Inn for a memorable and breathtaking vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect for the category”
Reviews.Author: vacationer71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a standout, for many of the reasons cited in earlier reviews which I won't relist. I recommend it wholeheartedly. With minor improvements -- most of which are in any event necessary -- the owners could easily flag the property a Hilton or Westin, and really distinguish it in the Ocean City lineup. However, I can't give the hotel 5 stars until it makes those minor improvements. Most are merited by the high rates charged, and the balance I'd gladly pay for in a $25 or $50 higher rate, to get the 5 star experience that I want for the very little time I can get away with my family every year. First, the arrival experience and parking services needs to be upgraded. I expect a property at this level to offer a doorman, a bellman, and valet parking. With the exception of bellman on-call (i.e., not available as you pull up), the property offers none of these services. The problem is compounded by the fact that the lobby is a flight up from the port cochere, leaving a first-time arrival parked in front of the door, warning lights blinking, with no clear idea of where to go and no one to help him. (Not just me, either ... the three people to pull up after me all seemed to have the same perplexity.) Second, the breakfast was only the standard Holiday Inn bill of fare. This is totally unacceptable, as that menu is very limited in choices, low-end in terms of cuisine, and appears to use (sub)standardized ingredients provided by Sysco or some other restaurant mass wholesaler. A great hotel breakfast is a key piece of the upscale travel experience -- this property has no trouble putting on a good lunch and dinner, so they really should be able to offer a first rate breakfast, including both more healthier options and more indulgent options. For now, a guest has more and tastier options at the Denny's-type greasy spoon two blocks in from the beach than one has at the hotel dining room, and that's not right. Third, breakfast and lunch were understaffed upon our mid-week arrival and got worse into the weekend. The servers were pleasant and efficient, but simply had too many tables to cover. Fourth, there are a few signs of cheapness in the amenities which ought to be done away with. The pools are VERY overchlorinated; a real issue when your kids want to spend six hours a day in the pool. It saves management a few dollars (less filtration and cleaning, less fresh water added, and less testing) but it is definitely not worth it from the standpoint of a guest. And while chlorine leaves a literal bad taste in one's mouth, the gameroom pricing does so figuratively -- $1.00 to play Pacman, forthsooth! The bath towels are undersized and no bathrobes are provided; big towels and bathrobes complement the inroom jacuzzi nicely. After the above suggestions, I do want to note a nice little thing done right, not necessarily noted by commentators below: the hotel provides a full expanded basic cable lineup (the local Comcast analog tier, plus HBO). This is SO VERY welcome -- one of my abiding frustrations with travel is how hotels will spend millions on frills of little consequence, but will not spring for the 5 cents per guest per day it costs to put FX, TBS, USA, Nickolodeon, the Cartoon Channel, and Sci-Fi Channel on the television.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn Suites on 17th st”
Reviews.Author: dreamcycle
Reviews.Content: Just back from our stay., we stayed (1) night, on the top floor (14th), only like 10 rooms on that floor. Room was beautiful, like in previous notes, large living rm with queen size sofa pullout with its own tv, vcr, celing fan, 4 person dining table, than you go through archway to the kitchen, looked like all brand new appliances, full size stove, microwave, dishwasher and all the pots/pans and utencils, coffee maker, can opener and even a phone over the stove, than you go through another private door to the bedrm, we got the 2 queen beds, also another tv, vcr etc, another phone, and the bathrm was terrific, a 2 person jacuzzi tub, double sinks and plenty of bath stuff, soaps, shampoo etc, and yet another phone, hairdryer etc., ours had a large balcony, closed on both sides for privacy and looked right onto the ocean. A little pricey for off season- $209 but for 1 night was well worth it. They have a nice independant restaurant/bar/grill on the property, caribbean style, palm trees, island music etc and was very good, there is also an indoor pool right in the restaurant ! THere is also 2 outdoor pools and another nice bar/grill ! Staff was wonderful and helpful at all times !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend stay at this hotel, and could not be more impressed. The room was spacious, in-room amenities were great, and the entire hotel staff friendly and accommodating. The Coral Reef restaurant on premise was suprisingly very good.

Reviews.Title: “Second Trip to Holiday Inn and Still Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in this hotel for the second year in a row in July. This is still the BEST hotel in Ocean City. The room was very large, neat, clean and the full size kitchen with full size oven/range, refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher with all cooking utensils, dishware and flatware are the best. The cost of the hotel is high during the summer months, but what is spent for in accomodations is made up in the ocean views from the balcony and cooking every meal in the room rather than eating out. The kiddie pool does get very crowded, but since both my kids swim very well, they practically lived in the adult pool anyway, which was not crowded at all and only had a few sunbathers. My only regret was that we couldn't stay longer. I've already booked again next year which will be our 3rd vacation in a row to this great hotel. You can't go wrong staying here-- just book early and save your pennies cause it aint cheap...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Ocean City after one week stay. Hotel was everything we hoped for. Clean with good service. The gym was nice as were the three pools. Right in the heart of the boardwalk close to bicycle rental. Towel exchanges were easy. Bring chairs for the beach although you can rent chairs and umbrellas by the day or week. Room was nice size with full refrigerator, stove, microwave and small 4 cup coffee pot. View from the bedroom was perfect. Beds in bedroom were comfortable with lots of pillows. Pull out sofa bed in living room was ok. Jacuzzi tub in bathroom was nice and room is equipped with high speed internet access (front desk has cables). There was a DVD player in living room and Video Player in bedroom. Average price for the week including tax was about $325 per night, but we would definitely stay there again. Hotel activities were limited, but surrounding area has plenty to do. Also a Dunkin Donuts about 2 blocks away and local convenience stores. Looking forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Coming Back Next Year”
Reviews.Author: malhgold
Reviews.Content: I am sitting here on my last night of vacation thinking that this is one of the best family vacations we've had and we've been to Disney World, the Disney Cruise and Atlantis. The hotel room was nice and clean and the staff was incredibly pleasant and helpful. They were always happy to help in anyway, from a band aid, to a tape measure to locating a remote control for the TV in the Fitness Center. The kids pool was great and kept my children (6 and 9) entertained all day long. Ease access to the beach as well. Loved the fresh fruit available all day long at the front desk. Free kids meals helped out quite a bit as you can imagine. Housekeeping was very quick to help out with any requests. Even the other guests that were vacationing there were very pleasant, happy to make suggestions of things to do and places to eat(or not). Overall, I would say this is a great place to stay for a summer vacation. Last week in August is slightly cheaper and not as busy as peak summer as many schools have already started. Can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lpro13
Reviews.Content: This was my family's second time to Ocean City, but our first in a top-notch hotel! I've been traveling for 30 years, and this was one of my best hotel experiences to date. Everything was fabulous, from the activity pool (best I've seen anywhere) to the "kids eat free". The little touches were also terrific. Fruit in the lobby day and night, full sized pool towels, bath salts for the jacuzzi! I can't say enough. My kids (4 and 11) thoroughly enjoyed themselves and being on the boardwalk was terrific. we loved our suite, the bathroom and toilitries ! Nivea mens moisturizer and eye make-up remover! UNBELIEVABLE. For a vacation in OC reminiscent of being on an island try the Holiday Inn.. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryG2222
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, very modern hotel with many amenities. The 3 pools were clean and the water very warm. The poolside service was exceptional. Getting to the beach was a matter going down maybe 15 steps and the beach area had life gaurds. The room was exceptionally large, even the balcony was a good size. The location was perfect. You won't find a nicer hotel on the boardwalk. The one and only downfall was restuarant due to the excetionally long wait to get breakfast. Other than that the place was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: deadheadted
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Holiday Inn Hotels & suites in Ocean City. Yes, the price for a peak season ocean view room is close to $380.00 per night !, but you could not find a cleaner more profesionally run facility on the boardwalk. Our suite was cleaned everyday before 10:30am, this is after we left the room around 9:15 am. Friendly & professional staff from the conciege "Joe" to waitstaff "Lauren". The price is worth it when you consider the fact that every thing from the kidde pool to adult side pool bar are effciently operated with no sign of confusion. Additionally the Hotel Restaurant prepares above average food and for those who do not want an "all you can eat" option, it is worth the chance to visit the restaurant. The only glitchs are really the result of popularity, i.e. the crowding at the kiddie pool, especially the habit of some guests of "reserving" poolside lounges, at 9:00 am and then spending the next 5 hours at the beach! Anyhow, this seeems to be more of an guest rudeness issue not as a hotel operational defect. Recommend this for the central location (17th Street ) close enough to walk down to the "action " but far enough away to not have to participate if you choose. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for anytime!”
Reviews.Author: N8tvcalifgirl
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this kind of late. I had to post it though! My new husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon week. Despite some comments I read about Ocean City not being a typical honeymoon site, we decided to go anyway. This hotel was the perfect choice! Your honeymoon is what you make of it. If you like to have fun and want some nightlife as well, then this is a great place for it. This hotel was both romantic and practical. It has a great restaurant downstairs, a great view and every room has a big jacuzzi tub. We have kids and this would be a great place to bring a family as well. It has a full kitchen including a full size refrigerator and dishwasher! The staff was wonderful and we just had a great time! I can't say enough about how good our stay was! We will return! I have to say the best time to go is before the summer rush; we were there the week before Memorial Day and we left the weekend of. It was a perfect time because we got the before Summer rates, it was quiet at the fun center's, and nice crowds at the nightclubs, plus we got to party the last night with the incoming crowd.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Hotels and Suites Ocean City
HotelInfo.Address: 1701 Baltimore Ave, Ocean City, MD 21842
